analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs can zhig yin no /
translated: or if he is of the Great Vehicle type,

original: gtam des shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / kun tu dga' ba skye ba dang / @129b yid bde ba skye ba dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtam des shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / kun tu dga' ba skye ba dang / @129b yid bde ba skye ba dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he will not be very pleased, delighted, and overjoyed, and he will not feel faith and confidence.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs can gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs can gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Now, the one who is of the Great Vehicle type,

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i gtam byas pa na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i gtam byas pa na /
translated: when a discourse on the Great Vehicle is given,

original: gtam des shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / kun du dga' ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtam des shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / kun du dga' ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes very happy, delighted, and joyful, and he experiences mental pleasure, faith, and interest.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case for those of the Å›rÄvaka or pratyekabuddha type.

original: gal te de dbang po rtul po zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dbang po rtul po zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is of dull faculties,

original: gsal ba'i gtam byas na yang /
analyzed: gsal ba'i gtam byas na yang /
translated: even if he is given clear explanations,

original: chos kyi don nye bar brtag pa dang / gzung ba dang / so sor rtog par bya ba la shin tu mong rtul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi don nye bar brtag pa dang / gzung ba dang / so sor rtog par bya ba la shin tu mong rtul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be very slow in examining, retaining, and discerning the meaning of the teaching.

original: gal te dbang po 'bring zhig yin na ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po 'bring zhig yin na ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But if he is of middling faculties, this will not be the case.

original: gal te dbang po rnon po zhig yin na ni /ğŸ”½dbang po rtul po la gsal ba'i gtam byas pa las bzlog pa /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnon po zhig yin na ni / dbang po rtul po la gsal ba'i gtam byas pa las bzlog pa /
translated: If he is of sharp faculties,ğŸ”½then the opposite of what happens to those of dull faculties will occur.

original: zab mo'i gtam byas na yang /
analyzed: zab mo'i gtam byas na yang /
translated: Even if he is given profound explanations,

original: chos kyi don myur du nye bar rtogs pa dang / gzung ba dang / so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi don myur du nye bar rtogs pa dang / gzung ba dang / so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: he will quickly examine, retain, and discern the meaning of the teaching.

original: gal te de 'dod chags spyad ba zhig yin na ni /ğŸ”½dang bar 'gyur ba'i gtam byas pa na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dod chags spyad ba zhig yin na ni / dang bar 'gyur ba'i gtam byas pa na /
translated: If he is a person who practices desire,ğŸ”½when he is spoken to with words that arouse desire,ğŸ”½he shows a very clear and distinct

original: gtam des shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'khrug ces byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud snum pa dang sems 'jam pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: gtam des shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'khrug ces byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud snum pa dang sems 'jam pa ston par byed do //
translated: faith, joy, and delight, and his body hair stands on end, tears flow, his mind is clear, and his mind is gentle.

original: gal te de zhe sdang spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de zhe sdang spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices hatred,

original: de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the opposite occurs.

original: gal te de gti mug spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de gti mug spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices delusion,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i gtam mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i gtam mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa /
translated: when he is spoken to with words that distinguish the path to liberation and lead to nirvana,

original: zang zing med par byas pa na /
analyzed: zang zing med par byas pa na /
translated: without any material reward,

original: skrag pa dang ; dngang ba dang / kun du skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skrag pa dang ; dngang ba dang / kun du skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes frightened, terrified, and scared.

original: ji ltar dbang po rtul po bstan pa de bzhin du de yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po rtul po bstan pa de bzhin du de yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the faculties of a person of dull faculties are taught, so should his be understood.

original: gal te de nga rgyal spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de nga rgyal spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices pride,

original: shin tu gus pas nyan par mi byed cing rna gtod par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: shin tu gus pas nyan par mi byed cing rna gtod par yang mi byed la /
translated: He does not listen with great respect, nor does he pay attention.

original: de bzhin du kun shes par bya ba'i sems nye bar 'jog par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun shes par bya ba'i sems nye bar 'jog par mi byed cing /
translated: He does not set his mind on understanding.

original: dad par gyur na yang de bzhin du bsnyen bkur dang / legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed do //
analyzed: dad par gyur na yang de bzhin du bsnyen bkur dang / legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed do //
translated: Even if he has faith, he does not give his approval or show his appreciation.

original: gal te de rnam par rtog pa spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de rnam par rtog pa spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices with concepts,

original: legs par rna blags te /
analyzed: legs par rna blags te /
translated: he listens with his ears wide open,

original: nyan par byed kyang sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur zhing log par bzung ste /
analyzed: nyan par byed kyang sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur zhing log par bzung ste /
translated: but his mind is distracted and he grasps the wrong meaning.

original: 'dzin par @130a * //
analyzed: 'dzin par @130a * //
translated: He grasps it

original: yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang 'gyur la /
translated: incorrectly.

original: mi brtan zhing mi dam par 'dzin par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: mi brtan zhing mi dam par 'dzin par yang 'gyur /
translated: He grasps it without stability or firmness.

original: bzung na yang chud za bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bzung na yang chud za bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even if he grasps it, he loses it.

original: yang dang yang du phyi phyir yongs su 'dri bar byed par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyi phyir yongs su 'dri bar byed par yang 'gyur te /
translated: He asks questions again and again.

original: de ltar gtam gyis rigs dang / dbang po dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtam gyis rigs dang / dbang po dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should examine the personâ€™s family, faculties, and practice through conversation.

original: ji ltar na spyod pas rigs dang dbang po dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod pas rigs dang dbang po dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: How does one examine the spiritual gene, faculties, and practice by means of conduct?

original: gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dpyad pa dag gi rtags gang dag sngar bstan pa de dag ni spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dpyad pa dag gi rtags gang dag sngar bstan pa de dag ni spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those signs of the spiritual gene of the disciple and of the predominance of passion, etc., which were previously mentioned, are called â€œconduct.â€

original: spyod pa des rigs dang ; dbang po dang / spyad pa dag ci rigs par legs par rjes su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa des rigs dang ; dbang po dang / spyad pa dag ci rigs par legs par rjes su brtag par bya'o //
translated: By that conduct, one examines the spiritual gene, faculties, and practice, as appropriate.

original: de la ji ltar na sems kyi rnam grangs shes pas rigs dang / dbang bo dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sems kyi rnam grangs shes pas rigs dang / dbang bo dang / spyad pa dag legs par rjes su brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: How does one examine the spiritual gene, faculties, and practice by means of knowledge of the variety of beliefs?

original: gal te rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor shes pa de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa thob pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor shes pa de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa thob pa zhig yin na /
translated: If the yogin, who is skilled in yoga, has attained knowledge of the variety of beliefs,

original: des pha rol gyi sems bya'o //
analyzed: des pha rol gyi sems bya'o //
translated: he should examine the mind of another.

original: de de lta nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par chos pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas legs par rjes su brtag bar bya'o //
analyzed: de de lta nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par chos pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas legs par rjes su brtag bar bya'o //
translated: He should thoroughly investigate the four bases of spiritual power in accordance with the way things are, by knowing them as they really are, as conducive to the degeneration of those .

original: gnas bzhi po de dag rgyu bzhi po de dag rgyu bzhi po de dag gis legs par rjes su brtags na ;
analyzed: gnas bzhi po de dag rgyu bzhi po de dag rgyu bzhi po de dag gis legs par rjes su brtags na ;
translated: When he has thoroughly investigated those four bases of spiritual power in accordance with the way things are, by knowing them as they really are, as conducive to the degeneration of those ,

original: gnas lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: he should apply himself to the five bases:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / yid la byed pa bsgom pa dag la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / yid la byed pa bsgom pa dag la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the protection and cultivation of the requisites for meditative concentration, solitude, one-pointedness of mind, the purification of obscurations, and the cultivation of mental attention.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ji snyed pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ji snyed pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the protection and cultivation of the requisites for meditative concentration is the possession of the entire restraint of morality.

original: de la yang sangs rgyas kyis rjes su bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: de la yang sangs rgyas kyis rjes su bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: Therein, the morality is the complete morality-aggregate, which is taught by the Buddha and approved by the Buddha.

original: yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to not degenerate that,

original: bag yod par gnas shing bslab pa'i gzhi bsgrubs pas brtson 'grus mi gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: bag yod par gnas shing bslab pa'i gzhi bsgrubs pas brtson 'grus mi gtong ba yin te /
translated: they are heedful, they practice the basis of training, and they do not give up striving.

original: de lta na yang de tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pa'i bslab pa'i lam thob pa las yongs su mi nyams shing /
analyzed: de lta na yang de tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pa'i bslab pa'i lam thob pa las yongs su mi nyams shing /
translated: In that way, they do not degenerate from the path of training that is endowed with morality.ğŸ”½They also attain the path of training that they have not attained.

original: bslab pa'i lam thob pa yang thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po sdom pa dang / @130b zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang /
analyzed: bslab pa'i lam thob pa yang thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po sdom pa dang / @130b zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang /
translated: Just as with the vows of morality, they also guard the senses, know the proper amount of food, are diligent in the practice of the first and last periods of the night,

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan gyi bar la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan gyi bar la yang de bzhin te /
translated: are mindful in their conduct, and so on up to being adorned with the ornaments of a monk.

original: chogs kyis yongs su zin pa gang dang gang yin pa'i chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba dag thob pa dang / de dag rjes su srung bar byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir zhing yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /ğŸ”½ji skad gsungs pa bzhin lhag chad med par spyad par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: chogs kyis yongs su zin pa gang dang gang yin pa'i chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba dag thob pa dang / de dag rjes su srung bar byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir zhing yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / ji skad gsungs pa bzhin lhag chad med par spyad par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: Whatever Dharma teachings they have received that are embraced by the collections, they maintain them, they perfect the field of their analysis,

original: spro ba skyed de /
analyzed: spro ba skyed de /
translated: and they generate enthusiasm and arouse diligence in order to practice them just as they have been taught, without adding or subtracting anything.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing gnas pa dag yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrungs shing stsogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing gnas pa dag yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bsrungs shing stsogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œguarding and accumulating the collection of meditative stabilization.â€

original: de de ltar nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par chos rnams yongs su spong zhing khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la so sor rten par byed pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar nyams par gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par chos rnams yongs su spong zhing khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la so sor rten par byed pa na /
translated: When they abandon the qualities that are conducive to degeneration and rely on the qualities that are conducive to distinctive abilities,

original: rab tu dben par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dben par gnas pa yin no //
translated: they abide in solitude.

original: rab tu dben par gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dben par gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is â€œabiding in solitudeâ€?

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / dben pa phun sum tshogs pa gang yin ba'o //

original: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfect place is as follows.ğŸ”½

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khyim gyis stong pa dag ste /
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khyim gyis stong pa dag ste /
translated: in a monastery, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty house.

original: de la gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha' ni dgon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha' ni dgon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The open air and the charnel ground and the forest are called solitary places.

original: de la nags 'dab ni shing drung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nags 'dab ni shing drung zhes bya'o //
translated: The forest is the foot of a tree.

original: de la ri khrod dang ri phug dang / rtsva khang dag ni khyim gyis stong pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ri khrod dang ri phug dang / rtsva khang dag ni khyim gyis stong pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The empty in empty house refers to a mountain hermitage, a mountain cave, or a hut in the forest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong gi gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha' dang / nags 'dabs dang / ri khrod dang / ri phug dang / rtsva khang de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong gi gnas mal bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha' dang / nags 'dabs dang / ri khrod dang / ri phug dang / rtsva khang de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The dwelling place is a monastery, a tree, an empty house, an open space, a charnel ground, a remote place, a forest, a mountain, a cave, or a hut made of straw.ğŸ”½

original: gnas phun sum tshogs ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The excellent place is fivefold:

original: 'di la dang po kho nar gnas yibs su shis pa /ğŸ”½lta na sdug pa /
analyzed: 'di la dang po kho nar gnas yibs su shis pa / lta na sdug pa /
translated: Here, first, the place is auspicious,ğŸ”½beautiful to behold,ğŸ”½pleasing,

original: mdzes pa / kun dga' ra ba phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa / kun dga' ra ba phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: with excellent parks,

original: nags tshal phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: nags tshal phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: excellent forests,

original: rdzing bu phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: rdzing bu phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: excellent ponds,

original: gtsang ba nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: gtsang ba nyams dga' ba /
translated: clean, delightful,

original: shang shong med pa /ğŸ”½sdong dum dang / tsher ma'i gzhi ma yin pa /
analyzed: shang shong med pa / sdong dum dang / tsher ma'i gzhi ma yin pa /
translated: without ravines,ğŸ”½without stumps or thorns,

original: rdo ba dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo mi mang ba /
analyzed: rdo ba dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo mi mang ba /
translated: not full of stones, pebbles, and gravel,

original: gang des mthong na sbong ba la @131a * //
analyzed: gang des mthong na sbong ba la @131a * //
translated: where one who sees it is inspired

original: brtson par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: to strive for purification.ğŸ”½Since one's mind becomes clear,

original: sems mngon par rab tu dang bar 'gyur zhing sems rangs shing rab tu dga' bas spyong ba la rab tu stod par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems mngon par rab tu dang bar 'gyur zhing sems rangs shing rab tu dga' bas spyong ba la rab tu stod par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: one's mind is pleased and delighted, and one praises purification.

original: de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first excellent place.

original: gzhan yang nyin mo mi sdug pa nyung la /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyin mo mi sdug pa nyung la /
translated: Moreover, during the day, there are few unpleasant things,

original: mtshan mo sgra chung zhing klag cor nyung ba dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyis reg pa nyung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan yang gang na /
analyzed: mtshan mo sgra chung zhing klag cor nyung ba dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul gyis reg pa nyung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin no // gzhan yang gang na /
translated: The second excellent basis is one where there is little noise and commotion at night, and where there are few mosquitoes, horseflies, wind, sun, and snakes.

original: seng ge dang / stag dang / gung dang / chom rkun dang / pha rol gyi dmags  tshogs dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba med la /
analyzed: seng ge dang / stag dang / gung dang / chom rkun dang / pha rol gyi dmags  tshogs dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba med la /
translated: The third excellent basis is one where there are no lions, tigers, leopards, hyenas, thieves, enemies, humans, or non-humans, and where there is no fear or terror.

original: yid brtan zhing bag tsha ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /ğŸ”½gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: yid brtan zhing bag tsha ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /ğŸ”½gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: It is a place where one can live with confidence and without anxiety, and where one can live happily.

original: gzhan yang gang du chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du babs pa gang yin pa de dag tshegs chung dus 'grub cing bsod snyoms la sogs pa de dag gis lus ngal ba med par 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun
analyzed: gzhan yang gang du chos gos la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du babs pa gang yin pa de dag tshegs chung dus 'grub cing bsod snyoms la sogs pa de dag gis lus ngal ba med par 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas phun
translated: Furthermore, a place is excellent if one can easily obtain the requisites for living, such as Dharma robes, and if one can live without physical hardship, such as by begging for alms.

original: sum tshogs pa bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth excellent quality of a place.

original: gzhan yang gang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur zhing gang dag de la ma phye ba'i gnas rnams 'byed par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur zhing gang dag de la ma phye ba'i gnas rnams 'byed par byed cing /
translated: Furthermore, a place is excellent if one is cared for by spiritual friends who open up for one those topics that have not been opened up,

original: phye ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed pa dang / ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zab mo'i don dang tshig shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas /
analyzed: phye ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed pa dang / ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zab mo'i don dang tshig shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas /
translated: who clarify for one those topics that have been opened up, and who, in order to purify oneâ€™s wisdom and vision, analyze with wisdom the profound words and meanings.

original: legs bar rab tu ston par byed pa de lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: legs bar rab tu ston par byed pa de lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa yin no //
translated: The fifth perfection of the place is that it is the place where wise practitioners live, who are able to teach well and thoroughly.

original: de la spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is perfection of conduct?

original: nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed cing /
analyzed: nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed cing /
translated: During the day, he spends his time walking and sitting.

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang de bzhin byed pa dang / thun bar ma la glo g-yas ba phab ste nyal bar byed ba dang / thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nas lang te /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang de bzhin byed pa dang / thun bar ma la glo g-yas ba phab ste nyal bar byed ba dang / thun tha ma la myur ba myur ba kho nas lang te /
translated: In the first part of the night, he does the same. In the middle part of the night, he lies down on his right side, resting his cheek on his right hand, like a lion. In the last part of the night, he gets up quickly and spends his time walking and sitting.

original: 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed pa dang / de ltar gnas mal phun sum tshogs pa de nyid du sangs rgyas kyis @131b rjes su gnang ba'i khri'am /
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'da' bar byed pa dang / de ltar gnas mal phun sum tshogs pa de nyid du sangs rgyas kyis @131b rjes su gnang ba'i khri'am /
translated: In that very perfect place, he sits cross-legged on a seat approved by the Buddha,

original: khri'u'am / rtsva bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khri'u'am / rtsva bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par byed pa'o //
translated: such as a lion seat, a bench, or a spread of straw.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they see five types of causes.

original: lus legs par bsgrims na /
analyzed: lus legs par bsgrims na /
translated: If they properly restrain their bodies,

original: spyod lam de shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod lam de shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they will generate pliancy in that posture and it will be compatible with it.

original: myur ba myur ba kho nar shin tu sbyangs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du 'dug pas dus yun ring po 'da' bar byed nus shing /
analyzed: myur ba myur ba kho nar shin tu sbyangs pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du 'dug pas dus yun ring po 'da' bar byed nus shing /
translated: Because of that, pliancy will quickly arise and they will be able to remain in that posture for a long while.ğŸ”½That posture will not cause their bodies to become fatigued and that posture will not be shared in common with non Buddhists or opponents.

original: spyod lam des de'i lus shin tu ngal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du spyod lam de ni gzhan mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag gis spyod lam des 'dug pa mthong na shin tu dang ba skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: spyod lam des de'i lus shin tu ngal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du spyod lam de ni gzhan mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag gis spyod lam des 'dug pa mthong na shin tu dang ba skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If others see them sitting in that posture, they will generate great faith.

original: de bzhin du spyod lam de ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su gnang zhing bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyod lam de ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis rjes su gnang zhing bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That posture is permitted and taught by the buddhas and the buddhas Å›rÄvakas.

original: rgyu de lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he sees these five causes correctly,

original: skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrangs nas 'dug go //
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas te lus drang por bsrangs nas 'dug go //
translated: he sits down, crosses his legs, and holds his body erect.

original: de la lus drang por gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus drang por gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by â€œholding the body erectâ€?

original: lus gsal bar bsang ste bzhag pa dang / sems la g-yo med cing tshul 'chos pa med par drang por bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus gsal bar bsang ste bzhag pa dang / sems la g-yo med cing tshul 'chos pa med par drang por bzhag pa'o //
translated: It means to sit with a clear body and a mind that is not crooked or hypocritical.

original: de la lus drang pos rab tu zin pas ni /
analyzed: de la lus drang pos rab tu zin pas ni /
translated: When the body is held erect,

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyi sems yang dag par blangs te gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyi sems yang dag par blangs te gnas par mi byed do //
translated: one does not take up and abide in a state of mind that is drowsy or sleepy.

original: sems la g-yo med cing tshul 'chos pa med pas ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba yang dag par blangs te gnas par mi byed do //ğŸ”½dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste zhes bya ba de la dran pa phyogs par bzhag ste /
analyzed: sems la g-yo med cing tshul 'chos pa med pas ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba yang dag par blangs te gnas par mi byed do // dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste zhes bya ba de la dran pa phyogs par bzhag ste /
translated: When the mind is not crooked or hypocritical, one does not take up and abide in a state of external distraction.ğŸ”½â€œPlacing mindfulness in front of oneselfâ€ meansğŸ”½to sit with mindfulness in front of oneself.

original: gnas par byed pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by â€œplacing mindfulness in front of oneselfâ€?

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa ni nag po'i phyogs thams cad las phyir phyogs shing mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½dran pa phyogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa ni nag po'i phyogs thams cad las phyir phyogs shing mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir / dran pa phyogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Mindfulness associated with proper mental attention is called â€œdirectedâ€ because it is opposed to and incompatible with all that is dark.

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la dmigs ba dang ; gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa thams cad la phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir dran pa phyogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la dmigs ba dang ; gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa thams cad la phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir dran pa phyogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, mindfulness that takes the sign of concentration and the sign of the reflected image as its object is called â€œdirectedâ€ because it is directed toward all the objects of the stage of meditative concentration.

original: de ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œthe perfection of deportment.â€

original: dben pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /ğŸ”½smras pa / @132a * //
analyzed: dben pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na / smras pa / @132a * //
translated: What is the perfection of seclusion?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa'o //
analyzed: lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa'o //
translated: seclusion of the body and seclusion of the mind.

original: de la lus dben pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / gnyis lhan cig na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus dben pa ni khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / gnyis lhan cig na mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Seclusion of the body means that the ordained person does not live with the laity.

original: de la sems dben pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs te /ğŸ”½mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'am /
analyzed: de la sems dben pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs te / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'am /
translated: Mental seclusion is the avoidance of afflicted and neutral mental activities.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dga' ba'i don dang ldan pa sgom par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dga' ba'i don dang ldan pa sgom par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the mental activity that arises from the preparation of the equipment for meditative concentration, or that belongs to the stage of meditative concentration, and is associated with the object of joy.

original: de ni sems dben pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems dben pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called mental seclusion.

original: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa dang / lus dben pa gang yin pa dang / sems dben pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rab tu dben pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa dang / lus dben pa gang yin pa dang / sems dben pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rab tu dben pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The excellence of place, the excellence of posture, physical seclusion, and mental seclusion are all together called seclusion.

original: de la sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is one-pointedness of mind?

original: smras pa / yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang / cha mthun pa la dmigs pa dang / rgyun dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang / cha mthun pa la dmigs pa dang / rgyun dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa ste /
translated: He replied: It is the continuity of mind that is accompanied by recollection, that takes on the aspect of the object, that is uninterrupted, that is free of obscurations, and that is accompanied by joy.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is called meditative concentration.

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called the one-pointedness of mind that is virtuous.

original: de la ci zhig yang dang yang du rjes su dran par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ci zhig yang dang yang du rjes su dran par byed ce na /
translated: What is it that one recollects again and again?

original: smras pa / chos gang dag bzung zhing mnyan pa dang ; bla ma dag las gdams shing rjes su bstan pa thob pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: smras pa / chos gang dag bzung zhing mnyan pa dang ; bla ma dag las gdams shing rjes su bstan pa thob pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: He replied: It is the Dharma that one has learned and heard, and the instructions and teachings that one has received from oneâ€™s spiritual teachers.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i mtshan ma mngon du byas te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i mtshan ma mngon du byas te /
translated: Having taken that as oneâ€™s object, one should bring to mind the sign that is the basis for the mindâ€™s stability.

original: dmigs pa de la rgyun dang ldan pa'i dran pa rjes su 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: dmigs pa de la rgyun dang ldan pa'i dran pa rjes su 'jug par byed cing /
translated: One should then cause mindfulness to engage that object continuously and to maintain it.

original: nye bar stod par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar stod par byed do //
translated: One should also cause it to be free of obscurations.

original: de la cha mthun pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la cha mthun pa la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by taking on the aspect of the object?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang yin pa ste /
translated: The object of the stage of meditative concentration is manifold, of many kinds, and various.

original: gang gis dmigs pa de la sems 'jug par byed pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa de la sems 'jug par byed pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That by which the mind engages in the object is called meditative concentration.

original: de ni cha mthun pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni cha mthun pa la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the object of similarity.

original: de gang dang cha mthun zhe na /
analyzed: de gang dang cha mthun zhe na /
translated: What is similar to it?

original: smras pa / de ni shes bya'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan yin pas na de'i phyir cha mthun pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½dmigs pa des dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rtag tu dang / gus par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun dang ldan @132b pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni shes bya'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan yin pas na de'i phyir cha mthun pa zhes bya'o // dmigs pa des dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rtag tu dang / gus par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun dang ldan @132b pa yin no //
translated: It is said: Because it is the reflection of the object of knowledge, therefore it is called similar.ğŸ”½That which is uninterrupted, continuous, constant, and respectful engagement with that object without distraction of mindfulness is called continuous.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la mngon par dga' ba nyon mongs pa med cing /
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la mngon par dga' ba nyon mongs pa med cing /
translated: That which is free from afflictions and delights in that very object is called pure.

original: reg par gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni kha na ma thob med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: reg par gnas pa'i dran pas lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni kha na ma thob med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: The path of one who has entered it with mindfulness that abides in contact is free of transgressions and is joyful.

original: de'i phyir yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang / cha mthun pa la dmigs pa dang ; rgyun dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dang yang du rjes su dran pa dang / cha mthun pa la dmigs pa dang ; rgyun dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyun ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the stream of mind that is free of transgressions and is joyful is called concentration.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs yod de /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid de yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs yod de /
translated: That one-pointedness of mind also has two aspects: the aspect of serenity and the aspect of insight.

original: de la sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin no //
translated: Among them, the nine states of mind that are stillnesses are the aspect of serenity.

original: de la shes rab kyis dpyod pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyis dpyod pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Among them, the four kinds of investigations with wisdom are the aspect of insight.

original: de la sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine states of mind that are stillnesses?

original: 'di la dge slong sems nang kho nar 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong sems nang kho nar 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: he places it well, he collects it, he focuses it, he calms it, he pacifies it,

original: nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
translated: he unifies it, he concentrates it.

original: de la ji ltar na 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he place it?

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par bsdus te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par bsdus te /
translated: He collects it from all external objects

original: rnam par mi g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir nang du nye bar gtod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir nang du nye bar gtod par byed pa ste /
translated: and focuses it within, in order to avoid distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang por nye bar gtad pa gang yin pa de ni 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang por nye bar gtad pa gang yin pa de ni 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The first focusing is the placing.

original: ji ltar na yang dag par 'jog par byed ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang dag par 'jog par byed ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does he place it well?

original: dang po nye bar gtod pa'i sems gang yin pa de /
analyzed: dang po nye bar gtod pa'i sems gang yin pa de /
translated: The mind that he has first focused

original: g-yo ba dang / rags pa dang / yang dag par mi gnas pa dang / yongs su mi gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / rags pa dang / yang dag par mi gnas pa dang / yongs su mi gnas par gyur na /
translated: It is unsteady, gross, not settled, and not fully settled.

original: de dmigs pa de nyid la gtad pa'i tshul dang / dang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa dang bcas pas /
analyzed: de dmigs pa de nyid la gtad pa'i tshul dang / dang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa dang bcas pas /
translated: When it is like that, he focuses on that very object with a method of directing and a method of clarifying.

original: phra bar byed cing mngon par g-yeng bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phra bar byed cing mngon par g-yeng bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: He makes it subtle and does not allow it to be distracted. That is called â€œfully settling.â€

original: ji ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he settle it by collecting?

original: de ltar de'i sems gzhag pa dang yang dag par gzhag pa de gal te brjed ngas pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar de'i sems gzhag pa dang yang dag par gzhag pa de gal te brjed ngas pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
translated: If his mind, which is settled and fully settled in that way, becomes distracted outwardly due to forgetfulness,

original: des yang phyir de nyid la sdud par byed de /ğŸ”½de ltar na bsdus te @133a * //
analyzed: des yang phyir de nyid la sdud par byed de / de ltar na bsdus te @133a * //
translated: he again collects it right there.

original: 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is called â€œsettling by collecting.â€

original: ji ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he settle it by placing?

original: dang po kho nar de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: dang po kho nar de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: From the very beginning, he places mindfulness right there.

original: gnas shing sems de yang dag par 'jog bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gnas shing sems de yang dag par 'jog bar byed pa na /
translated: When he is abiding in that thought and setting it correctly,

original: ji nas kyang de'i sems de'i phyi rol du mi 'phro bar byed de /
analyzed: ji nas kyang de'i sems de'i phyi rol du mi 'phro bar byed de /
translated: he does not let it go out to external objects.

original: de ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he is setting it correctly.

original: ji ltar na dul bar byed pa yin zhe na //ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na dul bar byed pa yin zhe na // 'di lta ste /
translated: How does he tame it?

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma dag gam /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma dag gam /
translated: He does not let his thought go out to the signs of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bud med dang skyes pa'i mtshan ma gang dag gis /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bud med dang skyes pa'i mtshan ma gang dag gis /
translated: or to the signs of women and men, or to the signs of passion, hatred, and ignorance,

original: de'i sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na /
translated: by which his thought would be distracted.

original: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bzung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bzung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the very beginning, he has taken up the idea of the disadvantages of those signs,

original: mtshan ma de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
translated: and he does not let his thought go out to those signs.

original: de ltar na dul bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dul bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he tames it.

original: ji ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he pacify it?

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis de'i sems kun du 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis de'i sems kun du 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: Whatever discursive thoughts there are, such as those of desire, and whatever secondary defilements there are, such as the hindrance of longing for sensual pleasures, by which his mind is disturbed,

original: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes su gzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de'i sems de rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag la 'phror mi ster bar byed do //
analyzed: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes su gzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de'i sems de rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag la 'phror mi ster bar byed do //
translated: he does not allow his mind to be dispersed among those discursive thoughts and those secondary defilements, but rather he takes hold of the notion of danger in regard to them.

original: de ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he pacifies.

original: ji ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he thoroughly pacify?

original: de brjed ngas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyi ga kun 'byung bar gyur na ;
analyzed: de brjed ngas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyi ga kun 'byung bar gyur na ;
translated: When both discursive thought and secondary defilement arise due to his forgetfulness,

original: byung ngo cog dang du mi len cing spong bar byed de /
analyzed: byung ngo cog dang du mi len cing spong bar byed de /
translated: he does not acquiesce in their arising, but rather he abandons them.

original: de ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin no /
translated: Thus he thoroughly pacifies.

original: ji ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one make the mind one-pointed?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed de /
translated: One makes the mind one-pointed by uninterruptedly and continuously placing the mind on the stream of concentration with effort.

original: de ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one makes the mind one-pointed.

original: ji ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin zhe na /ğŸ”½kun du bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i lam thob cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: ji ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin zhe na / kun du bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i lam thob cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa de nyid kyis /
translated: How does one make the mind concentrated?ğŸ”½One makes the mind concentrated by attaining the path of effortless and spontaneous engagement through the cause of repeated practice and familiarity.

original: de'i sems @133b rnam par g-yang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sems @133b rnam par g-yang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of that very effortless and spontaneous engagement, one enters the stream of concentration without mental distraction.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one makes the mind concentrated.

original: de la stobs rnam pa drug gis ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu po dag 'grub ste /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la stobs rnam pa drug gis ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu po dag 'grub ste /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
translated: The nine mental states are accomplished by means of six powers.ğŸ”½What are the six powers?

original: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / shes bzhin gyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs kyis so //ğŸ”½de la thos pa dang bsams pa'i stobs kyis ni re zhig thos pa gang yin pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / shes bzhin gyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs kyis so // de la thos pa dang bsams pa'i stobs kyis ni re zhig thos pa gang yin pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: by the power of hearing, the power of reflection, the power of mindfulness, the power of full awareness, the power of vigor, and the power of thorough familiarization.

original: dang po kho nar sems dmigs pa la 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: dang po kho nar sems dmigs pa la 'jog par byed cing /
translated: By the power of hearing and reflection, one first of all places the mind on the object of meditation, and by the power of mindfulness, one fixes the mind on the object of meditation.

original: de nyid la gtod pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par 'jog par yang byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la gtod pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par 'jog par yang byed do //
translated: By the power of full awareness, one correctly fixes the mind on the object of meditation.ğŸ”½By the power of vigor, one gathers the mind and fixes it on the object of meditation.

original: de ltar sems gtad pa la dran pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par sdud cing rnam par g-yeng par mi byed pas bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar sems gtad pa la dran pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par sdud cing rnam par g-yeng par mi byed pas bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed do //
translated: By the power of thorough familiarization, one places the mind in equipoise.

original: de nas shes bzhin gyi stobs kyis ni rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dag la 'phro par mi byed pas dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: de nas shes bzhin gyi stobs kyis ni rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dag la 'phro par mi byed pas dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed ba'o //
translated: Then, by the power of vigilance, one does not let the mind go out to the signs of the fundamental or proximate defilements, and so one tames and pacifies the mind.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni de gnyi ga kun du 'byung ba dang du mi len cing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni de gnyi ga kun du 'byung ba dang du mi len cing /
translated: By the power of vigor, one does not tolerate the arising of either of them,

original: rgyud gcig tu yang byed do //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu yang byed do //
translated: and one makes the mind one-pointed.

original: yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs kyis ting nge 'dzin du byed do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs kyis ting nge 'dzin du byed do //
translated: By the power of thorough familiarity, one concentrates the mind.

analyzed: de la sems gnas pa dgu po dag la yid la byed pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di la dge slong 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, monks,ğŸ”½on the basis of inner mental calm, they discern phenomena,

analyzed: de la ji ltar rnam par 'byed par byed ce na /

analyzed: spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dag la /

analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis rnam par 'byed par byed do //

translated: They discern them well by way of the mode of existence.ğŸ”½When they apprehend signs with a conceptual mental attention that is associated with wisdom,

translated: What are the three doors of insight?

original: mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i lhag mthong dang / yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are insight that is occupied with mere signs, insight that is occupied with thorough searching, and insight that is occupied with the thorough analysis of what is thoroughly searched for.

analyzed: de la mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa ni gang gis thos pa dang / bzung ba'i chos sam ;

analyzed: gdams ngag la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pas /

analyzed: yid la byed cing sems par mi byed / rtog par mi byed / 'jal bar mi byed /
translated: does not imagine,ğŸ”½does not measure,

analyzed: nye bar rtog par mi byed pa ste /

original: de ni mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su zhugs pa yin no //

original: gang gi tshe sems par byed /ğŸ”½rtog par byed ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems par byed / rtog par byed ;

analyzed: 'jal bar byed / nye bar rtog par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /

original: yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba'i rjes su zhugs pa yin no //

original: gang gi tshe bsams shing brtags la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsams shing brtags la /

analyzed: gzhal zhing nye bar brtags nas / ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor rtog par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /

original: @134b yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: @134b yongs su btsal ba la so sor rtog pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /

analyzed: de yongs su tshol bar byed pa na /

analyzed: gzhi rnam pa drug bo yongs su tshol bar byed de /

analyzed: yongs su btsal nas kyang de dag la so sor rtog par byed do //

analyzed: smras pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes de ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed do //

original: ji ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /

original: sgal tshigs kyi sbubs dang / mgo'i thod pa'i bar du 'brel pa yin no //ğŸ”½yan lag gi keng rus ni lag ngar gyi rus pa dang 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: sgal tshigs kyi sbubs dang / mgo'i thod pa'i bar du 'brel pa yin no // yan lag gi keng rus ni lag ngar gyi rus pa dang 'brel ba'am /
translated: The skeleton of the body is the connection of bones from the cavity of the pelvis up to the cavity of the spine and the skull.

original: brla dang rje ngar gyi rus pa dag 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: brla dang rje ngar gyi rus pa dag 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The skeleton of the limbs is the connection of the bones of the arms and hands, or the connection of the bones of the thighs and calves.

original: de la lus kyi keng rus gang yin pa de ni keng rus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi keng rus gang yin pa de ni keng rus zhes bya'o //
translated: The skeleton of the body is called the skeleton.

original: yan lag gi keng rus gang yin pa de ni rus pa'i keng rus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi keng rus gang yin pa de ni rus pa'i keng rus zhes bya'o //
translated: The skeleton of the limbs is called the bone-skeleton.

original: gzhan yang keng rus kyi mtshan mar bzung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang keng rus kyi mtshan mar bzung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Furthermore, the apprehension of the sign of a skeleton is of two kinds:ğŸ”½the drawn image and the real skeleton.

original: ri mor bris pa'am /ğŸ”½rdo rje ba'am /
analyzed: ri mor bris pa'am / rdo rje ba'am /
translated: The drawn image is drawn on a wall,ğŸ”½on a piece of cloth,ğŸ”½on a bone,

original: shing ngam / 'jim pa las byas pa dang / keng rus yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: shing ngam / 'jim pa las byas pa dang / keng rus yang dag pa'o //
translated: on a piece of wood, or on clay.

original: de la gang gi tshe keng rus yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe keng rus yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When you bring to mind the skeleton, which is a false mental image,ğŸ”½

original: keng rus kho nar mos par @136b byed pa yin te /
analyzed: keng rus kho nar mos par @136b byed pa yin te /
translated: When one attends to the skeleton as a false sign, then one has conviction in the skeleton alone,

analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus su ni ma yin no // gang gi tshe keng rus yang dag pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /

analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus su mos par byed pa yin no //
translated: When one attends to the skeleton as a true sign, then one has conviction in the skeleton as a bone.

original: phyi rol gyi kha dog lta bu rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su gtogs pa de dag gis rnam par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi kha dog lta bu rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su gtogs pa de dag gis rnam par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The transformation of external color that is included in derivative form is of three kinds:

original: rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs so //ğŸ”½de la rnam par bsngos pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / de gnyi ga'i phyogs so // de la rnam par bsngos pa nas bzung ste /
translated: transformation by nature, transformation by another, and transformation by both.

original: rnam par bam pa'i bar dag ni rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //ğŸ”½de rnam par zos pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bam pa'i bar dag ni rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //ğŸ”½de rnam par zos pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Among these, the transformation from the blue-black stage up to the bloated stage is by nature.ğŸ”½The transformation from the festering stage up to the skeleton stage is by another.ğŸ”½The transformation from the worm-infested stage up to the skeleton stage is by both.

original: rnam par 'thor ba'i bar dag ni gzhan gyis byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba'i bar dag ni gzhan gyis byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //

original: de la rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus dag ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyis rnam par gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus dag ni de gnyi ga'i phyogs kyis rnam par gyur ba yin te /

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa de ni phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa de ni phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one who makes known the external ugliness in this way, as it is, is one who seeks the own-characteristic of external ugliness.

analyzed: ji ltar mi sdug pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed ce na / nang gi lus kyi phyi rol sdug cing / kha dog lta bu rnam par ma nyams pa gang yin pa dang / phyi'i lus kyi phyi rol mi sdug cing /
translated: How does one seek the general characteristic of ugliness?ğŸ”½The external ugliness of the internal body is the external ugliness of the body that is not yet transformed.

original: kha dog lta bu rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: kha dog lta bu rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /

analyzed: nang gi sdug pa kha dog lta bu ma nyams pa 'di dang / chos nying 'dra zhing chos nyid mtshungs pa yin te /

analyzed: bdag gis sdug pa dang / kha dog lta bu 'di'i mi sdug pa'i chos nyid de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ma shes pa nas /

analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yid la byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dmigs pa ste / nyon mongs @138a * //

analyzed: de ltar 'thad bsgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do /

analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

analyzed: mi sdug pa sgom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags sbong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba de ni grags pa'i chos nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid yin te /

analyzed: de ni bsam par mi bya /ğŸ”½rnam par brtag par mi bya'i mos par bya ba yin no snyam du sems te /

original: de ltar chos nyid kyi rigs pas mi sdug pa nyid yongs su tshol bar byed de /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la mos pa byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar dngos po la byams pa yongs su tshol bar byed do // de yang phyogs gsum po sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa /
