analyzed: rjes su dpag bar bya ba de lta bu yang yod do zhes de ltar 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pas byams pa yongs su 'tshol bar byed do //
translated: And he has the inference that such is the case. Thus, he seeks love by the reasoning of proof.

original: byams pa bsgom pa gang yin pas gnod sems sbong bar 'gyur ba de ni grags pa'i chos nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid yin no zhes de ltar chos nyid kyi rigs pas byams pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: byams pa bsgom pa gang yin pas gnod sems sbong bar 'gyur ba de ni grags pa'i chos nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid yin no zhes de ltar chos nyid kyi rigs pas byams pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, they search for loving kindness with the reasoning of nature.

original: de la rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong la rab tu brtson pa ji ltar yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /ğŸ”½smras pa / de'i dbang du byas pa'i chos thos pa dang / bsam pa'i dbang du byas nas chos de dang de dag skyes pas chos de dang de dag skye zhing /ğŸ”½chos de dang de dag 'gags pas /
analyzed: de la rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i lhag mthong la rab tu brtson pa ji ltar yongs su tshol bar byed ce na / smras pa / de'i dbang du byas pa'i chos thos pa dang / bsam pa'i dbang du byas nas chos de dang de dag skyes pas chos de dang de dag skye zhing / chos de dang de dag 'gags pas /
translated: How do they search by means of the vipaÅ›yanÄ that focuses on the dependent origination of this very condition?

original: chos de dang de dag 'gag par zad kyi /
analyzed: chos de dang de dag 'gag par zad kyi /
translated: They think, â€œThe arising of those phenomena is due to the arising of those phenomena, and the cessation of those phenomena is due to the cessation of those phenomena.

original: 'di la chos rnams kyi dbang phyug dang / byed pa po dang / 'byin pa po dang / sprul pa po yang med la /
analyzed: 'di la chos rnams kyi dbang phyug dang / byed pa po dang / 'byin pa po dang / sprul pa po yang med la /
translated: There is no creator, no cause, no agent, and no experiencer of phenomena.

original: chos rnams 'jug par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang / skyes bu gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhes de ltar don so sor rig par byed pa de ni don yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams 'jug par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang / skyes bu gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhes de ltar don so sor rig par byed pa de ni don yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he seeks the meaning.

original: yang de sred ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag ni nang gi dbang phyi rol gyi yin par mos shing /
analyzed: yang de sred ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag ni nang gi dbang phyi rol gyi yin par mos shing /
translated: He also believes that the twelve members of dependent origination are internal and external.

original: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi yin par mos shing /
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi yin par mos shing /
translated: He believes that they are internal and external.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: He thoroughly discerns them.

original: de ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed do //ğŸ”½yang de ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi @140a * //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed do // yang de ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi @140a * //
translated: In this way, he seeks the entity.

original: mtha' mi shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: mtha' mi shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: He also thoroughly discerns, in accordance with the analysis of dependent origination, that ignorance is the non-understanding of the prior limit, and so on.

original: de ltar rang tig mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rang tig mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, he seeks the characteristics of the intrinsic nature.

original: yang de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed de dag thams cad ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur pa'i rim gyis mi rtag pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
analyzed: yang de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed de dag thams cad ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur pa'i rim gyis mi rtag pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
translated: Furthermore, he discerns that all these conditioned things that originate in dependence are impermanent because they arise from what does not exist and, having arisen, they are destroyed.

original: 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / rang dang med pa dang / nang na skyes bu dmigs pa med pa'i phyir stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no zhes rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / rang dang med pa dang / nang na skyes bu dmigs pa med pa'i phyir stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no zhes rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: They are suffering because they are subject to birth, old age, sickness, death, and so on. They are empty and insubstantial because they are devoid of a self and because no person is perceived within them.

original: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he seeks their general characteristics.

original: yang de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du byed 'di dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba la /
analyzed: yang de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du byed 'di dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, in order to understand correctly these conditioned things that are impermanent, suffering, empty, and insubstantial,

original: bdag kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa'i chos de ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa'i chos de ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: he discerns the Dharma that is associated with the afflictions, which is the ignorance that is the root of all the other afflictions.

original: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The dark side is the side of non-virtue.

original: rmongs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: The absence of confusion is the absence of defilement.

original: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes rgyas par rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes rgyas par rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: The bright side is the side of virtue.

original: de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, one searches the directions.

original: yang de 'das pa'i dus la brten te//ğŸ”½rtag pa dang / yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa'i lus thob pa 'gal yang med la /ğŸ”½da ltar gyi dus la brten te /
analyzed: yang de 'das pa'i dus la brten te// rtag pa dang / yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa'i lus thob pa 'gal yang med la / da ltar gyi dus la brten te /
translated: Moreover, one searches the past,ğŸ”½and one searches the future,

original: mi gnas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang gnas par mi 'gyur bar rab tu rnam par byed de /
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang gnas par mi 'gyur bar rab tu rnam par byed de /
translated: and one searches the present.

original: de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //ğŸ”½yang de las kyang yod /
analyzed: de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do // yang de las kyang yod /
translated: In this way, one searches the times.ğŸ”½Moreover, one searches the self,

original: rnam par smin pa yang yod la /ğŸ”½chos kyi brdar btags pa ma gtogs par byed pa po'am /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang yod la /ğŸ”½chos kyi brdar btags pa ma gtogs par byed pa po'am /
translated: and one searches the other.ğŸ”½In this way, one searches the persons.

original: myong ba po gang yin pa'i byed pa po mi dmigs pa dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar de dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya /ğŸ”½rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: myong ba po gang yin pa'i byed pa po mi dmigs pa dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar de dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: They are merely designated by names such as this is the name,ğŸ”½this is the family,

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: this is the clan,

original: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: this is the kind of food they eat,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /ğŸ”½tshe ni 'di ltar ring por gyur /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong / tshe ni 'di ltar ring por gyur /
translated: this is the kind of pleasure and pain they experience,ğŸ”½this is how long their lives are,

original: yun ni de srid cig tu gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni de srid cig tu gnas gnas /
translated: this is how long they live,ğŸ”½this is the end of their lives.

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di lta bur gyur to zhes ming dang brdar tha snyad gdags pa tsam du zad do zhes @140b bya ba dang / gzhan yang de la 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di lta bur gyur to zhes ming dang brdar tha snyad gdags pa tsam du zad do zhes @140b bya ba dang / gzhan yang de la 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of effects and two kinds of causes:

original: lus kyi 'bras bu dang / yul la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'bras bu dang / yul la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the effect of the body and the effect of enjoying objects, and the projecting cause and the actualizing cause.

original: de la lus kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / da ltar gyi skye mched drug po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / da ltar gyi skye mched drug po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The result of the body is the six sense spheres that are born from the maturation of karma.

original: yul la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni reg pa drug las byung ba 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i las kyi dbang gis tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni reg pa drug las byung ba 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i las kyi dbang gis tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The result of the experience of objects is the feeling that arises from the six contacts, which is either pleasant or unpleasant due to the power of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.ğŸ”½The projecting cause is the cause of the two results.ğŸ”½It is the cause of the result of the body and the result of the experience of objects. It is the cause of the result of the body because it is the cause of the six sense spheres that are born from the maturation of karma. It is the cause of the result of the experience of objects because it is the cause of the feeling that arises from the six contacts.

original: de la 'phen pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis las /
analyzed: de la 'phen pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis las /
translated: The projecting cause is the cause of the two results.

original: kun du rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa sngon du btang ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams dang 'du byed rnams kyis yang srid par rnam par shes pa'i myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i sa bon yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa sngon du btang ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams dang 'du byed rnams kyis yang srid par rnam par shes pa'i myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i sa bon yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: It is the cause of the result of the body and the result of the experience of objects. It is the cause of the result of the body because it is the cause of the six sense spheres that are born from the maturation of karma. It is the cause of the result of the experience of objects because it is the cause of the feeling that arises from the six contacts.

original: rnam par shes pa yang srid par 'byung ba'i ming dang gzugs kyis bon dang / skye mched drug gi sa bon dang / reg pa dang tshor ba'i sa bon yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang srid par 'byung ba'i ming dang gzugs kyis bon dang / skye mched drug gi sa bon dang / reg pa dang tshor ba'i sa bon yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is the seed of name-and-form that will arise in the next existence, the seed of the six sense spheres, and the seed of contact and feeling.

original: de ltar phyi ma la skye ba'i ming can gyi rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba rnams skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phyi ma la skye ba'i ming can gyi rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba rnams skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it generates the consciousness that is the name of the future birth, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling,

original: rim gyis dang po kho nar sa bon yongs su zin pa gang yin pa de ni 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis dang po kho nar sa bon yongs su zin pa gang yin pa de ni 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: the first stage of the process of taking up a seed is the projecting cause.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa na /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa na /
translated: The actualizing cause is the experience of feeling that arises from the contact that is the coming together of ignorance.

original: de la dmigs pa'i sred pas yang 'byung ba'i sred pa'i srid par skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sred pas yang 'byung ba'i sred pa'i srid par skyed par byed cing /
translated: Craving, which is focused on that feeling, generates the craving for renewed existence.

original: sred pa'i phyogs dang / gti mug gi phyogs kyi nye bar len pa yang yongs su 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: sred pa'i phyogs dang / gti mug gi phyogs kyi nye bar len pa yang yongs su 'dzin par byed la /
translated: The appropriation of the side of craving and the side of delusion is also taken up.

original: de'i stobs dang / de'i mthus las de'i rnam par smin pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i stobs dang / de'i mthus las de'i rnam par smin pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and by the power of that, and by the force of that, one is able to generate the maturation of that karma.

original: de ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause of actualization.

original: rgyu de gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal gsum dang 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal gsum dang 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: In terms of those two causes, one thoroughly discerns, â€œThis mass of suffering alone arises in connection with the three types of suffering.â€

original: de ltar ltos pa'i rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ltos pa'i rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, one seeks the reasoning of dependence.

original: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun du bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas na /
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun du bsten cing goms par byas lan mang du byas na /
translated: By means of this very condition, if one relies on dependent origination, cultivates it, and frequently practices it,

original: gti mug spong bar 'gyur pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung yang de yin la /ğŸ”½bdag nyid @141a * //
analyzed: gti mug spong bar 'gyur pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung yang de yin la / bdag nyid @141a * //
translated: one abandons delusion, and that is the authoritative scripture.

original: kyi so so rang gi rig pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i bya ba yang de yin la /
analyzed: kyi so so rang gi rig pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i bya ba yang de yin la /
translated: That is the activity of oneâ€™s own inference.

original: grags pa'i chos nyid yang de yin te /
analyzed: grags pa'i chos nyid yang de yin te /
translated: That is the nature of what is renowned.

original: de ltar bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas yongs su tshol bar byed do //ğŸ”½de la khams rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa lhag mthong la rab tu brtson pa /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas yongs su tshol bar byed do // de la khams rab tu dbye ba la dmigs pa lhag mthong la rab tu brtson pa /
translated: Thus, he investigates with the reason of efficacy, the reason of the accomplishment of what is possible, and the reason of nature.

original: ji ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: With regard to that, one who is intent on insight that has the differentiation of the elements as its object, How does he investigate the meaning?

original: khams kyi don ni rigs kyi don dang / sa bon gyi don dang / rgyu'i don dang / rang bzhin gyi don to zhes don so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: khams kyi don ni rigs kyi don dang / sa bon gyi don dang / rgyu'i don dang / rang bzhin gyi don to zhes don so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: The meaning of element is the meaning of lineage, the meaning of seed, the meaning of cause, and the meaning of nature. Thus, he conceptually discerns the meaning.

original: de ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar don yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he investigates the meaning.

original: sa la sogs pa khams drug po dag / nang gi dang phyi rol gyi yin par mos par byed pa ni dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa khams drug po dag / nang gi dang phyi rol gyi yin par mos par byed pa ni dngos po yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He investigates the entity by being convinced that the six elements, such as earth, are internal and external.

original: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The characteristic of earth is solidity, and so on up to:

original: rlung gi mtshan nyid ni yang zhing g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi mtshan nyid ni yang zhing g-yo ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of wind is lightness and movement.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is to cognize.ğŸ”½The characteristic of the space element is to be a cavity, and so on up to: the characteristic of the form element is to be the appearance of form.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni sbubs can gyi mtshan nyid dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa gsal ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni sbubs can gyi mtshan nyid dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa gsal ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus he investigates the specific characteristics of the elements.

original: khams de dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi bar gyis mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin no zhes de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: khams de dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi bar gyis mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin no zhes de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He investigates the general characteristics of the elements in this way: All these elements are the same, are similar, in being impermanent, and so on up to: in being insubstantial.

original: khams sna tshogs mi shes shing ril por 'du shes pa /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mi shes shing ril por 'du shes pa /
translated: He investigates the elements in this way: Whoever does not know the variety of elements, and has the notion of a unity,ğŸ”½is inflated and conceited with this body that has a variety of elements.

original: khams sna tshogs can gyi lus 'dis khengs shing rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa'i chos de ni /ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa sta /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs can gyi lus 'dis khengs shing rlom sems su byed pa gang yin pa'i chos de ni / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa sta /
translated: That dharma is defiled,

original: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: is on the dark side.

original: de las bzlog pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is undefiled,ğŸ”½is on the bright side.

original: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: This is how they investigate the side of virtue.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su khams drug po dag la brten te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su khams drug po dag la brten te /
translated: They investigate the six elements that are the basis for entering the womb in the past, future, and present.

original: ma'i lto bar mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma'i lto bar mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how they investigate time.ğŸ”½For example,

original: dper na / rtsva dang / shing gi rkyen la brten te /
analyzed: dper na / rtsva dang / shing gi rkyen la brten te /
translated: when grass and trees are the conditions

original: nam mkha' kun nas dkris na /
analyzed: nam mkha' kun nas dkris na /
translated: and space is completely enclosed,ğŸ”½it is counted as a house.

original: khang pa khang pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: khang pa khang pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: khams drug po dag la yang brten /
analyzed: khams drug po dag la yang brten /
translated: the six elements are the basis,

original: rus pa dang / chu rgyus dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag gi rkyen la yang @141b brten te /
analyzed: rus pa dang / chu rgyus dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag gi rkyen la yang @141b brten te /
translated: and the conditions of bones, sinews, skin, flesh, and blood

original: nam mkha' kun nas dkris pa sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i gzhi de dag la /

translated: In this way, one searches for the specific characteristics.

original: dbugs rngub ba 'gags na dbugs 'byung ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs rngub ba 'gags na dbugs 'byung ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When the inhalation is blocked, the exhalation occurs.

original: dbugs 'byung ba 'gags na dbugs rngub pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba 'gags na dbugs rngub pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When the exhalation is blocked, the inhalation occurs.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i 'jug pa ni srog gi dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba'i 'jug pa ni srog gi dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang 'brel ba yin te /
translated: The occurrence of inhalation and exhalation is connected with this body that possesses the life faculty and consciousness.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba rten dang bcas pa na mi rtag pa @142a * //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba rten dang bcas pa na mi rtag pa @142a * //
translated: When inhalation and exhalation are together with their supports, they are impermanent.

original: yin no zhes de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: yin no zhes de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, one searches for the general characteristics.

original: de ltar dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag la dran pa nye bar ma bzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pas byas pa'i sems kun du g-yeng ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ste /

translated: Thus, the mind that is distracted by conceptual thoughts due to not being established in mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is defiled.

original: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the dark side.

original: de las bzlog pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is undefiled.ğŸ”½This is the bright side.

original: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes rgya cher de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs yin no zhes rgya cher de ltar phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he seeks the side in detail.ğŸ”½Inhalation and exhalation depend on the body and mind in the past, future, and present.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su lus dang sems la rag las pa yin la /ğŸ”½lus dang sems kyang dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag la rag las pa yin no zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su lus dang sems la rag las pa yin la / lus dang sems kyang dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag la rag las pa yin no zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: The body and mind also depend on inhalation and exhalation.ğŸ”½Thus, he seeks the time in detail.ğŸ”½Here, inhalation and exhalation are the cause of the body and mind.

original: 'di la dbugs rngub par byed pa dang / dbugs 'byung bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la dbugs rngub par byed pa dang / dbugs 'byung bar byed pa'am /
translated: Or, the body and mind are the cause of inhalation and exhalation.

original: gang gi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba de dag ni 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba de dag ni 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
translated: In fact, there is no inhalation or exhalation at all.

original: 'on kyang rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di dag la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu las byung ba'i 'du byed dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di dag la /
translated: Nevertheless, these formations that arise from causes and conditions, and this dependent origination,ğŸ”½are simply expressed by names, symbols, and conventions.

original: ming dang brda dang / tha snyad du brjod par zad do zhes de ltar ltos pa'i rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: ming dang brda dang / tha snyad du brjod par zad do zhes de ltar ltos pa'i rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, he investigates with the reasoning of dependence.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa kun du brten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa kun du brten cing goms par byas /
translated: If you rely on and become accustomed to mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,

original: lan mang du byas na rnam par rtog pa rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan mang du byas na rnam par rtog pa rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
translated: and do it many times, the stream of discursive thought will be cut off.

original: yid ches pa'i lung yang de yin /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung yang de yin /
translated: This is the authoritative scripture.

original: bdag nyid kyi so so rang gi ye shes dang / mthong pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i bya ba dang / grags pa'i chos nyid kyang de yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi so so rang gi ye shes dang / mthong pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i bya ba dang / grags pa'i chos nyid kyang de yin /
translated: This is the activity of oneâ€™s own individual wisdom, seeing, inference, and the nature of what is renowned.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid kyang de yin no zhes de ltar bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid kyang de yin no zhes de ltar bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: This is the principle of the performance of function, the principle of the establishment of proof, and the principle of reality.

original: de ltar dpyad pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pas gzhi drug yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpyad pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pas gzhi drug yongs su btsal nas /
translated: Thus, having investigated the six topics by means of the objective reference of the analysis,

original: sems yang dang yang du nang du zhi bar byed cing lhag mthong gi rnam pa dag gis ji ltar btsal ba de dag nyid la yang dang yang du so sor rtog par yang byed de /
analyzed: sems yang dang yang du nang du zhi bar byed cing lhag mthong gi rnam pa dag gis ji ltar btsal ba de dag nyid la yang dang yang du so sor rtog par yang byed de /
translated: he repeatedly calms his mind and repeatedly examines those very things which he has investigated by means of the aspects of insight.

original: de'i zhi gnas la brten nas lhag mthong rnam par dag par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i zhi gnas la brten nas lhag mthong rnam par dag par byed cing /
translated: On the basis of his serenity, he purifies insight;

original: lhag mthong la brten nas kyang zhi gnas 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong la brten nas kyang zhi gnas 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and on the basis of insight, his serenity increases and expands.

original: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong @142b ba'i dmigs pa dag la lhag mthong gis dngos po drug yongs su tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyis rang gi gnas skabs su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong @142b ba'i dmigs pa dag la lhag mthong gis dngos po drug yongs su tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyis rang gi gnas skabs su brjod par bya'o //
translated: The six matters to be investigated by insight in the objects of the wise and the objects of the purification of the passions will be explained later in their own places.

original: de la rnal 'byor pas dkar po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa dgu dang / de las bzlog pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnam pa dgu yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pas dkar po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa dgu dang / de las bzlog pa ni nag po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnam pa dgu yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The yogi should know that there are nine kinds of application included in the bright side and nine kinds of application included in the dark side, the opposite of the former.

original: 'de lta ste mthun pa'i sbyor ba dang / goms pa'i sbyor ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba dang / mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba dang / dus kyi sbyor ba dang / nye bar rtog pa'i sbyor ba dang / chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: 'de lta ste mthun pa'i sbyor ba dang / goms pa'i sbyor ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba dang / mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba dang / dus kyi sbyor ba dang / nye bar rtog pa'i sbyor ba dang / chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: They are: application of conformity, application of practice, application of non-error, application of non-laxity, application of time, application of investigation, application of non-satisfaction,

original: mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba dang ; yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba dang ; yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: application of non-contradiction, and application of correctness.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnam pa dgu po 'di dag gis ni myur ba myur bar sems ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnam pa dgu po 'di dag gis ni myur ba myur bar sems ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par byed cing /
translated: These nine factors that are on the bright side quickly settle the mind in concentration and

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du yang 'gro par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du yang 'gro par 'gyur la /
translated: they also lead to the distinctive qualities of concentration.

original: des bgrod par bya zhing /
analyzed: des bgrod par bya zhing /
translated: And,

original: thob par bya ba'i sa ji snyed yod pa de dag tu yang thags thogs med par myur ba myur ba kho nar phyin cing thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i sa ji snyed yod pa de dag tu yang thags thogs med par myur ba myur ba kho nar phyin cing thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: they lead to the various levels that are to be attained and they are quickly and easily reached.

original: nag po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnams kyis ni /
translated: The factors that are on the dark side

original: myur ba myur bar sems ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: myur ba myur bar sems ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par byed cing /
translated: quickly settle the mind in concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du yang 'gro bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du yang 'gro bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: but they do not lead to the distinctive qualities of concentration.

original: des bgrod par bya zhing thob par bya ba'i sa ji snyed yod pa de dag tu yang thags thogs med par myur ba myur ba kho nar phyin cing thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bgrod par bya zhing thob par bya ba'i sa ji snyed yod pa de dag tu yang thags thogs med par myur ba myur ba kho nar phyin cing thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And, they do not lead to the various levels that are to be attained and they are not quickly and easily reached.

original: de la mthun pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application that is in conformity?

original: gal te 'dod chags spyad pa zhig yin na ni mi sdug pa la sems nye bar gtod par byed do //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags spyad pa zhig yin na ni mi sdug pa la sems nye bar gtod par byed do //
translated: If he is a person who practices with passion, he should direct his mind to the meditation on the foul.

original: zhes sdang spyad pa zhig yin na ni byams pa la'o //ğŸ”½rnam par rtog pa'i bar du spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: zhes sdang spyad pa zhig yin na ni byams pa la'o // rnam par rtog pa'i bar du spyad pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices with hatred, he should direct his mind to loving-kindness.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'i bar la'o //ğŸ”½cha mnyam par spyad pa dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'i bar la'o // cha mnyam par spyad pa dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If he is a person who practices with discursive thought, he should direct his mind to mindfulness of breathing.

original: dmigs pa gang la dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba des rab tu brtson par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba des rab tu brtson par byed pa ste /
translated: If he is a person who practices with equal shares of passion, hatred, and discursive thought, or if he is a person of little defilement, he should direct his mind to whatever meditation object gives rise to joy.

original: de ni mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is called the application of will.ğŸ”½The application of practice is the practice of serenity and insight.

original: de la goms pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la goms pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: The application of counteracting is the practice of the applications of mindfulness.ğŸ”½The application of complete acceptance is the practice of the applications of correct abandonment.ğŸ”½The application of complete comprehension is the practice of the bases of supernatural power.ğŸ”½The application of the aids to penetration is the practice of the faculties.ğŸ”½The application of the path is the practice of the powers.ğŸ”½The application of the fruits of asceticism is the practice of the branches of the path.

original: des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la than chung zad tsam yang goms par byas shing thams cad kyi thams cad du las dang po pa nyid ma yin pa ste //
analyzed: des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la than chung zad tsam yang goms par byas shing thams cad kyi thams cad du las dang po pa nyid ma yin pa ste //
translated: The application of the ultimate is the practice of the eight branches of the holy.

original: 'di ltar las dang po pa ni mthun pa'i dmigs pas rab tu brtson par @143a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang po pa ni mthun pa'i dmigs pas rab tu brtson par @143a * //
translated: Thus, a beginner, even though he strives with a suitable object,

original: byed kyang / sgrib pa rnams dang lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len dag yang dang yang du kun du 'byung zhing des de'i sems myur bar ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byed kyang / sgrib pa rnams dang lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len dag yang dang yang du kun du 'byung zhing des de'i sems myur bar ting nge 'dzin du 'jog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: his obstructions and the bad habit patterns of his body and mind arise again and again, and his mind does not quickly enter concentration.

original: de ni goms pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni goms pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application of cultivation.

original: de la mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi lhod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application of non-laxity?

original: rtag tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / gus par byas shing sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / gus par byas shing sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: One is always applying oneself and one applies oneself with devotion.

original: gal te bsod snyoms kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms kyi phyir ram /
translated: If one is going out for alms,

original: bla ma la rje sa dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bla ma la rje sa dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: or to serve and respect oneâ€™s guru,

original: nad pa'i nad g-yog bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nad pa'i nad g-yog bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: or to nurse the sick,

original: phyag bya ba'i las kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: phyag bya ba'i las kyi phyir ram /
translated: or to do prostrations,ğŸ”½or for any other suitable immediate activity,

original: de lta bu dar mthun pa'i 'phral gyi bya ba gang yang rung pa'i phyir ram ting nge 'dzin las langs na yang /
analyzed: de lta bu dar mthun pa'i 'phral gyi bya ba gang yang rung pa'i phyir ram ting nge 'dzin las langs na yang /
translated: or if one rises from concentration,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med cing /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med cing /

translated: It is the full attention of the mind, the full exaltation of the mind, the full delight of the mind, the full concentration of the mind, and the full establishment of the mind, by taking up any subject that inspires confidence.

analyzed: de la rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /

original: de la rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus gang zhe na /

original: sems bying bar 'gyur ba'i tshe'am /

translated: When the mind is sinking or

analyzed: bying du dogs pa'i che @144b ste ;

original: de la btang snyoms gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms gang zhe na /
translated: What is equanimity?

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi dmigs pa la sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid dang / rnal du bab ba dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / sems nyams bde ba dang / sems las su rung ba'i rjes su rtsol ba med pa'i bya bas gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi dmigs pa la sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid dang / rnal du bab ba dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / sems nyams bde ba dang / sems las su rung ba'i rjes su rtsol ba med pa'i bya bas gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the state of mind which is neither afflicted nor purified with regard to the object of serenity and insight, and which is the natural state of the mind, its natural object, and its natural function, and which is the state of the mind that is comfortable and serviceable.

original: de la btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /

analyzed: dmigs pa gang gis sems btang snyoms su byed pa dang / dmigs pa de nyid la brtson 'grus ha cang lhag par brtson par mi byed pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is the object by which the mind is made to be equanimous, and it is the object by which the mind is not made to be too energetic.

original: / de la btang snyoms kyi dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la btang snyoms kyi dus gang zhe na /

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems bying ba dang / rgod ba med pa'i tshe ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs la sems bying ba dang / rgod ba med pa'i tshe ste /

analyzed: bsgom pa'i phyir btang snyoms kyi dus yin te de ni dus kyi sbyor ba yin no //

analyzed: mtshan ma de dag nyid legs par bzung zhing legs par brtags ba yin te /

original: de la legs par bzung zhing legs par brtag pa'i phyir gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe snyoms par 'jug pa dang / hi snyed 'dod pa de snyed la snyoms par zhugs shing gnas pa dang / gang gi tshe ldang bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la legs par bzung zhing legs par brtag pa'i phyir gang gi tshe 'dod pa de'i tshe snyoms par 'jug pa dang / hi snyed 'dod pa de snyed la snyoms par zhugs shing gnas pa dang / gang gi tshe ldang bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one wishes to enter, one enters into meditative concentration to the extent that one wishes, and one abides in meditative concentration to the extent that one wishes.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan spangs te /
translated: When one wishes to rise from it, one abandons the reflection that is the domain of concentration.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa yid la byed bas ldang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa yid la byed bas ldang bar byed pa ste /
translated: One rises by attending to the natural object of the non-concentrated stage.

original: de ni nye bar brtag pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye bar brtag pa'i sbyor ba yin no //

original: de la chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis chog mi shes shing spong ba las kyang phyir mi ldog la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis chog mi shes shing spong ba las kyang phyir mi ldog la /
translated: It is the fact of not being satisfied with the good qualities one has, of not turning back from the effort to acquire those one does not have,

original: gong nas gong du gya nom pa las kyang ches gya nom pa'i gnas dag mngon par 'dod pa'i tshul gyis lan mang du gnas pa dang / gong du bya ba yod na cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam dang / zhi gnas tsam gyis bar ma dor sgyid lug par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gong nas gong du gya nom pa las kyang ches gya nom pa'i gnas dag mngon par 'dod pa'i tshul gyis lan mang du gnas pa dang / gong du bya ba yod na cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam dang / zhi gnas tsam gyis bar ma dor sgyid lug par mi byed pa ste /
translated: of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the lesser and middling persons, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the greater persons who are not in the Great Vehicle, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the stages and perfections, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the ten perfections, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the first production of the thought of enlightenment, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the practice of the thought of enlightenment, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the thought of enlightenment itself, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the practice of the thought of enlightenment, of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the first stage, and of not being satisfied with the acquisition of the good qualities of the second, third, up to the tenth stage.

original: de ni chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni chog mi shes pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application of not being satisfied.

original: de la mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application of not contradicting?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa nyams par mi byed cing 'dral bar mi byed pa dang / bud med gzhon nu ma kha dog bzang ba chags par 'gyur bar mthong na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa nyams par mi byed cing 'dral bar mi byed pa dang / bud med gzhon nu ma kha dog bzang ba chags par 'gyur bar mthong na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is the fact of not transgressing or violating the rules of training, and of not grasping the signs or characteristics of a young woman of good family who might arouse desire.

original: zlas la ran par byed pa dang / mi nyal ba'i @145a * //
analyzed: zlas la ran par byed pa dang / mi nyal ba'i @145a * //
translated: It is to be diligent in not sleeping.ğŸ”½It is to remember and recollect what was done a long time ago and what was said a long time ago.

original: rjes su brtson pa dang / don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / g-yeng ba nyung ba dang / yun ring po nas byas pa dang / yun ring po nas smras pa rjes su dran zhing dran par byed pa dang / de lta bu dang ma mthun pa'i chos rnams ni mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su brtson pa dang / don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / g-yeng ba nyung ba dang / yun ring po nas byas pa dang / yun ring po nas smras pa rjes su dran zhing dran par byed pa dang / de lta bu dang ma mthun pa'i chos rnams ni mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: These kinds of qualities are called the practice of non-opposition.

original: chos de dag ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun zhing mi 'gal la /
analyzed: chos de dag ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun zhing mi 'gal la /
translated: These qualities are in harmony with and do not oppose one-pointedness of mind.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir 'jug par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir 'jug par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not lead to distraction of mind.

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: They do not lead to external distraction.

original: nang gi sems las su mi rung zhing dran pa'i phyir yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: nang gi sems las su mi rung zhing dran pa'i phyir yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: They do not lead to internal distraction due to unserviceability of mind and lack of mindfulness.

original: de ni mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the practice of non-opposition.

original: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: â€œWhat is right practice?

original: mos par byas shing mos par byas nas /
analyzed: mos par byas shing mos par byas nas /
translated: Having thus become convinced,

original: dmigs pa rnam par bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: he cultivates the object by means of right application.

original: gal te mi sdug pa la rab tu brtson par byed na /
analyzed: gal te mi sdug pa la rab tu brtson par byed na /
translated: If he is cultivating the contemplation of impurity,ğŸ”½he cultivates the object by means of the insight that follows the signs,

original: yang mtshan ma tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gis mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dag gis /
analyzed: yang mtshan ma tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gis mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dag gis /
translated: and by means of the aspects of impurity.

original: mi sdug pa yid la byed de des dmigs pa yid la byed pa de myur ba myur bar rnam par bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: mi sdug pa yid la byed de des dmigs pa yid la byed pa de myur ba myur bar rnam par bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: He should quickly cultivate that mental attention to the object,

original: myur ba myur bar mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: myur ba myur bar mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: and quickly realize it.

original: rnam par bsgom pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam par bsgom pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of cultivation:

original: sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa dang / dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa dang / de las gzhan pa yid la byed pa dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa dang / dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa dang / de las gzhan pa yid la byed pa dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the mind that is inwardly collected, the cultivation of the mind that is neither mindful nor oblivious, the cultivation of the mind that is other than those, the cultivation of the mind that is the antidote, and the cultivation of the mind that is the sphere of signlessness.

original: de la lhag mthong sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus ni /
analyzed: de la lhag mthong sngon du btang ba'i sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus ni /
translated: The nine states of mind that precede insight

original: sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed do //
translated: He concentrates his mind inwardly.

original: mtshan ma thams cad la mi phyogs shing rnam par g-yeng ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang po nas nye bar gtod pas ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad la mi phyogs shing rnam par g-yeng ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang po nas nye bar gtod pas ni /
translated: From the very beginning, he focuses his mind on the object of meditation in order to avoid all signs and distractions.

original: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med par rig par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med par rig par byed do //
translated: He should understand that this is done without mindfulness and without attention.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa las mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i chos nyid kyi dmigs pa gzhan dag yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa las mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i chos nyid kyi dmigs pa gzhan dag yid la byed pa ni /
translated: He attends to the object of meditation that is the reality of the stage of meditative concentration, which is different from the object of meditation of the stage of meditative concentration.

original: de las gzhan pas yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pas yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: This is called â€œattention to something other than that.â€

original: sdug pa'i gnyen po mi sdug ba nas rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dbugs rdu ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa dang / gzugs kyi gnyen po na mkha'i khams kyi bar dag yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: sdug pa'i gnyen po mi sdug ba nas rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po dbugs rdu ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa dang / gzugs kyi gnyen po na mkha'i khams kyi bar dag yid la byed pa ni /
translated: He attends to the repulsive as the antidote to desire, and so on up to: he attends to the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation as the antidote to discursive thought, and he attends to the element of space as the antidote to form.

original: gnyen po yid la @145b byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yid la @145b byed pa yin no //
translated: This is called â€œattention to an antidote.â€

original: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa ni /
translated: He does not attend to any signs at all, and he attends to the realm of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed ba yin no //
translated: It is the sphere of signlessness that is attended to.

original: dmigs pa rnam par bsdom pa de dag ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par bsdom pa de dag ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag ba yin mod kyi /
translated: These are the characteristics of the all-pervading objective supports.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa dang / dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa yin par dgongs so //ğŸ”½de la las dang po pa las thog ma pas ni dang po kho nar mi sdug ba'am /
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa dang / dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa yin par dgongs so // de la las dang po pa las thog ma pas ni dang po kho nar mi sdug ba'am /
translated: But in this context, the meaning is that the mind is drawn inward and there is neither mindfulness nor attention.ğŸ”½The beginner, the novice, should not at first direct his mind to any objective support, whether it be foulness or something else.

original: de las gzhan ba'i dmigs pa gang la yang sems nye bar gtad par mi bya bar rnam par g-yeng pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i dmigs pa gang la yang sems nye bar gtad par mi bya bar rnam par g-yeng pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid distraction,

original: ji bdag gi sems mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / 'gul ba med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / rtsol ba med par nang du mngon par dga' ba yin nam zhes rab tu brtson bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji bdag gi sems mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / 'gul ba med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / rtsol ba med par nang du mngon par dga' ba yin nam zhes rab tu brtson bar bya ste /
translated: â€œIs my mind delighted internally, without signs, without discursive thought, peaceful, calmed, unmoving, unperturbed, effortless, and without exertion?â€

original: de ltar rab tu brtson par byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu brtson par byed pa na /
translated: When he is thus exerting himself,

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma byung ngo cog thams cad la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma byung ngo cog thams cad la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par byed de /
translated: he should be without mindfulness and without mental activity with regard to all external signs that occur.

original: de ni de'i dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pas dmigs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pas dmigs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is his cultivation of the objective mental support through the absence of mindfulness and the absence of mental activity.

original: de de la rnal 'byor du byed pa na /
analyzed: de de la rnal 'byor du byed pa na /
translated: When he practices yoga with regard to that,

original: dga' ba skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: dga' ba skyed par byed cing /
translated: he should generate joy.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mtshan ma dang bcas shing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag la spyod bar byed do //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mtshan ma dang bcas shing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag la spyod bar byed do //
translated: He should practice with regard to the objective mental supports such as the ugly, which are accompanied by signs and discursive thought.

original: ji ltar spyod bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he practice?

original: mtshan ma'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / so so rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i lhag mthong gis spyod par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / so so rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i lhag mthong gis spyod par byed de /
translated: He practices with insight that is engaged in signs, engaged in investigation, and engaged in analysis.

original: lhag mthong la gcig tu brtson pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong la gcig tu brtson pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He is not solely intent on insight.

original: yang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma las phyir bzlog nas /
analyzed: yang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma las phyir bzlog nas /
translated: Moreover, he turns away from the signs of insight.

original: zhi gnas kyi rnam pas dmigs pa de nyid yid la byed do //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rnam pas dmigs pa de nyid yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to that very object with the aspect of serenity.

original: des de'i tshe na dmigs pa de ma btang ma bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: des de'i tshe na dmigs pa de ma btang ma bzung ba yin te /
translated: At that time, he neither abandons nor grasps that object.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa de la zhi gnas su 'jug bar byed pa de'i phyir ni ma btang ba yin no //ğŸ”½gang gi phyir mar mi byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa de la zhi gnas su 'jug bar byed pa de'i phyir ni ma btang ba yin no // gang gi phyir mar mi byed cing /
translated: He does not abandon it because he enters into serenity with regard to that object.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de'i phyir ni ma bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de'i phyir ni ma bzung ba yin te /
translated: He does not grasp it because he does not conceive of it and does not conceptualize it.

original: de ltar na sems nang du mngon par sdud pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems nang du mngon par sdud pa'i sgo nas dmigs pa rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he cultivates the object by way of the mindâ€™s inner concentration.

original: de la lhag mthong gi mtshan ma ma bzung ba dang ldan pa'i @146a * //ğŸ”½dmigs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lhag mthong gi mtshan ma ma bzung ba dang ldan pa'i @146a * // dmigs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yin no //
translated: The object of insight is the absence of distraction, which is associated with the absence of the signs of insight.

original: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma bzung ba dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa ni shes bya'i dngos po'i mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma bzung ba dang ldan pa'i dmigs pa ni shes bya'i dngos po'i mtshan ma yin no //
translated: The object of serenity is the sign of the object of knowledge.

original: gal te de gcig tu dmigs pa la mos par byed la /
analyzed: gal te de gcig tu dmigs pa la mos par byed la /
translated: If one is devoted to the object of meditation,

original: yang dang yang du rnam par sgom par mi byed na /
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam par sgom par mi byed na /
translated: but does not cultivate it again and again,

original: de'i mos pa ni 'di lta ste shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gong nas gong du yongs su dag pa dang yongs su byang bar mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gang gi phyir mos par yang byed la /
analyzed: de'i mos pa ni 'di lta ste shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gong nas gong du yongs su dag pa dang yongs su byang bar mi 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir mos par yang byed la /
translated: then that devotion will not become purified and cleansed to a higher degree, in order to realize the object of knowledge directly.ğŸ”½But if one is devoted to the object of meditation,

original: yang dang yang du rnam par sgom par byed na ni /ğŸ”½de'i phyir de'i mos pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam par sgom par byed na ni /ğŸ”½de'i phyir de'i mos pa 'di lta ste /
translated: and cultivates it again and again,ğŸ”½then that devotion will become purified and cleansed to a higher degree, in order to realize the object of knowledge directly.

original: shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gong nas gong du ches yongs su dag pa dang / ches yongs su byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gong nas gong du ches yongs su dag pa dang / ches yongs su byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to realize the things that are to be known, they become more and more purified and more and more cleansed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na ri mo mkhan gyi slob ma zhig dang po kho nar ri mo'i las la brtson par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na ri mo mkhan gyi slob ma zhig dang po kho nar ri mo'i las la brtson par gyur na /
translated: For example, a student of painting, who is just beginning to work on a painting,

original: de slob dpon las bslab pa sngar byas shing dpe blangs pa las bltas shing bltas shing ri mo 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: de slob dpon las bslab pa sngar byas shing dpe blangs pa las bltas shing bltas shing ri mo 'dri bar byed do //
translated: having first received instruction from a master, looks at a model, and then paints.

original: bris shing bris shing rnam par dpyod par byed /
analyzed: bris shing bris shing rnam par dpyod par byed /
translated: Having painted, he examines it.

original: phyir 'byed par byed cing yang 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: phyir 'byed par byed cing yang 'dri bar byed do //
translated: He corrects it, and then paints again.

original: de ji lta ji ltar phyis shing phyis shing 'dri bar byed pa de lta de ltar gong nas gong du ri mo ches yongs su dag pa dang / ches yongs su byang bar snang ste /
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar phyis shing phyis shing 'dri bar byed pa de lta de ltar gong nas gong du ri mo ches yongs su dag pa dang / ches yongs su byang bar snang ste /
translated: The more he paints and repaints, the more his painting appears to be purified and cleansed.

original: de ltar legs par brtson par byed pa ni dus gzhan na ni /
analyzed: de ltar legs par brtson par byed pa ni dus gzhan na ni /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, who is engaged in this kind of practice,

original: slob dpon dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: slob dpon dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: after a long period of time,

original: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it becomes even more distinguished.

original: gal te ri mo de ma phyis par de nyid kyi steng du yang dang yang du 'dri bar byed na ni de'i ri mo de nam du yang yongs su byang bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te ri mo de ma phyis par de nyid kyi steng du yang dang yang du 'dri bar byed na ni de'i ri mo de nam du yang yongs su byang bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: If one does not wipe away the picture, but paints over it again and again, that picture will never be completely finished.

original: 'di la yang tshul bzhin de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul bzhin de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that this is also like that, in accordance with the principle.

original: de la dmigs pa ji tsam la mos par byed pa de tsam rnam par sgom par byed kyi ji tsam rnam par sgom par byed pa de tsam la mos par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ji tsam la mos par byed pa de tsam rnam par sgom par byed kyi ji tsam rnam par sgom par byed pa de tsam la mos par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: To the extent that one has confidence in the object, one cultivates it to that extent, but one does not have confidence in the object to the extent that one cultivates it.

original: chung du la mos par byed pa na yang chung du nyid rnam par sgom par byed la chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chung du la mos par byed pa na yang chung du nyid rnam par sgom par byed la chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: When one has confidence in the small, one cultivates the small, and when one has confidence in the great and the immeasurable, one cultivates them.

original: rnam par bsgoms nas kyang lan 'ga' ni chung du nyid la mos par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par bsgoms nas kyang lan 'ga' ni chung du nyid la mos par byed do //
translated: Having cultivated, sometimes one has confidence in the small.

original: lan 'ga' ni chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa la mos par byed de /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa la mos par byed de /
translated: Sometimes one has confidence in the great and the immeasurable.

original: chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the great and the immeasurable.

original: de la gzugs can gyi chos rnams kyi mtshan ma dang / @146b gzugs brnyan dang / snang brnyan gang yin pa de ni rags pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi chos rnams kyi mtshan ma dang / @146b gzugs brnyan dang / snang brnyan gang yin pa de ni rags pa ste /
translated: Among those, the sign, reflection, and appearance of material dharmas is coarse.

original: sbrul pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sbrul pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like an emanation.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'i ming dang brda sngon du btang ba tsam du zad de de ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang / snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'i ming dang brda sngon du btang ba tsam du zad de de ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For immaterial dharmas, it is merely the name and conventional term that are based on experience and appearance. That is called correct application.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnam pa dgu po de dag ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / rjes su mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba rnam pa dgu po de dag ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / rjes su mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those nine types of application on the side of virtue are to be known as being in accordance with Å›amatha, vipaÅ›yanÄ, and their union.

original: de las bzlog pa rnam pa dgu po ni mi mthun pa yin no //

analyzed: smras pa / de ltar yang dag par rab tu brtson par byed pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni /

analyzed: de la yongs su gdung ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dpen pa la brtson pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi 'dod pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: ye shes dang / mthong ba dang / reg par rang pa cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis bdag ni thob pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes rgyas par snga ma bzhin du nga rgyal byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi dbang dang / nad kyis yongs su nyon mongs pas lus nyam chung ba dang / ha cang brtson pa dang / @147a * //

analyzed: ngan pas brtson pa dang / dang po brtson pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / dben pa la goms pa'o //

analyzed: sgrib pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ni sgrib pa dang mthun pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa dang / bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing lan mang du byed pa ste /
translated: The basis of obscurations, discursive thought, and self-satisfaction is improper attention and frequent practice of phenomena that are conducive to obscurations, conducive to discursive thought, and conducive to self-satisfaction.

analyzed: de ni sgrib pa dang rnam par rtogs pa dang / bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: This is the basis of obscurations, discursive thought, and self-satisfaction.

analyzed: 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa yid la ma byas pas sdug pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, â€œincorrect mental activityâ€ is the mental activity of the pleasant, which is due to the non-cultivation of the unpleasant.

translated: Similarly, it is the mental activity of the signs of anger, which is due to the non-cultivation of loving kindness; the mental activity of the signs of darkness, which is due to the non-cultivation of the perception of light; the mental activity of the discursive thoughts of self and of the world, which is due to the non-cultivation of calm abiding;

original: sngon rtses pa dang bgad pa dang / dga' bar byas pa dang / dga' mgur spyad pa dag yid la byed pa dang / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas du sa gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la nga'o zhe'am bdag go zhes rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de ni 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: sngon rtses pa dang bgad pa dang / dga' bar byas pa dang / dga' mgur spyad pa dag yid la byed pa dang / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas du sa gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la nga'o zhe'am bdag go zhes rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de ni 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o
translated: the mental activity of recollecting oneâ€™s former enjoyments, laughter, amusements, and pleasures; and the mental activity of the perception that is generated by the incorrect reasoning that the formations of the three realms are â€œIâ€ or â€œmineâ€ in terms of the conditionality of dependent origination.

original: // de la nyes dmigs gang zhe na /

translated: then there is non-realization of what has not been realized, loss of what has been realized, loss of the application of yoga, abiding in affliction, abiding in suffering, self-condemnation,

analyzed: gzhan gyis smad pa dang / lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu na song rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la yongs su gdung ba'i gnyen po ni rjes su dran pa dag ste /

analyzed: yongs su gdung ba skyes pa ni sel bar byed la /

original: de la lus @147b nyam chung ba gang yin pa dang / ha cang brtson pa gang yin pa dang / dang po brtson pa gang yin pa'i gnyen po ni de la brtson 'grus rang par brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lus @147b nyam chung ba gang yin pa dang / ha cang brtson pa gang yin pa dang / dang po brtson pa gang yin pa'i gnyen po ni de la brtson 'grus rang par brtson pa yin no //
translated: The remedy for the weakness of the body, for excessive exertion, and for initial exertion is to exert oneself with moderation.

analyzed: ngan bas brtson pa gang yin pa'i gnyen po ni de la gus par yongs su 'dri ba yin no //

translated: The remedy for the abundance of afflictions is to apply oneself to the objects of meditation for purification, such as the loathsome and so on, as is appropriate.

original: dben pa la ma goms pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po ni 'di ltar so sor rtog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dben pa la ma goms pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po ni 'di ltar so sor rtog par byed pa yin te /
translated: The remedy for not being accustomed to solitude is to reflect in the following way:

original: bdag gis sngon yang goms par byas pas des na /
analyzed: bdag gis sngon yang goms par byas pas des na /
translated: â€œFormerly, I was not accustomed to solitude.

original: da ltar bdag dben pa la rab tu brtson pa na /
analyzed: da ltar bdag dben pa la rab tu brtson pa na /
translated: Now, when I am exerting myself in solitude,

original: yongs su gdung ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba skye bar 'gyur te /

translated: Therefore, I will abandon what is unpleasant and take up what is pleasant, having examined this for myself.

analyzed: sgrib pa lhag ma rnams kyi gnyen po ni / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed ba las bzlog pa /
translated: The remedy for the remaining obscurations should be understood as follows:ğŸ”½The remedy for the obscurations of laziness is the cultivation of the will to be free,

analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa sgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the remedy for the obscurations of inappropriate action is the cultivation of proper mental activity.

original: de la ngo bo nyid yongs su shes nas sgrib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas /ğŸ”½'di ni yongs su spang par bya ba yin no zhes gzhi yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid yongs su shes nas sgrib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas / 'di ni yongs su spang par bya ba yin no zhes gzhi yongs su spangs nas /
translated: Having understood their nature, he abandons the basis of the obscurations, the afflictions, and the dark side, thinking,ğŸ”½â€œThis is to be abandoned.â€ğŸ”½Having abandoned the basis, he seeks the basis of their abandonment, thinking,

original: de yang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhi yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhi yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: â€œThat will also be abandoned.â€

original: yongs su ma spangs na /
analyzed: yongs su ma spangs na /
translated: If they are not abandoned,

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba de la nyes pa ci yod ces de'i phyir nyes dmigs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba de la nyes pa ci yod ces de'i phyir nyes dmigs yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: What is the danger in that which is to be thoroughly abandoned? Thus, he seeks the danger.

original: yongs su spang pa de la phyis ji ltar mi skye bar 'gyur zhes de'i phyir gnyen po sgom par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su spang pa de la phyis ji ltar mi skye bar 'gyur zhes de'i phyir gnyen po sgom par byed de /
translated: How can that which is to be thoroughly abandoned not arise again in the future? Thus, he cultivates the counteragent.

original: de ltar na nges sgrib pa dag las sems rnam par sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nges sgrib pa dag las sems rnam par sbyang ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the mind is purified from obscurations.

original: de la de ji tsam du lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i bshad pa mang po de tsam du ni lhag mthong mang ba yin no /
analyzed: de la de ji tsam du lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i bshad pa mang po de tsam du ni lhag mthong mang ba yin no /
translated: To the extent that there is an abundance of explanations that are conducive to insight, to that extent there is an abundance of insight.

analyzed: de ji tsam du lhag mthong mang ba de tsam du ni zhi gnas kyang mang ba yin no //

analyzed: lhag mthong de yang shes bya mtha' yas pa'i phyir mtha' yas par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that insight should be known as infinite because the knowable is infinite.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: sgo gsum dang / gzhi rab tu dbye ba drug po de dag re re'i rnam pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dag la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: through the three doors and the six categories, and through the method of engagement with the aspects and divisions of each of those.

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar yang dag par rab tu brtson pa'i lhag mthong goms pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i @148a * //
translated: And the more he cultivates insight that is correctly applied, the more his body and mind will become fit for work.

original: stobs kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: stobs kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: This is the power of purification.

original: yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par gyur pa de lta de ltar lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa skyed par byed pa zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyang yangs pa dang / 'phel ba dang / rgyas par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½ji lta ji ltar de'i lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa de lta de ltar dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa nyid rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur la /

translated: And the more his body and mind become fit for work, the more he will experience physical and mental pliancy, which is the side of serenity.ğŸ”½And the more he experiences physical and mental pliancy, the more his one-pointed concentration on the object will increase.

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sems rtse gcig pa nyid rnam par 'phel ba de ltar de ltar lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba yang rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: And the more his one-pointed concentration increases, the more his physical and mental pliancy will increase.

original: chos gnyis po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos gnyis po 'di lta ste /
translated: These two factors

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / shin tu sbyangs pa de dag ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig la gcig rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / shin tu sbyangs pa de dag ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig la gcig rag las pa yin no //
translated: One-pointedness of mind and pliancy are mutually dependent and mutually supportive.

analyzed: 'di lta ste sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i chos de gnyis kyi mtha' ni 'di yin te /
translated: These two dharmas, one-pointedness of mind and pliancy, have this as their limit:

analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no /
translated: namely, the transformation of the basis.

analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa na shes bya'i dngos po la mngon sum gyi shes pa skye'o //

analyzed: de la ji tsam gyis sa na mi sdug pa thob pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa des mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba kun du bsten cing goms par byas /

analyzed: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus na /

original: rgyu yang rung /
analyzed: rgyu yang rung /
translated: whether in a cause or

original: gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: in a place,

analyzed: yul mngon du gyur cing mtshan mar so sor brtags su zin kyang /
translated: Even though the object is manifest and you have examined it with its signs,

original: mngon par 'du byed par rang bzhin gyis mi sdug pa nyid du ches mang du snang ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed par rang bzhin gyis mi sdug pa nyid du ches mang du snang ste /
translated: you still see the natural repulsiveness of the body as something that is very much present.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because
