analyzed: mi sdug pa shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems 'jug par mi 'gyur / dga' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: you have become very familiar with the repulsive.ğŸ”½Your mind does not engage with, does not delight in, and does not become absorbed in those things that arouse desire and passion.

original: mos par mi 'gyur zhing btang snyoms dang / yid 'byung ba dang mi mthun par kun du gnas na /ğŸ”½rnal 'byor bas bdag ni mi sdug pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mos par mi 'gyur zhing btang snyoms dang / yid 'byung ba dang mi mthun par kun du gnas na / rnal 'byor bas bdag ni mi sdug pa thob pa yin no //
translated: You remain indifferent and disgusted with them.

original: bdag ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhes rig par bya ste /ğŸ”½de tsam gyis na mi sdug pa thob pa yin no /
analyzed: bdag ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhes rig par bya ste / de tsam gyis na mi sdug pa thob pa yin no /
translated: The practitioner should understand that he or she has attained the meditation on the repulsive.ğŸ”½This is the extent of the attainment of the meditation on the repulsive.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is the non-attainment.

original: mi sdug pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mi sdug pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the meditation on the repulsive,

original: byams pa dang rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs @148b 'byung ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dran pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs @148b 'byung ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dran pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the same for the mindfulness of loving kindness, the dependent origination of this very condition, the classification of the elements, and the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod re /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod re /
translated: Here is the difference.

original: byams pa'i sems ches mang dus snang la /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems ches mang dus snang la /
translated: The mind of loving kindness appears more frequently,ğŸ”½and the mind of anger does not arise, and one does not engage the mind in dharmas associated with malice.ğŸ”½One should elaborate. Unwholesomeness appears more frequently,

original: khong khro ba'i sems med pa dang / gnod sems dang ldan pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par chos mang du snang la /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i sems med pa dang / gnod sems dang ldan pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par chos mang du snang la /
translated: and the mind of non-greed does not arise, and one does not engage the mind in dharmas associated with craving.ğŸ”½One should elaborate.ğŸ”½Dharmas associated with impermanence, suffering, and no-self appear more frequently,ğŸ”½and the mind of permanence, happiness, and the view of the transitory collection does not arise, and one does not engage the mind in signs that lead to delusion and dharmas that accord with delusion.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa med pa dang / kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa med pa dang / kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang /
translated: One should elaborate.

original: khams sna tshogs pa dang / khams du ma pa'i lus la ril por rab tu 'byed pa'i 'du shes ches mang du snang la /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa dang / khams du ma pa'i lus la ril por rab tu 'byed pa'i 'du shes ches mang du snang la /
translated: In the body with its various elements and many elements, the perception of a unified whole appears very much,ğŸ”½but the perception of a unified whole itself does not appear, and the mind does not engage with things that are consistent with the entanglement of pride.

original: ril po'i 'du shes nyid med pa dang / nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang / nang nye bar zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / zhi gnas kyi 'du shes ches mang du snang la /
analyzed: ril po'i 'du shes nyid med pa dang / nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba dang / nang nye bar zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / zhi gnas kyi 'du shes ches mang du snang la /
translated: In the body with its various elements and many elements, the perception of inner peace and the perception of calm abiding appear very much,

original: spros pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: spros pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug go zhes rgyas par bya ba'o //
translated: but the perception of elaboration does not appear, and the mind does not engage with things that are consistent with the entanglement of discursive thought.

original: de la ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur cing /
analyzed: de la ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur cing /
translated: To what extent are calm abiding and insight mixed?ğŸ”½To what extent are they evenly united?

original: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa dang / gang gis na zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa dang / gang gis na zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam zhes bya zhe na /
translated: And by what means is it called the path of their union?

original: smras pa / sems gnas pa rnam par dgu dag la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sems gnas pa rnam par dgu dag la 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said: In the nine mental states of abiding, namely,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa dgu po gnag yin pa de thob par gyur cing de ting nge 'dzin yongs su grub pa de la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa la rab tu brtson par byed do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa dgu po gnag yin pa de thob par gyur cing de ting nge 'dzin yongs su grub pa de la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa la rab tu brtson par byed do //
translated: Having attained the nine aspects of meditative equipoise, on the basis of that perfected meditative stabilization, he strives to discern phenomena with superior discerning wisdom.

original: de'i tshe ni chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa de'i lam rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang rtsol ba med par 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa de'i lam rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang rtsol ba med par 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: At that time, the path of discerning phenomena becomes automatic and effortless.

original: zhi gnas kyi lam ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'du byed pa med pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi lam ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'du byed pa med pas /
translated: Without the application of the path of serenity,

original: lhag mthong yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / zhi gnas kyi rjes su song ba dang / nyams bde bas yongs su zin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag mthong yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / zhi gnas kyi rjes su song ba dang / nyams bde bas yongs su zin par 'gyur te /
translated: his discerning wisdom becomes pure, cleansed, in accord with serenity, and imbued with bliss.

original: de'i phyir de'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur cing mnyam par zung du 'jug pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba yin //
translated: and the mental engagement of the one who has practiced.ğŸ”½The mental engagement of the beginnerğŸ”½is the mental engagement of the beginner

analyzed: de la yid la byed pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: and the mental engagement of the one who has practiced.ğŸ”½The mental engagement of the beginner

original: smras pa / de ltar khyab pa'i mtshan nyid rnams par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar khyab pa'i mtshan nyid rnams par gzhag pa la /
translated: He replied: â€œIn this way, the characteristics of pervasion are established.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sgrib pa rnams par sbyong ba'i log par sbyor ba spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sgrib pa rnams par sbyong ba'i log par sbyor ba spong bar byed cing /
translated: One abandons the false practice of one-pointedness of mind and the purification of obscurations.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la slob par byed pa'i las dang po las thog ma pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la slob par byed pa'i las dang po las thog ma pa ste /
translated: One trains in the correct practice, which is the beginning of the beginner.ğŸ”½First, one should attain one-pointedness of mind and delight in abandonment. One should attend to these four thoughts.

original: dang por sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / spong ba la mngon par dga' ba thob par bya'o zhes yid la byed pa rnams bzhi rab tu btsun par byed do // bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dang por sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / spong ba la mngon par dga' ba thob par bya'o zhes yid la byed pa rnams bzhi rab tu btsun par byed do // bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yin la byed pa dang / sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa dang / shin tu sbyang pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa dang / ye shes dang mthong ba rnams par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yin la byed pa dang / sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa dang / shin tu sbyang pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa dang / ye shes dang mthong ba rnams par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pas so //
translated: The thought that causes mental torment, the thought that moistens the mind, the thought that generates pliancy, and the thought that purifies wisdom and insight.

original: de la sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the thought that causes mental torment?

original: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pa ste /
translated: He said, â€œIt is the mental attention by which one causes the mind to be distressed with regard to those things that are conducive to distress.

original: de ni sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems kun du gdung bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the mental attention that causes the mind to be distressed.

original: de la sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: â€œWhat is the mental attention that causes the mind to be moistened?â€

original: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang ma thun pa'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang ma thun pa'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byed pa ste /
translated: He said, â€œIt is the mental attention by which one causes the mind to delight with regard to those things that are conducive to delight.

original: de ni sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //ğŸ”½de la shin tu sbyangs pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems mngon par brlan par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no // de la shin tu sbyangs pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the mental attention that causes the mind to be moistened.

original: de la shin tu sbyangs pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pa skyed pa'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: â€œWhat is the mental attention that generates pliancy?â€ğŸ”½He said, â€œIt is the mental attention by which one generates pliancy.

original: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byas shing /
analyzed: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis de dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byas shing /
translated: He replied: â€œThe attention that, from time to time, causes the mind to be weary of the things that are conducive to weariness,

original: dus dus sum mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byas nas /ğŸ”½sems nang du zhi bar byed cing /
analyzed: dus dus sum mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byas nas / sems nang du zhi bar byed cing /
translated: and, from time to time, causes the mind to delight in the things that are conducive to delight,ğŸ”½and, having done so,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang rnam par rtog pa me dang @149b la nye bar 'jog par yang byed la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang rnam par rtog pa me dang @149b la nye bar 'jog par yang byed la /
translated: causes the mind to be placed in a state of non-conceptuality and non-mentation,

analyzed: dran pa rtse gcig pa la yang 'jug par byed de /
translated: and causes it to be placed in a state of one-pointed mindfulness,

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po lus dang sems rab tu tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po lus dang sems rab tu tshim par byed pa /
translated: by that cause and that condition, causes the body and mind to be nourished with the antidote to the unwholesome tendencies of the body and mind,

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: and causes the body to be well-postured and the mind to be well-postured.

original: de ni shin tu sbyangs ba skyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu sbyangs ba skyed pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention that generates well-posturedness.

original: de la ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhen /
analyzed: de la ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pa gang zhen /
translated: What is the attention that purifies wisdom and insight?

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas de nyid la brten na /
analyzed: nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas de nyid la brten na /
translated: Based on the inner mental stability,

original: de ltar sems nang du yang dag par rab tu zhi ba'i yid la byed pa des /
analyzed: de ltar sems nang du yang dag par rab tu zhi ba'i yid la byed pa des /
translated: through the attention that fully pacifies the mind within,

original: dus dus su lhag pa'i shes rab chos rnam par 'byed pa la yang dang yang du phyir zhing phyir zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa ste /
analyzed: dus dus su lhag pa'i shes rab chos rnam par 'byed pa la yang dang yang du phyir zhing phyir zhing rnal 'byor du byed pa ste /
translated: from time to time one repeatedly and continuously practices the discernment of wisdom and the analysis of phenomena.

original: de ni ye shes dang / mthong ba rnam par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes dang / mthong ba rnam par sbyong ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention that purifies wisdom and insight.

original: de de ltar dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de de ltar dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pas na /

analyzed: de'i sems de 'di lta ste /

analyzed: zag pa rnams zag pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la gdung ba dang / kun du gdung ba dang / skyo ba dang / kun du skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mind becomes distressed, greatly distressed, weary, and greatly weary of the defilements and the phenomena that accord with the defilements.

analyzed: de la kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / smras pa bzhi ste /
translated: What are the phenomena that are conducive to complete disenchantment?ğŸ”½It was stated:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyus kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa'i gnas yin pa'o //

analyzed: de de ltar dus dus su mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byed pa na /

translated: The dharmas that are conducive to joy

analyzed: 'jam pa dang / snum pa dang / gsher ba dang / rlan pa dang / shin tu dang ba dang / rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci bdag gis bya ba dag byas shing mi bya ba dag ma byas pa yin nam ma yin / mdor na bdag 'di lta ste /
translated: Have I done what should be done and not done what should not be done?ğŸ”½In brief, am I endowed with the higher intention and application with regard to the bases of training or not?

original: sems kyi tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: is a synonym for the mind that is directed toward tranquility, because it is the oil of the fitness of body and mind.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œa man with a sword held over his headâ€

original: gshed ma'i mi ral gri gzas pa thogs pa zhes bya ba de ni mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag la sngon nyes dmigs kyi mtshan mar bzung ba'i tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: gshed ma'i mi ral gri gzas pa thogs pa zhes bya ba de ni mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag la sngon nyes dmigs kyi mtshan mar bzung ba'i tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: is a synonym for the signs, thoughts, and secondary afflictions, because they are held as the signs of danger.

original: thigs pa gcig tsam yangs la mi bo bar legs pa kho nar khyer te zhe bya ba de ni /
analyzed: thigs pa gcig tsam yangs la mi bo bar legs pa kho nar khyer te zhe bya ba de ni /
translated: The phrase â€œnot spilling even a dropâ€

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yongs su shes pa la sems gtad pas /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yongs su shes pa la sems gtad pas /
translated: is a synonym for the mind that is directed toward the knowledge of distraction and nondistraction.

original: yongs su zin pa'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi tshig bla dags yin te /
analyzed: yongs su zin pa'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyi tshig bla dags yin te /
translated: It is a designation for the path of serenity that is fully possessed.

original: des na de'i sems kyi rgyud dang / sems kyi rgyun thams cad brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis rim gyis mthar chags su mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing /ğŸ”½mtshan ma la dmigs pa'am /ğŸ”½rna par rtog pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: des na de'i sems kyi rgyud dang / sems kyi rgyun thams cad brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis rim gyis mthar chags su mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing / mtshan ma la dmigs pa'am / rna par rtog pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Therefore, by the power of his effort, the entire continuum of his mind and all its states are gradually and sequentially brought to the absence of signs, the absence of conceptualization, and complete pacification.ğŸ”½He should not generate any thought that observes signs,ğŸ”½that observes conceptualization,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o //

original: rnal 'byor pa des zhi gnas la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po ba de la 'di skad rjes su 'doms par yang byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des zhi gnas la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po ba de la 'di skad rjes su 'doms par yang byed de /
translated: That yogin who is a beginner and is striving in serenity should be instructed as follows:

original: bzhin bzangs khyod ni ci tsam du de ltar thabs kyis yongs su zin cing dran pa nag /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs khyod ni ci tsam du de ltar thabs kyis yongs su zin cing dran pa nag /
translated: â€œDear sir, to the extent that you are fully possessed of such methods,

analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i zhi gnas kyi lam la rab tu brtson par byed cing /
translated: you should strive in the path of serenity that is endowed with mindfulness and introspection.

original: sems mngon par dga' ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba de tsam du /
analyzed: sems mngon par dga' ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba de tsam du /

analyzed: khrod kyis zhi gnas kyi lam nyid bsgom par bya'o // gal te ma goms pa'i nyes pas mngon par mi dga' zhing 'khrug pa dang bcas pa la bsgrims te /

original: bya dgos par snang na /
analyzed: bya dgos par snang na /
translated: If, due to the fault of not being accustomed to it, you are not pleased and are distracted, and it seems that you must make an effort,ğŸ”½then

analyzed: de'i tshe myur ba myur ba kho nar rnam bar rtog pa med pa'i dmigs pa de las langs te /
translated: you should quickly rise from that object of meditation that lacks discursive thought

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gtad par bya ste /

original: khyod kyis sngar mi sdug ba'i mtshan ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis sngar mi sdug ba'i mtshan ma 'di lta ste /
translated: You should think, The sign of ugliness that you have apprehended,

analyzed: rnam par bsdos pa'am /

original: rnam par rnags pa nas rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid la dang po kho nar mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gis yid la gyis shig / de ltar rab tu brtson bar byed pa na /
analyzed: rnam par rnags pa nas rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid la dang po kho nar mtshan ma tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gis yid la gyis shig / de ltar rab tu brtson bar byed pa na /
translated: a corpse with a discolored livid hue, or a skeleton, is just a sign that you have taken hold of.

original: dang po kho nar rnam par bsngos pa gcig la mos par gyis shig dang / des na de la khyod kyi sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / 'od gsal bar @155b 'gyur zhing dmigs pa de la mos par yang 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½des na rnam par bsdos pa gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgya dang / stong nas rnam par bsdos pa'i rnam pa tshad med pas phyogs dang /ğŸ”½phyogs mtshams thams cad 'dab chags su yongs su gang ste /
analyzed: dang po kho nar rnam par bsngos pa gcig la mos par gyis shig dang / des na de la khyod kyi sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / 'od gsal bar @155b 'gyur zhing dmigs pa de la mos par yang 'gyur ro // des na rnam par bsdos pa gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgya dang / stong nas rnam par bsdos pa'i rnam pa tshad med pas phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams thams cad 'dab chags su yongs su gang ste /
translated: First, you should visualize a single bloated corpse, and then, as your mind becomes trained, you should visualize two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, and so on, until you can finally visualize the entire ground covered with bloated corpses as far as the horizon.

original: de dag gi bar skabs tha na khar ba'i rtse mo gzugs pa'i gtos tsam yang med par mos par gyis shig / rnam par bsngos pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag la yang de bzhin du mos par gyis shig /
analyzed: de dag gi bar skabs tha na khar ba'i rtse mo gzugs pa'i gtos tsam yang med par mos par gyis shig / rnam par bsngos pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag la yang de bzhin du mos par gyis shig /
translated: You should visualize the entire ground covered with skeletons, as far as the horizon.

original: // / nyan thos kyi sa bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: // / nyan thos kyi sa bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: The ÅšrÄvaka Levels says:

analyzed: khyod kyis mos pa yid la byed pa de nyid la brten la yang dag pa yid la byed pa la yang 'jug par bya ste /
translated: â€œYou should engage in the correct mental activity on the basis of just that mental activity of devoted interest.

original: 'di ltar zhugs shig / bdag gis rnam par bsngos pa dang rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag ji snyed cig la mos par byed pa de bas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhugs shig / bdag gis rnam par bsngos pa dang rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar dag ji snyed cig la mos par byed pa de bas ni /

original: bdag gi sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gi sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te /
translated: the extent to which I have devoted interest in the stages of decay of my own body from the beginning of time,

original: srid pa dang / 'gro ba de dang de dag tu bdag 'chi 'pho zhing skye ba dag na /
analyzed: srid pa dang / 'gro ba de dang de dag tu bdag 'chi 'pho zhing skye ba dag na /
translated: in my deaths and rebirths in this and that cyclic existence,

original: shi zhing dus la 'das par gyur pa'i rnam par bsngos par gyur pa gang dag yin pa dang / rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ches tshad med pa yin te /
analyzed: shi zhing dus la 'das par gyur pa'i rnam par bsngos par gyur pa gang dag yin pa dang / rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ches tshad med pa yin te /
translated: in those who have died and passed away and become corpses, up to those who have become skeletons, is immeasurable.

original: de dag gi sngon gyi mtha' ni mi mngon no //
analyzed: de dag gi sngon gyi mtha' ni mi mngon no //
translated: The beginning of that is not evident.

original: gal te de ltar gyur pa de dag la la zhig gis bsdus shing bsdus nas kyang zhig bar ma gyur /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur pa de dag la la zhig gis bsdus shing bsdus nas kyang zhig bar ma gyur /
translated: If someone were to collect all those and, having collected them, they did not decay,

original: rul bar ma gyur du zin na /
analyzed: rul bar ma gyur du zin na /
translated: If they did not rot,

original: gang du de dag shod bar 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs kyang med do //
analyzed: gang du de dag shod bar 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs kyang med do //
translated: there would be no place for them to be discarded.ğŸ”½If there were someone to collect all the blue-blacks,

original: bskal pa gcig gis rnam par bsngos pa nas ras pa'i keng rus kyi bar de dag kyang sdud par byed pa 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gis rnam par bsngos pa nas ras pa'i keng rus kyi bar de dag kyang sdud par byed pa 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /

analyzed: de dag bsdus pa'i phung po yang ri ngos tsam mo //
translated: the pile of bones would be as large as Mount Meru.

original: sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams ba ji lta ba bzhin du ji srid sdug bsngal mthar phyin par ma gyur gyi bar du phyi ma'i mtha'i yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams ba ji lta ba bzhin du ji srid sdug bsngal mthar phyin par ma gyur gyi bar du phyi ma'i mtha'i yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as it was in the past, so it will be in the future, until the end of suffering.

analyzed: de ltar khyod kyis mos pa yid la byed pa la brten nas yang dag pa yid la byed pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, you will enter into correct mental attention on the basis of mental attention that is directed to aspiration.

original: lhag mthong la rab tu brtson bas rnam par bsngos pa dang / rus ba'i keng rus kyi bar de dag la lan cig rnam par blta bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhag mthong la rab tu brtson bas rnam par bsngos pa dang / rus ba'i keng rus kyi bar de dag la lan cig rnam par blta bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: One who is striving for insight should not look at the blue-blacks, and so on, up to the skeletons, just once.

original: rnam par bsngos pa gcig kho na la mos par byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa gcig kho na la mos par byas nas /
translated: Having focused on just one bloated corpse,

original: yang sems zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: yang sems zhi bar byas te /
translated: he should again pacify his mind.

original: @156a * // ji srid du dmigs pa de nyid du mngon par dga' ba dang / 'od gsal ba dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / kun nas dkris pa med pa dang / bsgrims te bya mi dgos pa de srid du rnam bar bsngos pa de la mos bar bya'o //ğŸ”½de nas ji srid du dmigs pa de la bsgrims te ;
analyzed: @156a * // ji srid du dmigs pa de nyid du mngon par dga' ba dang / 'od gsal ba dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / kun nas dkris pa med pa dang / bsgrims te bya mi dgos pa de srid du rnam bar bsngos pa de la mos bar bya'o // de nas ji srid du dmigs pa de la bsgrims te ;
translated: He should focus on that very object until he has a sense of mental satisfaction, clarity, non-discursiveness, non-dissipation, and does not need to make an effort to be mindful.

original: bya dgos pa'i bar du sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: bya dgos pa'i bar du sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar byas te /
translated: Then, as long as he needs to make an effort to be mindful, he should again pacify his mind and settle it internally.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar cig dang / tshad med pa'i bar dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rus pa'i keng rus kyi bar cig dang / tshad med pa'i bar dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: As with the bloated corpse, he should understand the same process to occur with the remaining corpses, up to the insubstantial.

original: sems nang du zhi bar byas shing yang dag par zhi bar byas nas yang mos par bya ste /
analyzed: sems nang du zhi bar byas shing yang dag par zhi bar byas nas yang mos par bya ste /
translated: Having pacified and settled his mind internally, he should again focus on the object.

original: des na thams cad kyi tha mar sems nang du mngon par bsdus pas rnam par bsngos pa tshad med pa dang / rus pa'i keng rus tshad med pa'i bar dag rnam par 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: des na thams cad kyi tha mar sems nang du mngon par bsdus pas rnam par bsngos pa tshad med pa dang / rus pa'i keng rus tshad med pa'i bar dag rnam par 'jog par byed cing /
translated: Thus, in the end, by fully drawing the mind inward, one establishes immeasurable blue-blacks and immeasurable skeletons.

original: snang ba med ba nyid la 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: snang ba med ba nyid la 'jog par byed la /
translated: One establishes the absence of appearances.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma de dag kyang spong bar mi byed cing rnam par rtog par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma de dag kyang spong bar mi byed cing rnam par rtog par yang mi byed la /
translated: One does not abandon those conceptualized signs, nor does one conceptualize them.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la sems mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi bar 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la sems mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi bar 'jog par byed do //
translated: One establishes the mind on that very object without signs, without conceptuality, and in complete peace.

original: de la yang lung 'bogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang lung 'bogs par byed do //
translated: One also recites the scriptures.

original: bzhin bzangs khyod kyis dang po kho nar snang ba'i mtshan ma gzung ba gang yin pa la /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs khyod kyis dang po kho nar snang ba'i mtshan ma gzung ba gang yin pa la /
translated: â€œGood man, you first apprehend the signs of appearances.

original: khyod kyis zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi sbyor ba yid la gyis shig / snang ba dang ldan pa dang / 'od dang ldan pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang / mun pa med pa'i sems kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang sgoms shig ;
analyzed: khyod kyis zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi sbyor ba yid la gyis shig / snang ba dang ldan pa dang / 'od dang ldan pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang / mun pa med pa'i sems kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang sgoms shig ;
translated: You should cultivate Å›amatha and vipaÅ›yanÄ with a mind that is bright, radiant, clear, and free of darkness.

original: khyod de ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam la snang ba'i 'du shes sgom pa na /
analyzed: khyod de ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi lam la snang ba'i 'du shes sgom pa na /
translated: â€œWhen you cultivate the perception of light on the path of Å›amatha and vipaÅ›yanÄ,

original: gal te dang po nyid nas dmigs pa la mos pa rnam par mi gsal zhing snang ba mtshungs par gyur na yang /
analyzed: gal te dang po nyid nas dmigs pa la mos pa rnam par mi gsal zhing snang ba mtshungs par gyur na yang /
translated: if at first your conviction in the object is unclear and the light is not bright,

original: bsgom pa goms par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen des dmigs pa la mos pa rnam par gsal ba dang / snang ba chen po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa goms par byed pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen des dmigs pa la mos pa rnam par gsal ba dang / snang ba chen po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then through the cause and condition of cultivating that meditation, your conviction in the object will become clear and the light will become bright.

original: gal te dang po nyid nas rnam par gsal ba dang / snang ba chen por gyur ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dang po nyid nas rnam par gsal ba dang / snang ba chen por gyur ba yin na ni /
translated: If at first your conviction in the object is clear and the light is bright,

original: de'i phyir zhing rgya cher shin tu rnam par gsal ba dang / shin tu snang ba chen po nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhing rgya cher shin tu rnam par gsal ba dang / shin tu snang ba chen po nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it becomes vast, very clear, and very bright.

original: khyod kyis de ltar kun du skyo bar 'gyur @156b ba'i mtshan ma legs par bzung ba dang / rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma dang / snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par bzung bas dus dus su sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar gyis shig / mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gi chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye bar yang gis shig /'di lta ste /ğŸ”½mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar kun du skyo bar 'gyur @156b ba'i mtshan ma legs par bzung ba dang / rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma dang / snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par bzung bas dus dus su sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar gyis shig / mtshan ma tsam gyis rjes su 'brang ba'i lhag mthong gi chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye bar yang gis shig /'di lta ste / mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: You should properly take up the signs of complete disenchantment, the signs of faith, the signs of Å›amatha, the signs of vipaÅ›yanÄ, and the signs of illumination. From time to time, you should pacify the mind internally with just those signs. You should also properly discern the phenomena that are followed by vipaÅ›yanÄ with just those signs.ğŸ”½In this way,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la yang 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la yang 'jug par bya ste /
translated: you should also engage the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar 'jug par gyis shig / phyi rol gyi lus la skra la sogs pa nas bshad ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du mi sdug pa'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi mtshan ma bzung nas rang gi lus la yang mi sdug pa'i rdzas kyi mtshan ma de dag
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug par gyis shig / phyi rol gyi lus la skra la sogs pa nas bshad ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du mi sdug pa'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi mtshan ma bzung nas rang gi lus la yang mi sdug pa'i rdzas kyi mtshan ma de dag
translated: you should imagine that all of those signs of impure substances are present in your own body.

original: thams cad mos par gyis shig / mos par byas shing mos par byas nas kyang sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar gyis shig dang / de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad mos par gyis shig / mos par byas shing mos par byas nas kyang sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar gyis shig dang / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having imagined them, you should pacify your mind and settle it inwardly.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang gi lus las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang gi lus las brtsams nas /
translated: In this way, beginning with your own internal body,

original: khyod kyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag ba la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag ba la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: you will engage in the application of mindfulness that observes the body in relation to your own internal body.

original: yang khyod kyis phyi rol gyi lus kyi mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma bzung bas /
analyzed: yang khyod kyis phyi rol gyi lus kyi mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma bzung bas /
translated: Moreover, because you have apprehended the signs of the external bodyâ€™s impurity,

original: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rus gong dang / rus pa'i keng rus chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i bar dag la mos par gyis shig / mos par byas shing mos par byas nas kyang sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar byos shig dang /ğŸ”½de ni 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi lus las brtsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rus gong dang / rus pa'i keng rus chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i bar dag la mos par gyis shig / mos par byas shing mos par byas nas kyang sems nang du yang dag par zhi bar byos shig dang / de ni 'di lta ste / gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi lus las brtsams nas /
translated: Having been intent and become intent, you should pacify the mind internally.

original: khyod kyi phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is how you should engage in the application of mindfulness that observes the external body in relation to the external body of another.

original: yang khyod kyis bdag nyid kyi nang gi lus la mi sdug pa nyid du yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems dang / gzhan gyi nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la mi sdug pa nyid du yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis bdag nyid 'chi bar mos par gyis shig / shi nas kyang dur khrod du khyer ba dang /ğŸ”½khyer nas kyang dur khrod du bor ba dang / bor nas kyang rnam par bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs dang / rnam par rnags @157a * //
analyzed: yang khyod kyis bdag nyid kyi nang gi lus la mi sdug pa nyid du yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems dang / gzhan gyi nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la mi sdug pa nyid du yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems kyis bdag nyid 'chi bar mos par gyis shig / shi nas kyang dur khrod du khyer ba dang / khyer nas kyang dur khrod du bor ba dang / bor nas kyang rnam par bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs dang / rnam par rnags @157a * //
translated: You should imagine that you die, and that after death your body is carried to the charnel ground.ğŸ”½You should imagine that it is thrown on the charnel ground, and that it is left there, and that it is contemplated as it decays,

original: pa'i gnas skabs dang / rus pa'i keng rus kyi gnas skabs kyi bar du gyur bar mos par gyis shig dang / de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs dang / rus pa'i keng rus kyi gnas skabs kyi bar du gyur bar mos par gyis shig dang / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: as it becomes a skeleton, and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus las brtsams nas /
translated: In this way, beginning with your own body and the bodies of others,

original: khyod kyi nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: you should enter into the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the inner and outer body.

original: yang khyod kyis phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag la thos pa dang / bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba yongs su rtog pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pas /
analyzed: yang khyod kyis phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag la thos pa dang / bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba yongs su rtog pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pas /
translated: Moreover, you should understand that the four non-physical aggregates are the signs of the conceptualization that arises from hearing and reflection.ğŸ”½You should understand that the three aspects are the side of calm abiding, the side of distraction, and the side of insight.

original: cha gsum po zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs rnams su mos bar gyis shig / de la zhi gnas kyi phyogs la ni gang gi tshe sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa na de la mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: cha gsum po zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs rnams su mos bar gyis shig / de la zhi gnas kyi phyogs la ni gang gi tshe sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed pa na de la mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: With regard to the side of calm abiding, when the mind is inwardly focused, it is signless,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa dang / spro ba med pa dang / kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa dang / spro ba med pa dang / kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang /
translated: non-conceptual, and has the aspect of complete peace. It is without distraction, without excitement, without agitation, and is not reliable.

original: sdug pa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la dmigs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la dmigs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four formless aggregates of feeling, etc., which are the aspects of the perception of beauty and the object of non-distraction,

original: skad cig re re dang / skad cig re re la gzhan dang / gzhan du sar ba sar ba dang / rnying pa ma yin pa dang / rnying pa ma yin par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no zhes mos par gyis shig dang / de ni khyod kyi nang gi tshor ba rnams dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re dang / skad cig re re la gzhan dang / gzhan du sar ba sar ba dang / rnying pa ma yin pa dang / rnying pa ma yin par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no zhes mos par gyis shig dang / de ni khyod kyi nang gi tshor ba rnams dang /
translated: are fresh, fresh, not old, not old, and are different, different, from one moment to the next.ğŸ”½This is the way to enter the mindfulness of observing phenomena, which is the internal feeling,

original: sems dang chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems dang chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: mind and phenomena.

original: khyod kyis sngon yul nye bar len par byed pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon yul nye bar len par byed pa /
translated: You have previously taken the country as your object.

original: yul la dmigs par byed pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa par rtogs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa ming gi phung po gzugs can ma yin ba bzhi po mngon par 'dus shing zad pa gang dag yin pa rnams dang / da ltar brjed ngas pas sems rnam par g-yeng ba na mtshan ma dang /ğŸ”½rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag ni byung nas /
analyzed: yul la dmigs par byed pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa par rtogs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa ming gi phung po gzugs can ma yin ba bzhi po mngon par 'dus shing zad pa gang dag yin pa rnams dang / da ltar brjed ngas pas sems rnam par g-yeng ba na mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag ni byung nas /
translated: The four name aggregates of feeling and so on that are not form, which are the manifest and exhausted accumulations of the non-equipoised level that focus on objects,ğŸ”½and the four name aggregates of feeling and so on that are not form, which are the present ones that arise due to the power of focusing on signs,

original: 'jig pa nyid dang / dus yun mi ring ba nyid dang / ngan par gnas pa nyid dang / @157b nyes dmigs dang bcas pa nyid dang mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid yin par mos bar gyis shig / de ni khyod kyi phyi rol gyi tshor ba rnams dang /
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid dang / dus yun mi ring ba nyid dang / ngan par gnas pa nyid dang / @157b nyes dmigs dang bcas pa nyid dang mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid yin par mos bar gyis shig / de ni khyod kyi phyi rol gyi tshor ba rnams dang /
translated: concepts, and secondary afflictions, are impermanent,ğŸ”½unstable, and unreliable.

original: sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: and the mindfulness that observes phenomena and the mind.

original: yang khyod kyis lhag mthong gi mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: yang khyod kyis lhag mthong gi mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: Moreover, you should apprehend the signs of vipaÅ›yanÄ.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas te /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas te /
translated: Then, you should abide in mental engagements that possess signs and possess discursive thoughts.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang gis byung ba nang gi tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa de dag la skad cig re re dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i dbang gis byung ba nang gi tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa de dag la skad cig re re dang /
translated: Then, you should understand that the four nonphysical aggregatesâ€”the internal feelings and so onâ€”that arise due to the power of a discursive and conceptualized object are fresh in every moment,

original: skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du sar ba sar ba dang / rnying pa ma yin pa dang / rnying pa ma yin par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du mos par gyis shig dang de ni khyod kyi nang dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du sar ba sar ba dang / rnying pa ma yin pa dang / rnying pa ma yin par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du mos par gyis shig dang de ni khyod kyi nang dang /
translated: fresh in every instant, not old, not old.

original: phyi rol gyi tshor pa rnams dang / sems dang ; chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi tshor pa rnams dang / sems dang ; chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: He engages in the application of mindfulness to the body, to feelings, to thought, and to dharmas.

original: de ltar na khyod mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khyod mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, you will have entered the four applications of mindfulness, taking up the practice of repulsiveness.

original: khyod dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: khyod dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: When you are practicing the applications of mindfulness,

original: dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang rab tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang rab tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: from time to time you should also strive at serenity and insight.

original: khyod de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la dran pa nye bar gzhag pas grong ngam /
analyzed: khyod de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la dran pa nye bar gzhag pas grong ngam /
translated: When you are practicing the four applications of mindfulness in this way, whether you are staying in a villageğŸ”½or a town, you should not be attached to

original: grong rdal gang rung ba dag la brten cing gnas pa na khyod grong ngam /
analyzed: grong rdal gang rung ba dag la brten cing gnas pa na khyod grong ngam /
translated: the villageğŸ”½or the town.

original: grong rdal de nyid na de la gzhol ba dang / de la 'bab pa dang / de la babs pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan ma ma spangs par bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: grong rdal de nyid na de la gzhol ba dang / de la 'bab pa dang / de la babs pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan ma ma spangs par bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa'i tshe na /
translated: In that very town, with a mind that is focused on that, that is inclined toward that, and that is intent on that, without abandoning the object and the sign of the object, when you enter for the sake of alms,

original: glang po che dmu rgod dang / rta dmu rgod dang / ba lang rdung rgus dang / khyi za ba dang / sprul dang / ngam grog dang / sdong du ma dang / tsher ma dang / 'dam rdzab dang / g-yang sa dang / ljan ljin dang /
analyzed: glang po che dmu rgod dang / rta dmu rgod dang / ba lang rdung rgus dang / khyi za ba dang / sprul dang / ngam grog dang / sdong du ma dang / tsher ma dang / 'dam rdzab dang / g-yang sa dang / ljan ljin dang /
translated: you should avoid wild elephants, wild horses, wild oxen, dogs, snakes, ravines, stumps, thorns, swamps, precipices, filth, and cesspools.

original: mi gtsang ba'i khung bu dang / spyod lam dang / spyod ba dang / gnas mal sdig pa can dag yongs su spang zhing khyod kyis bdag nyid kyi lus legs par bsrung bar gyis shig / khyod kyis yul gyi mtshan ma gang dag la dbang po rnams gtad par @158a * //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i khung bu dang / spyod lam dang / spyod ba dang / gnas mal sdig pa can dag yongs su spang zhing khyod kyis bdag nyid kyi lus legs par bsrung bar gyis shig / khyod kyis yul gyi mtshan ma gang dag la dbang po rnams gtad par @158a * //
translated: You should avoid evil conduct, behavior, and resting places. You should protect your body well. You should not direct your senses toward any object that is inappropriate.

original: mi bya ba de dag la yang brtsal ba med pas /
analyzed: mi bya ba de dag la yang brtsal ba med pas /
translated: You should not seek out

original: dbang po rnams legs bar bsdam par gyis shig / khyod kyi mtshan ma gang dag la dbang po rnams gtad par bya ba de dag la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams legs bar bsdam par gyis shig / khyod kyi mtshan ma gang dag la dbang po rnams gtad par bya ba de dag la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: You should properly restrain your senses.

original: nyon mongs pa kun du mi rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir dran ba shin tu nye bar gzhag par gyis shig /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du mi rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir dran ba shin tu nye bar gzhag par gyis shig /
translated: You should be mindful of those objects to which you direct your senses, so that the afflictions do not arise.

original: khyod kyis de ltar lus legs par bsrungs ba dang / dbang po rnams legs par bsdams pa dang / dran ba shin tu nye bar gzhag pas de dang 'brel ba'i yid kyis zas kyi tshod rig bar zo shig / khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar lus legs par bsrungs ba dang / dbang po rnams legs par bsdams pa dang / dran ba shin tu nye bar gzhag pas de dang 'brel ba'i yid kyis zas kyi tshod rig bar zo shig / khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang /
translated: In this way, you should properly protect your body, properly restrain your senses, and be mindful. You should eat the right amount of food, with a mind that is connected to this practice.

original: lhan cig ran par smra ba dang / rigs par smra ba dang / dus su smra ba dang / gnam por smra ba dang / rab tu zhi bar smra bar gyis shig / khyod kyis chos ma yin pa'i gtam ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ran par smra ba dang / rigs par smra ba dang / dus su smra ba dang / gnam por smra ba dang / rab tu zhi bar smra bar gyis shig / khyod kyis chos ma yin pa'i gtam ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: You should speak appropriately with householders and monastics, speaking in a timely way, speaking pleasantly, speaking peacefully. You should completely abandon all forms of inappropriate speech.

original: khyod kyis chos kyi gtam zer ba na yang rtsod ba'i gtam mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi gtam zer ba na yang rtsod ba'i gtam mi bya ba'o //
translated: And when you speak about the Dharma, do not speak in a way that leads to disputes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu gang zag rtsod pa'i gtam gyi tshogs kyi rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par gnas pa ni smra ba mang po la sems kun du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / smra ba mang na rgod par 'gyur ba dang / rgod na nye bar mi zhi bar 'gyur ba dang nye bar ma zhi na sems ting nge 'dzin las thag ring du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag rtsod pa'i gtam gyi tshogs kyi rjes su sbyor ba la brtson par gnas pa ni smra ba mang po la sems kun du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / smra ba mang na rgod par 'gyur ba dang / rgod na nye bar mi zhi bar 'gyur ba dang nye bar ma zhi na sems ting nge 'dzin las thag ring du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a person who is occupied with the practice of engaging in the accumulation of disputes will have a mind that is full of talk, and when there is a lot of talk, there is agitation, and when there is agitation, there is no tranquility, and when there is no tranquility, the mind is far from meditative absorption.

original: khyod de ltar rgyu ba na dmigs pa ma btang bas myur ba myur bar 'dug la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mtshan ma ji lta bzung ba de nyid kyis rgyun du byed pa dang / legs par byed pas rnal 'byor du gyis shig / gtsub gtan las me 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu byed pa dang /
analyzed: khyod de ltar rgyu ba na dmigs pa ma btang bas myur ba myur bar 'dug la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mtshan ma ji lta bzung ba de nyid kyis rgyun du byed pa dang / legs par byed pas rnal 'byor du gyis shig / gtsub gtan las me 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu byed pa dang /
translated: â€œWhen you are wandering around like this, do not give up your object of meditation. Quickly sit down and practice yoga by means of continuous and proper practice with the very signs of serenity and insight that you have apprehended.

original: gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du gyis shig /'di ltar sems rab tu gtad par yang gis shig / gal te 'dzam bu'i gling na 'dzam bu'i gling ba'i mi thams cad kyi tshe ji srid du thub par gyur pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus teğŸ”½nga bdag gcig pu'i tshe tshad du gyur kyang /
analyzed: gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rgyun du gyis shig /'di ltar sems rab tu gtad par yang gis shig / gal te 'dzam bu'i gling na 'dzam bu'i gling ba'i mi thams cad kyi tshe ji srid du thub par gyur pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te nga bdag gcig pu'i tshe tshad du gyur kyang /
translated: If the lifespan of all the people in JambudvÄ«pa were combined andğŸ”½became my lifespan,

original: bdag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: I would still not be satisfied.

original: rnal 'byor la rab tu brtson pa 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu che ba nyid dang / phan yon che ba nyid rig pas na tshe dpag tu med pas spong ba dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la rnal 'byor mi gtang bar bya ba na tshe thung zhing srog myur na shin tu yun ring du zin kyang lo brgya las mi thub cing yongs su brtsis @158b na yud tsam cig las med pa 'dis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de ltar sems
analyzed: rnal 'byor la rab tu brtson pa 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu che ba nyid dang / phan yon che ba nyid rig pas na tshe dpag tu med pas spong ba dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la rnal 'byor mi gtang bar bya ba na tshe thung zhing srog myur na shin tu yun ring du zin kyang lo brgya las mi thub cing yongs su brtsis @158b na yud tsam cig las med pa 'dis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de ltar sems
translated: What need is there to mention this?â€ğŸ”½Thus, they should be very attentive.

original: rab tu gtad par gyis shig / de ltar khyod ji skad rjes su bstan pa bzhin du rgyun du byed cing legs par byed na gang gi don du spong bar khas blangs pa'i don ni 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu gtad par gyis shig / de ltar khyod ji skad rjes su bstan pa bzhin du rgyun du byed cing legs par byed na gang gi don du spong bar khas blangs pa'i don ni 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If you constantly practice and do well what has been taught, then the purpose for which you have accepted the vow of renunciation will be accomplished.

original: dang bo kho nar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa chung ngu la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang bo kho nar lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa chung ngu la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: First of all, he will experience a slight pliancy of body, a slight pliancy of mind, and a slight one-pointedness of mind.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po dag kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po dag kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'doms par byed do //
translated: After that, he will attain the great mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de ltar slob dpon rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor shes pa des slob ma las dang po pa las thog ma pa mi sdug pa la rab tu brtson pa de las 'doms pa na yang dag pa kho nar gtams pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor shes pa des slob ma las dang po pa las thog ma pa mi sdug pa la rab tu brtson pa de las 'doms pa na yang dag pa kho nar gtams pa yin la /
translated: Thus, when the master, the yogi who knows yoga, instructs the beginner, the neophyte who is striving in the meditation on foulness, he is giving correct instruction.

original: de ltar sgrub ba na yang yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub ba na yang yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: And when the latter practices in this way, he is correctly engaged.

original: mi sdug pas 'dul ba la mi sdug pas gdams pa ji lta ba bzhin du byams pas 'dul ba las dbugs rngub ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis 'dul ba la yang de bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pas 'dul ba la mi sdug pas gdams pa ji lta ba bzhin du byams pas 'dul ba las dbugs rngub ba dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis 'dul ba la yang de bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the same applies to those who are to be disciplined by the repulsive, and those who are to be disciplined by love, up to and including those who are to be disciplined by mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de las gzhan pa dag gi sgor 'jug pa dag gi khyad par gang yin pa de ni rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gi sgor 'jug pa dag gi khyad par gang yin pa de ni rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The difference between the doors of entry of the other perfections should be distinguished.

original: de las dang po pa byams pa bsgom pa la brtson pa phyi rol gyi mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mtshan ma bzung ste /
analyzed: de las dang po pa byams pa bsgom pa la brtson pa phyi rol gyi mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mtshan ma bzung ste /
translated: The beginner who is striving to cultivate love should apprehend the characteristics of the external group of friends and the group of strangers.

original: gnas mal tshul dang mthun par song ste /
analyzed: gnas mal tshul dang mthun par song ste /
translated: He should go to a suitable place and sit down.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i yid la byed pa phan pa dang / bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i yid la byed pa phan pa dang / bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas /
translated: With a superior intention of benefit and happiness, he should practice mental attention on the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: dang po kho nar mdza' bshes kyi phyogs gcig dang / dgra bo'i phyogs gcig dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gcig la mos par byas te /
analyzed: dang po kho nar mdza' bshes kyi phyogs gcig dang / dgra bo'i phyogs gcig dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs gcig la mos par byas te /
translated: First, one should focus on one person who is a friend, one person who is an enemy, and one person who is a stranger.

original: phyogs gsum po de dag la phan pa dang / bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: phyogs gsum po de dag la phan pa dang / bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas /
translated: With a mental state that has the superior intention of benefit and happiness for those three,ğŸ”½one should practice the same way, thinking, â€œAlas!

original: kye ma sems can bde ba 'dod pa 'di dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye ma sems can bde ba 'dod pa 'di dag 'di lta ste /
translated: May these sentient beings who desire happiness be happyâ€”

original: 'dod pa'i bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba med pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pas bde bar gyur cig ces mtshungs par nye bar bsgrub bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dga' ba med pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pas bde bar gyur cig ces mtshungs par nye bar bsgrub bar bya'o //
translated: that is, may they be happy through the absence of the reproach of desire, through the absence of the reproach of joy, and through the absence of the reproach of the absence of joy.â€

original: de'i 'og tu mdza' bshes kyi phyogs gcig dang gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / @159a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mdza' bshes kyi phyogs gcig dang gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / @159a * //
translated: After that, one should focus on two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or one hundred people in each of the three categoriesâ€”friends, enemies, and strangersâ€”and practice the same way.

original: lnga bcun sa snga ma bzhin du phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams thams cad kyi bar dag mdza' bshes kyis 'dab chags su gang ste /
analyzed: lnga bcun sa snga ma bzhin du phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams thams cad kyi bar dag mdza' bshes kyis 'dab chags su gang ste /
translated: The fifty are the same as before, but the directions and the intermediate directions are filled with friends and relatives.

original: gang du 'dab chags su ma gyur ba'i go skabs su ni than 'khar ba'i rtse mo gzugs pa'i gtos tsam yang med par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du 'dab chags su ma gyur ba'i go skabs su ni than 'khar ba'i rtse mo gzugs pa'i gtos tsam yang med par mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that there is not even room for the tip of a needle that is not filled with friends and relatives.

original: mdza' bshes kyi phyogs la ji lta bzhin du dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi phyogs la ji lta bzhin du dgra bo'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the same with regard to the side of enemies and the side of neutrals as it is with regard to the side of friends and relatives.

original: byams pa'i sbyor pa de yang mi spong bar byams pa bsgom bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la 'jug pa kho nar yang byed de /
analyzed: byams pa'i sbyor pa de yang mi spong bar byams pa bsgom bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la 'jug pa kho nar yang byed de /
translated: One should not abandon that application of loving kindness, but while cultivating loving kindness, one should also enter into the applications of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: How does one enter into them?

original: 'di ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed de ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed de ;
translated: One enters into them by imagining as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½bdag kyang gzhan dag gi mdza' bshes su grags pa yang yin /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag kyang gzhan dag gi mdza' bshes su grags pa yang yin /
translated: One imagines thatğŸ”½one is a friend to some,ğŸ”½an enemy to some,

original: dgra bor gyur pa yang yin /ğŸ”½tha mal bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: dgra bor gyur pa yang yin /ğŸ”½tha mal bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: and a neutral person to some.

original: bdag kyang bde bar 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / mi mthun pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang bde bar 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / mi mthun pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he cultivates lovingkindness by observing the internal body.

original: sems can 'di dag kyang bdag ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan dag gi mdza' bshes su gyur ba yang yin /ğŸ”½dgra bor gyur pa yang yin /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag kyang bdag ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan dag gi mdza' bshes su gyur ba yang yin / dgra bor gyur pa yang yin /
translated: â€œThese sentient beings are friends of mine, just as I am a friend of theirs.

original: tha mal par gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: tha mal par gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: They are enemies of mine, just as I am an enemy of theirs.ğŸ”½They are neutral to me, just as I am neutral to them.ğŸ”½I too am the same, in that I want to be happy, and I do not want to suffer.

original: sems can 'di dag kyang bde bar 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang mi mthun pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag kyang bde bar 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang mi mthun pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he cultivates lovingkindness by observing the external body.

original: sems can 'di dag kyang bdag ji lta ba de lta byin pas /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag kyang bdag ji lta ba de lta byin pas /
translated: â€œThese sentient beings are friends of mine, just as I am a friend of theirs.

original: ji ltar kho bo bdag bde ba tshol ba de bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang bdag dang mnyam zhing bdag dang mtshungs pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo bdag bde ba tshol ba de bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang bdag dang mnyam zhing bdag dang mtshungs pas na /
translated: Just as I seek my own happiness, so do these sentient beings, who are equal to me, who are the same as me.ğŸ”½Thus, I will also seek the happiness of these sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la yang bde ba nyi bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i nang dang / phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la yang bde ba nyi bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar mos par byed pa de ni de'i nang dang / phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i byams pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: This is the cultivation of love that observes the internal and external body, in the manner of observing the body.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag las chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni phung po 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag las chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni phung po 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Among the four establishments of mindfulness, the establishment of mindfulness of dharmas is the establishment of mindfulness that observes a mixture, because it focuses on a mixture of the aggregates.

original: rnal 'byor pas gzugs kyi mtshan ma kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan ma bzung nas mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mos par byed pas na de'i phyir de ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag @159b pa kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gzugs kyi mtshan ma kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan ma bzung nas mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la mos par byed pas na de'i phyir de ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag @159b pa kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Yogis apprehend the sign of form, the sign of color, and the sign of shape, and then they direct their attention to the class of friends, enemies, and ordinary beings.ğŸ”½Therefore, this is established as the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: de la mos pa yid la byed ba la brten nas /
analyzed: de la mos pa yid la byed ba la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on the attention of directing one's attention to the body,

original: yang dag pa yid la byed pa la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa yid la byed pa la yang 'jug ste /
translated: one enters into the attention of reality.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does one enter?ğŸ”½One enters in the following way:

original: 'di ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed de /
translated: One directs one's attention in this way:

original: bdag gis phan pa dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can tshad med pa'i bar de dag la mos par byas pa de bas ni /
analyzed: bdag gis phan pa dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can tshad med pa'i bar de dag la mos par byas pa de bas ni /
translated: I have directed my attention to those sentient beings up to the end of space, with the superior intention that possesses benefit and happiness.

original: bdag gis sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te sems can gang dag bdag gi mdza' bshes su gyur pa las dgra bo dang / tha mal par song ba dang / dgra bor gyur pa las mdza' bshes dang / tha mal par song ba dang / tha mal par gyur pa las mdza' bshes dang /
analyzed: bdag gis sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te sems can gang dag bdag gi mdza' bshes su gyur pa las dgra bo dang / tha mal par song ba dang / dgra bor gyur pa las mdza' bshes dang / tha mal par song ba dang / tha mal par gyur pa las mdza' bshes dang /
translated: Beginning from the past, I have been friends with those who have become my enemies, and I have been friends with those who have become ordinary people.ğŸ”½I have been enemies with those who have become my friends, and I have been enemies with those who have become ordinary people. I have been ordinary with those who have become my friends,

original: dgra bor song ba'i mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang tha mal pa'i phyogs mngon par 'das pa'i sems can de dag ches tshad med pa yin pas de'i phyir na rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: dgra bor song ba'i mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang tha mal pa'i phyogs mngon par 'das pa'i sems can de dag ches tshad med pa yin pas de'i phyir na rnam grangs des na /
translated: and I have been ordinary with those who have become my enemies. Since the number of sentient beings who have been in these relationships with me is immeasurable,ğŸ”½for this reason,

original: sems can 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: all these sentient beings are equal and the same.

original: 'di la mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa yin zhes bya bar yongs su grub pa ni 'ga' yang med pas na /
analyzed: 'di la mdza' bshes dang / dgra bo dang / tha mal pa yin zhes bya bar yongs su grub pa ni 'ga' yang med pas na /
translated: There is no one who is established as a friend, an enemy, or an ordinary person.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis kyang phyogs gsum po thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la yang mnyam pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis kyang phyogs gsum po thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la yang mnyam pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: And by this very method, he should be impartial toward all three parties, and he should be impartial in providing benefit and happiness.

original: sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams nas ji lta ba bzhin du phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams nas kyang 'khor ba na 'khor ba yod kyi bar du de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams nas ji lta ba bzhin du phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams nas kyang 'khor ba na 'khor ba yod kyi bar du de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as he has done in relation to the past, he should understand in the same way in relation to the future, as long as there is wandering in cyclic existence.

original: bdag gis sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gis sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te /
translated: â€œIn the past,ğŸ”½those sentient beings toward whom I did not cultivate loving kindness and compassion,

original: sems can gang dag la byams pa'i sems kyis rjes su snying brtse bar ma byas par de dag mngon par 'das su zin gyis kyang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag la byams pa'i sems kyis rjes su snying brtse bar ma byas par de dag mngon par 'das su zin gyis kyang /
translated: even though they have passed away,

original: 'on kyang de dag la bdag gis 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la bdag gis 'di lta ste ;
translated: I will take hold of them in this way,

original: rang gi sems la rtog pa med pa dang / gnod sems su gyur pa med pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems la rtog pa med pa dang / gnod sems su gyur pa med pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: with a mind that is free of conceptual thought and free of malice.ğŸ”½â€˜Alas! May those sentient beings who have passed away be happy!â€™

original: kye ma 'das pa'i sems can 'di dag kyang bde bar gyur cig ces rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye ma 'das pa'i sems can 'di dag kyang bde bar gyur cig ces rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o //
translated: â€œAnd he should cultivate compassion in the same way toward those sentient beings who are presently existing.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can ma 'das pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can ma 'das pa de dag kyang /
translated: Those sentient beings of the future who have not yet come to be

original: bde bar gyur cig ces de ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bde bar gyur cig ces de ltar mos par byed pa na 'jug par byed do //
translated: are also brought into the present by the wish, â€œMay they be happy!â€ğŸ”½The stream of merit and the stream of virtue of one who is established in love that is a correct mental attention in the present

original: da ltar yang dag pa yid la byed pa rjes su zhugs pa'i byams pa la gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyi rgyun dang / dge ba'i rgyun gang yin pa de'i gnan  mos pa las byung ba'i byams pa la gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni brgya'i @160a * //ğŸ”½char nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: da ltar yang dag pa yid la byed pa rjes su zhugs pa'i byams pa la gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyi rgyun dang / dge ba'i rgyun gang yin pa de'i gnan  mos pa las byung ba'i byams pa la gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni brgya'i @160a * // char nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: do not approach even a hundredth part of the mass of merit of one who is established in love that arises from aspiration.ğŸ”½They do not approach even a thousandth part, or any number, fraction,

original: stong gi cha dang grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ste /
translated: comparison, or example.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la rkyen 'di ba nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i yongs su rtog pas mtshan ma 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de la rkyen 'di ba nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i yongs su rtog pas mtshan ma 'dzin par byed do //
translated: The beginner who is intent on the dependent origination of this very condition, by the power of hearing and reflection, apprehends the signs through conceptualization.

original: sems can 'di dag la ni mi shes pas kun du rmongs pa yod de /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni mi shes pas kun du rmongs pa yod de /
translated: These sentient beings have delusion through ignorance.

original: des ni 'di dag mngon sum du mi rtag pa la ni rtag par rtog par byed /
analyzed: des ni 'di dag mngon sum du mi rtag pa la ni rtag par rtog par byed /
translated: By that, they conceive what is directly impermanent as permanent,

original: mngon sum du mi sdug pa la ni sdug par /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi sdug pa la ni sdug par /
translated: what is directly unpleasant as pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba ni bde bar /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni bde bar /
translated: what is suffering as happiness,

original: bdag med pa la ni bdag du rtog par byed pas na /
analyzed: bdag med pa la ni bdag du rtog par byed pas na /
translated: and what is selfless as a self.

original: sems can 'di dag ni phyin ci log gis bslad pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni phyin ci log gis bslad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, these sentient beings are corrupted by error.
