original: bslad pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la tshor ba rnams dang / tshe phyi ma la lus mngon par 'grub pa la srid pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bslad pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la tshor ba rnams dang / tshe phyi ma la lus mngon par 'grub pa la srid pa skyed par byed do //
translated: By the cause of corruption, they generate craving for the feelings in this life and for the establishment of the body in the next life.

original: sred par gyur pas skye ba'i rtsa ba'i las rnams byas pas na /
analyzed: sred par gyur pas skye ba'i rtsa ba'i las rnams byas pas na /
translated: By becoming craving, they perform the actions that are the root of birth.

original: des na phyi ma la las dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes mtshan mar 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: des na phyi ma la las dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di mngon par 'grub par byed do zhes mtshan mar 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in the future, it is the cause of karma and afflictions that will produce this mass of suffering.

original: de ltar mtshan ma bzung nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma bzung nas kyang /
translated: Thus, he grasps the sign.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di yang de kho na lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes nang la mos par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di yang de kho na lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes nang la mos par byed do //
translated: Having grasped the sign, he becomes convinced that his own mass of suffering is just like that.

original: lus gang dag mtha' yas mu med pa'i sngon gyi mtha' nas brtsams pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon te /
analyzed: lus gang dag mtha' yas mu med pa'i sngon gyi mtha' nas brtsams pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon te /
translated: The bodies that are limitless and endless, beginning with the past, are not evident in the past.

original: de dag kyang de lta bur gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang de lta bur gyur ba yin la /
translated: They are just like that.

original: sems can 'di dag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lus sdug bsngal gyi phung pos kun du zin pa de dag thams cad kyang de lta bu kho nar mngon par grub pa dang / phyis kyang skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lus sdug bsngal gyi phung pos kun du zin pa de dag thams cad kyang de lta bu kho nar mngon par grub pa dang / phyis kyang skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes mos par byed do //
translated: â€œThese sentient beings, in the past, future, and present, are all completely pervaded by the mass of suffering of the body. They are all established in this way, and will be born in this way in the future.â€

original: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la byed pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa nyid yid la byed pa las byung ba yin gyi mos pa las byung pa ni med do //
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la byed pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa nyid yid la byed pa las byung ba yin gyi mos pa las byung pa ni med do //
translated: All of these contemplations of the dependent origination of this very condition arise from the attention of reality, not from the attention of imagination.

original: de la yang gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi da ltar gyi phung po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: de la yang gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi da ltar gyi phung po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: â€œWhen one attends to the dependent origination of oneâ€™s own present aggregates,

original: nang gi lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: then one attends to the internal body, and so on up to: attends to phenomena following phenomena.â€

original: gang gi tshe gzhan dag gi da ltar gyi phung po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni phyi rol gyi lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa @160b yin no //ğŸ”½gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rten cing 'brel ba 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan dag gi da ltar gyi phung po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni phyi rol gyi lus dang chos rnams kyi bar la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa @160b yin no // gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rten cing 'brel ba 'byung ba dag yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When he attends to the present aggregates of others, which are dependently arisen, then he is present to the external body and to the external and internal phenomena.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang / chos rnams kyi bar dag la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang / chos rnams kyi bar dag la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin te /
translated: When he attends to the past and future aggregates of himself and others, which are dependently arisen, then he is present to the internal and external body and to the internal and external phenomena.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: de la khams rab tu dbye ba la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la khams rab tu dbye ba la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams 'di lta ste /
translated: The beginner who is intent on the classification of the elements, first of all considers the external earth element, which is:

original: sa dang / ri dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / rin po che shang ka shi la dang / byi ru la sogs pa thams cad la sra ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: sa dang / ri dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / rin po che shang ka shi la dang / byi ru la sogs pa thams cad la sra ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: earth, mountains, grass, trees, forests, gravel, pebbles, jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystal, coral, and so on.

original: nang gi sra ba nyid la mos par byed do //ğŸ”½phyi rol gyi chu'i phung po 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½chu klung dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa la sogs pa dag la gsher ba'i mtshan ma bzung zhing de bzhin du phyi rol gyi me 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi sra ba nyid la mos par byed do // phyi rol gyi chu'i phung po 'di lta ste / chu klung dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa la sogs pa dag la gsher ba'i mtshan ma bzung zhing de bzhin du phyi rol gyi me 'di lta ste /
translated: He then focuses on the internal solidity of his own body.ğŸ”½He focuses on the external signs of fluidity, such as rivers, streams, lakes, ponds, and wells.ğŸ”½Similarly, he focuses on the external signs of heat, such as a great mass of fire, the rays of the spring sun, a person afflicted with a fever, or a house engulfed in flames.

original: me'i phung po chen po dang / dpyid ka'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs pa dang / sems can rims kyis btab pa dang / khyim me chen pos tsheg pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyi rol gyi rlung gi phung po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: me'i phung po chen po dang / dpyid ka'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis gdungs pa dang / sems can rims kyis btab pa dang / khyim me chen pos tsheg pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyi rol gyi rlung gi phung po 'di lta ste /
translated: He focuses on the external signs of motion, such as the wind, a great storm, or a forest fire.

original: shar dang lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rlung la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyi rol gyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar dag dang / de bzhin du gang dag yul gyis ma khyab pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pas khyab par bya ba ma yin pa dang /ğŸ”½bu gu dang bcas pa dang / sbubs yod pa dang / go skabs yod pa'i nam mkha'i khams de dag las mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: shar dang lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rlung la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyi rol gyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar dag dang / de bzhin du gang dag yul gyis ma khyab pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pas khyab par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bu gu dang bcas pa dang / sbubs yod pa dang / go skabs yod pa'i nam mkha'i khams de dag las mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: the wind of the east, the south, the west, the north, and so on, up to the external wind-mandala, and likewise, the space element that is not occupied by any object, that is not pervaded by any form,ğŸ”½that has holes, that has cavities, and that has openings.

original: nang gi chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams la mos par byed do //
analyzed: nang gi chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams la mos par byed do //
translated: Having apprehended the signs of those, he becomes convinced of the internal water element, the fire element, the wind element, and the space element.

original: de bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i yongs su rtog pas 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin par yang byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i yongs su rtog pas 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin par yang byed do //
translated: Likewise, through the power of hearing and reflection, he apprehends the signs of the consciousness element through his imagination.

original: gal te nang gi skye mched mig yongs su ma nyams shing gzugs snang bar gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te nang gi skye mched mig yongs su ma nyams shing gzugs snang bar gyur du zin kyang /
translated: â€œIf the internal sense-base of the eye is not damaged, and if forms appear,

original: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na /
translated: If the attention to the elements does not occur,

original: de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: the eye consciousness that arises from the elements will not occur.

original: de las bzlog na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does occur, it will occur.ğŸ”½The same should be understood for the mental faculty, mental objects, and mental consciousness.

original: yid dang chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes de rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan @161a * //ğŸ”½ma 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: yid dang chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes de rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan @161a * // ma 'dzin par byed do //
translated: In this way, he grasps the characteristics of the consciousness element.

original: des de ltar mtshan ma bzung nas kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i lus 'di la ni rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad kyis bon dang / khams dang / rigs dang / rang bzhin yod do zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: des de ltar mtshan ma bzung nas kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i lus 'di la ni rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad kyis bon dang / khams dang / rigs dang / rang bzhin yod do zhes mos par byed do //
translated: Having grasped the characteristics in this way, he then becomes convinced that the seeds, elements, natures, and essences of all those consciousnesses exist in this body, which is made of the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag kyang dang po kho nar yan lag dang / nyid lag dag la rags par yod do zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag kyang dang po kho nar yan lag dang / nyid lag dag la rags par yod do zhes mos par byed do //
translated: He becomes convinced that the four great elements first exist in a gross form in the limbs and members.

original: 'de'i 'og tu cha shas kyi rab tu dbye bas shin tu phra bar mos par byed do //
analyzed: 'de'i 'og tu cha shas kyi rab tu dbye bas shin tu phra bar mos par byed do //
translated: Then, he should imagine the body as being divided into parts and then as being divided into atoms.

original: de bzhin du nyi zer gyi nang na yod pa'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du khad kyis khad kyis rdul phra rab kyi bar du mos par byed do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi zer gyi nang na yod pa'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du khad kyis khad kyis rdul phra rab kyi bar du mos par byed do ;
translated: In the same way, he should imagine the body as being divided into atoms, as many as there are particles of dust in a sunbeam, and then as being divided into atoms, one by one.

original: / de yan lag dang / cha shas re re la yang rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tshad med pa dag yod par mos par byed na /
analyzed: / de yan lag dang / cha shas re re la yang rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tshad med pa dag yod par mos par byed na /
translated: If he imagines that each part and each portion of the body is made up of an immeasurable number of atoms,

original: lus thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: lus thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to mention the whole body?

original: de ni re zhig khams rab tu dbye ba la rab tu brtson pa'i khams gzugs can rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig khams rab tu dbye ba la rab tu brtson pa'i khams gzugs can rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the limit of the division of the material elements, for one who is intent on the division of the elements.

original: nam mkha'i khams la ni dang po kho nar mig sbubs yod pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / mid pa sbubs yod pa dang / gang gis mid par byed pa dang / gang du mid par byed pa dang / gang gis de'i mid pa smad kyi char 'dzag par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la ni dang po kho nar mig sbubs yod pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / mid pa sbubs yod pa dang / gang gis mid par byed pa dang / gang du mid par byed pa dang / gang gis de'i mid pa smad kyi char 'dzag par byed pa de ni /
translated: In the space element, he first imagines the eye sockets, the ear sockets, the nose sockets, the throat sockets, that by which one swallows, that into which one swallows, and that by which oneâ€™s throat is moistened below.

original: nam mkha'i khams rags pa yin no zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams rags pa yin no zhes mos par byed do //
translated: This is the gross space element.

original: de'i 'og tu khad kyis khad kyis spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi bar du sbubs dang ldan par mos par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khad kyis khad kyis spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi bar du sbubs dang ldan par mos par byed do //
translated: After that, he gradually imagines all the pores of the body as being hollow.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams la ni khyad kyis khad kyis gnas pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / dus dang / rnam pa'i bar du dbye ba ched med pa yod par mos bar mos par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams la ni khyad kyis khad kyis gnas pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / dus dang / rnam pa'i bar du dbye ba ched med pa yod par mos bar mos par byed do //
translated: In the consciousness element, he imagines the gradual differences in the location, object, mental activity, time, and aspect.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kho na la mos par byed pa na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kho na la mos par byed pa na /
translated: When he imagines only the consciousness element,

original: gnas dang dmigs pa la mos pas rnam par shes pa'i khams de nyid kyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gas rnam pa bcu po dag la yang mos par byed de //
analyzed: gnas dang dmigs pa la mos pas rnam par shes pa'i khams de nyid kyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gas rnam pa bcu po dag la yang mos par byed de //
translated: By being intent on the realm and the meditative object, he is intent on the ten forms that are the cause of that very realm of consciousness.

original: de dag kyang ji ltar gyur pa de lta bu kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar gyur pa de lta bu kho na yin no //
translated: And those are just as they are.

original: de gal te bdag nyid kyi nang gi khams la mos par byed pas na /
analyzed: de gal te bdag nyid kyi nang gi khams la mos par byed pas na /
translated: If he is intent on the internal realms,

original: de nang gi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nang gi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
translated: he is practicing the applications of mindfulness internally.ğŸ”½If he is intent on the realms of other sentient beings,

original: gal te sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa gzhan dag gi khams la mos par byed na ni phyir rol gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa gzhan dag gi khams la mos par byed na ni phyir rol gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
translated: he is practicing the applications of mindfulness externally.

original: gal te sems can du bgrang ba gzhan dag gi khams @161b la mos par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems can du bgrang ba gzhan dag gi khams @161b la mos par byed na ni /
translated: If he is intent on the realms of other sentient beings,

original: nang dang phyir rol gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyir rol gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa yin no //
translated: he is practicing the applications of mindfulness internally and externally.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi lus 'di 'chi ba dang / snga ma bzhin du rnam par rangs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i bar du mos par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi lus 'di 'chi ba dang / snga ma bzhin du rnam par rangs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i bar du mos par byed de /
translated: Furthermore, one should imagine that oneâ€™s own body is dead, and so on, up to the stage of being a skeleton.

original: rnam par rnags pa yang rnang rab tu 'dzag par mos par byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par rnags pa yang rnang rab tu 'dzag par mos par byed cing /
translated: One should imagine that the skeleton is oozing pus,

original: de khad kyis khad kyis rnag gi rgyun des rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis gzhi chen po rang gis yongs su gang bar mngon par spel zhing mos par yang byed do //
analyzed: de khad kyis khad kyis rnag gi rgyun des rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis gzhi chen po rang gis yongs su gang bar mngon par spel zhing mos par yang byed do //
translated: and that the flow of pus gradually increases, until one imagines that the entire great earth is filled with it.

original: lus de rnam pa mtha' yas par mos par byas nas me'i phung po chen po mtha' yas mu med pa'i mes tshig par yang mos par byed cing /
analyzed: lus de rnam pa mtha' yas par mos par byas nas me'i phung po chen po mtha' yas mu med pa'i mes tshig par yang mos par byed cing /
translated: Having imagined the body in this way, one should imagine that it is burned by a great fire, infinite and boundless.

original: me zhi nas kyang rus pa'i lhag rol dang / thal ba'i lhag rol tsam zhig lus la mos pa mtha' yas mu med pas mos par byed do //
analyzed: me zhi nas kyang rus pa'i lhag rol dang / thal ba'i lhag rol tsam zhig lus la mos pa mtha' yas mu med pas mos par byed do //
translated: And when the fire is extinguished, one should imagine that only the bones remain, and that even they are reduced to dust.

original: rus pa de dag kyang rlung gi phung po tshad med pas phye mar lhags te /
analyzed: rus pa de dag kyang rlung gi phung po tshad med pas phye mar lhags te /
translated: One should imagine that even the dust is blown away by an infinite mass of wind, and is scattered and disappears without a trace.

original: phyogs phyogs su gtor zhing khyer bar yang mos par byed do //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs su gtor zhing khyer bar yang mos par byed do //
translated: and he imagines that they are carried off in all directions.

original: khyer nas kyang rus pa de dag dang / thal ba de dag dang / rlung de dag mi snang bar lhag ma nam mkha'i khams tsam zhig lus par snang bar mos par byed de /ğŸ”½de ltar na re zhig nang dang / phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i mos pa yid la byed pas khams rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa'i phyir lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed do //
analyzed: khyer nas kyang rus pa de dag dang / thal ba de dag dang / rlung de dag mi snang bar lhag ma nam mkha'i khams tsam zhig lus par snang bar mos par byed de / de ltar na re zhig nang dang / phyi rol gyi mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba la brten pa'i mos pa yid la byed pas khams rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa'i phyir lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed do //
translated: And having been carried off, he imagines that the bones, the ashes, and the wind disappear, and only the space element remains.ğŸ”½In this way, he attends to the body and remains focused on the body by means of attention that is both physical and mental.

original: de ltar mos par byed pa na yang dag pa'i yid la byed pas kyang 'di ltar nang dang / phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar mos par byed pa na yang dag pa'i yid la byed pas kyang 'di ltar nang dang / phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed de /
translated: And when he attends to the body in this way, he also attends to the body by means of correct attention.

original: bdag gi chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang ; nam mkha'i khams kyi par tshad med pa de dag la mos par byas pa de bas ni /
analyzed: bdag gi chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / sa'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang ; nam mkha'i khams kyi par tshad med pa de dag la mos par byas pa de bas ni /
translated: The extent of my water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and so on, are immeasurable.

original: bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /ğŸ”½ma shi ba dang / pha shi ba dag dang / phu nu dang / bu srid dang / nye du shi ba dag dang / longs spyod zad pa dang / nor zad pa dag na mchi ma rab tu zags shing mchi ma rgyud blags pa dang /ğŸ”½ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa dang / rkun po dang / lam 'gog pa dang / khyim 'bugs pa dang / mdud pa 'grol ba dag 'byung bas de lag pa bcad pa dang / rkang pa bcad pa dang / mgo bcad pa dang / sna bcad pa dang /
analyzed: bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe / ma shi ba dang / pha shi ba dag dang / phu nu dang / bu srid dang / nye du shi ba dag dang / longs spyod zad pa dang / nor zad pa dag na mchi ma rab tu zags shing mchi ma rgyud blags pa dang / ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa dang / rkun po dang / lam 'gog pa dang / khyim 'bugs pa dang / mdud pa 'grol ba dag 'byung bas de lag pa bcad pa dang / rkang pa bcad pa dang / mgo bcad pa dang / sna bcad pa dang /
translated: When I was wandering in cyclic existence,ğŸ”½I cried and shed tears when my mother died, when my father died, when my siblings died, when my children died, when my relatives died, when my wealth was exhausted, and when my possessions were exhausted.

original: yan lag dang / nying lag rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu @162a * //ğŸ”½med pa dag bcad pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa des na /
analyzed: yan lag dang / nying lag rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu @162a * //ğŸ”½med pa dag bcad pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa des na /
translated: I experienced having my hands cut off, my feet cut off, my head cut off, my nose cut off, and having my major and minor body parts cut off in various ways.

original: khrag dpag tu med pa dag byung zhing rab tu zags par gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ches dpag tu med de /
analyzed: khrag dpag tu med pa dag byung zhing rab tu zags par gyur ba gang yin pa de dag ches dpag tu med de /
translated: The blood that has been shed and flowed is immeasurable.

original: mchi ma dang / 'o ma dang / khrag gis yongs su zin pa'i chu'i khams kyi chu'i phung po gang yin pa de'i gan na /
analyzed: mchi ma dang / 'o ma dang / khrag gis yongs su zin pa'i chu'i khams kyi chu'i phung po gang yin pa de'i gan na /
translated: The water element that is the basis for tears, milk, and blood is a mass of water that is immeasurable.

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi chus yongs su gang bas ni brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi chus yongs su gang bas ni brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The four great oceans filled with water do not approach even a hundredth part of that.

original: srid pa dang 'gro ba de dang de dag tu 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag na lus rnams mes bsregs par gyur pa'i me'i phung po gang yin ba de yang ches tshad med de /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'gro ba de dang de dag tu 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag na lus rnams mes bsregs par gyur pa'i me'i phung po gang yin ba de yang ches tshad med de /
translated: The mass of fire that burns the bodies at death and rebirth in this and that existence is immeasurable.

original: de la ni dpe yang tshad med do //ğŸ”½sa'i khams kyi rus pa zhigs par gyur pa dag kyang ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de la ni dpe yang tshad med do // sa'i khams kyi rus pa zhigs par gyur pa dag kyang ches tshad med do //
translated: The example for that is immeasurable.ğŸ”½The bones of the earth element that have been destroyed are immeasurable.

original: gang gi lus de dag rab tu g-yo bar byed pa'i rlung gi khams de yang ches tshad med do //
analyzed: gang gi lus de dag rab tu g-yo bar byed pa'i rlung gi khams de yang ches tshad med do //
translated: The wind element that moves those bodies is immeasurable.

original: lus de dag gi mig la sogs pa sbubs yod pa'i nam mkha'i khams kyang ches tshad med do //
analyzed: lus de dag gi mig la sogs pa sbubs yod pa'i nam mkha'i khams kyang ches tshad med do //
translated: The space element in the cavities of the eyes, etc. of those bodies is also immeasurable.

original: da ltar gyi tha ma'i lus 'di la thug pa'i bar gyi lus sar pa sar pa dag yang dang yang du len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun de yang ces tshad med de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi tha ma'i lus 'di la thug pa'i bar gyi lus sar pa sar pa dag yang dang yang du len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun de yang ces tshad med de /
translated: The stream of consciousness that takes up again and again a new body, up to the present last body, is also immeasurable.

original: de'i rnams par shes pa'i rgyun la gnas pa'i 'gro ba de yang phyi ma'i mthar ni ma nges te /
analyzed: de'i rnams par shes pa'i rgyun la gnas pa'i 'gro ba de yang phyi ma'i mthar ni ma nges te /
translated: The stream of consciousness of that being is not limited in the future.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar 'di ni tshad med pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar 'di ni tshad med pa yin no zhes de ltar mos par byed do //
translated: Thus, this element of consciousness is immeasurable.

original: de la dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'i rnal 'byor la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni /
analyzed: de la dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa'i rnal 'byor la rab tu brtson pa'i las dang po pa ni /
translated: In this regard, a beginner who is intent on the yoga of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation

original: gnas khang g-yas g-yon gyi sgo'i rnam pa las sam /ğŸ”½lcags mgar gyi spud pa dag las sam /
analyzed: gnas khang g-yas g-yon gyi sgo'i rnam pa las sam / lcags mgar gyi spud pa dag las sam /
translated: should visualize the breath as a mark on the right or left side of the house,ğŸ”½or as a mark on the bellows of a blacksmith,

original: gser mgar gyi shing sbud las sam /
analyzed: gser mgar gyi shing sbud las sam /
translated: or as a mark on the bellows of a goldsmith,ğŸ”½or as a mark on the nose,ğŸ”½or as a mark on the lips,ğŸ”½or as a mark on the teeth.

original: phyi rol gyi rlung gi phung po dag las rlung phyir 'byung ba dang / nang du 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas nang gi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i dmigs pa dran pas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rlung gi phung po dag las rlung phyir 'byung ba dang / nang du 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas nang gi dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i dmigs pa dran pas /
translated: Having taken up the signs of the external wind-aggregateâ€™s going out and coming in, and its coming and going, he recollects the object of the internal in-breath and out-breath.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la mos par byed do //ğŸ”½de dang po kho nar kha dang sna'i phyogs su sbubs rags pa nas /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la mos par byed do // de dang po kho nar kha dang sna'i phyogs su sbubs rags pa nas /
translated: He becomes absorbed in the in-breath and out-breath.

original: 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rlung shin tu phra zhing chung ba la mos par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rlung shin tu phra zhing chung ba la mos par byed do //
translated: At first, he becomes absorbed in the very subtle and slight wind that goes out and returns in the coarse tube of the nose and mouth.

original: de nas khyad kyis khad kyis rlung de che ba dang / ches mang bar mos par byed cing spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi bar du zhugs par mos par byed de /
analyzed: de nas khyad kyis khad kyis rlung de che ba dang / ches mang bar mos par byed cing spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi bar du zhugs par mos par byed de /
translated: Then, gradually, he becomes absorbed in that wind as it becomes greater and greater, and he becomes absorbed in it as it enters all the pores of the body.

original: 'di ltar @162b lus thams cad rlung gi phung po dang 'brel pa dang / rlung gi phung pos yongs su bskor ba dang / rlung gi phung pos nye bar dkris pa dang / rlung gi phung po tshad med ba'i nang na 'dug cing 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar @162b lus thams cad rlung gi phung po dang 'brel pa dang / rlung gi phung pos yongs su bskor ba dang / rlung gi phung pos nye bar dkris pa dang / rlung gi phung po tshad med ba'i nang na 'dug cing 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, the entire body is connected with a mass of wind, surrounded by a mass of wind, enveloped by a mass of wind, and situated within an immeasurable mass of wind.

original: dper na / shing bal gyi 'da' ba dang / ras bal gyi 'da' ba ltar yang ba nyid du mos par yang byed do //
analyzed: dper na / shing bal gyi 'da' ba dang / ras bal gyi 'da' ba ltar yang ba nyid du mos par yang byed do //
translated: He should imagine that it is light, like cotton fluff or a spiderâ€™s thread.

original: de gang gi tshe dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa ma nyam pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa ma nyam pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When he attends to the continuity of inhalation and exhalation,

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: then he is said to be â€œattending to the body in and of itself with regard to the internal body.â€

original: gang gi tshe gzhan dag gi shi ba'i lus rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur cing dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa ma nyams pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan dag gi shi ba'i lus rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur cing dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa ma nyams pa yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When he attends to the continuity of inhalation and exhalation in a dead body that has been discarded in a charnel ground and has begun to bloat,ğŸ”½then he is said to be â€œattending to the body in and of itself with regard to the external body.â€

original: phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is one who, externally, is a follower of the body in regard to the body.

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid 'chi ba'am /ğŸ”½shi bar mos par byed cing dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa dang bral bar mos par byed pa de'i chen ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid 'chi ba'am / shi bar mos par byed cing dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rgyun 'jug pa dang bral bar mos par byed pa de'i chen ni /
translated: When he imagines himself dead,

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: or imagines that the flow of his inhalation and exhalation has ceased, then he is one who, internally and externally, is a follower of the body in regard to the body.

original: sbyor pa thams cad la yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyis yongs su zin par mos par byed de /
analyzed: sbyor pa thams cad la yang zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang ldan pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs kyis yongs su zin par mos par byed de /
translated: In all the applications, he imagines that they are endowed with the side of serenity and are embraced by the side of serenity.

original: lhag ma gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: / de ltar las dang po pa yang dag par gtams pa de yang dag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: / de ltar las dang po pa yang dag par gtams pa de yang dag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: Thus, when the beginner who has been properly instructed is practicing correctly,

original: brtun pa dang / shes bzhin dang / dran pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal te gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: brtun pa dang / shes bzhin dang / dran pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal te gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with perseverance, vigilance, and mindfulness, and he lives having eliminated worldly covetousness and depression.

original: de la re zhig sbyor ba de la rgyun du byed pa dang / legs par byed cing yid la byed pa yang dag par thob pa bre mo gtam la sogs pas spyong bar mi byed ba gang yin pa de ni de'i brtun pa yin no //ğŸ”½de'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa'i sbyor ba de la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yongs su shes pa la sems gtod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig sbyor ba de la rgyun du byed pa dang / legs par byed cing yid la byed pa yang dag par thob pa bre mo gtam la sogs pas spyong bar mi byed ba gang yin pa de ni de'i brtun pa yin no // de'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa'i sbyor ba de la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med pa yongs su shes pa la sems gtod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Here, first, his perseverance is that he is engaged in that practice continuously and well, and he does not waste his efforts in idle talk, etc.

original: de'i shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: His vigilance and mindfulness are that he directs his mind to the full understanding of distraction and non-distraction in that practice of serenity and insight.

original: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma legs par rab tu gzung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba yin no //ğŸ”½de ltar brtun pa dang 'jig @163a * //
analyzed: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dang / dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma legs par rab tu gzung ba gang yin pa de ni de'i 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba yin no // de ltar brtun pa dang 'jig @163a * //
translated: The signs of weariness and the signs of enthusiasm are well grasped. This is the elimination of covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in the world.

original: rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba'i bar la gnas pa de'i dang po kho nar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba las brtson pa'i che sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems dang lus las su rung ba 'byung ba ni phra ba ste /
analyzed: rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba'i bar la gnas pa de'i dang po kho nar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba las brtson pa'i che sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems dang lus las su rung ba 'byung ba ni phra ba ste /
translated: Thus, he who is steadfast, up to the elimination of covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in the world, at the very outset, the pliancy of mind and the pliancy of body arise from the exertion of right practice. This is subtle,

original: brtag par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba yin no //
translated: difficult to discern.

original: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa na sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems dang lus las su rung ba gang yin pa de ni lus dang sems shing tu sbyangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa na sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems dang lus las su rung ba gang yin pa de ni lus dang sems shing tu sbyangs pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the pliancy of mind and the pliancy of body are the fitness of mind and body that occur in the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: de ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na /
analyzed: de ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na /
translated: That is the one-pointedness of mind and the pliancy of mind and body.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: When that increases,

original: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de len pa'i tshul gyis rags shing brtag par sla ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de len pa'i tshul gyis rags shing brtag par sla ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa 'dren par byed de /

original: ji tsam na de'i rags shing brtag par sla ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shing tu sbyangs pa yang ring por mi thogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'i lnga ltas su de'i sra ba lci bar snang ba skye bar 'gyur te /ğŸ”½de yang gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam na de'i rags shing brtag par sla ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang lus shing tu sbyangs pa yang ring por mi thogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'i lnga ltas su de'i sra ba lci bar snang ba skye bar 'gyur te /ğŸ”½de yang gnod pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: When that happens, the signs of the arising of the coarse and easy-to-recognize one-pointedness of mind and the pliancy of mind and body are that the meditator experiences a sense of solidity and heaviness that is not harmful.

original: de skyes ma thag tu sbyong ba la dga' ba'i bar chad byed pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phyogs su gyur pa sems kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur zhing de'i gnyen po sems las su rung ba dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de skyes pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang mthun pa /
analyzed: de skyes ma thag tu sbyong ba la dga' ba'i bar chad byed pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phyogs su gyur pa sems kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur zhing de'i gnyen po sems las su rung ba dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro // de skyes pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa skye ba dang mthun pa /
translated: As soon as it arises, it eliminates the negative tendencies of the mind that are the side of the afflictions that obstruct the delight in purification, and it gives rise to the antidote, mental fitness.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rlung dag lus la rgyu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rlung dag lus la rgyu bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that arises, the great elementsâ€™ winds that circulate in the body are conducive to the arising of physical fitness.

original: de dag kyang rgyu ba'i rgyus na spyong ba la dga' ba'i bar chad byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gyur pa lus kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de dang 'bral bar 'gyur zhing /

translated: Since they circulate, they eliminate the negative tendencies of the body that are the side of the afflictions that obstruct the delight in purification.

original: de'i gnyen po lus shing tu sbyangs pas lus thams cad rgyas te gang ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po lus shing tu sbyangs pas lus thams cad rgyas te gang ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The antidote to that, physical fitness, appears as if it fills and pervades the entire body.

original: dang por de skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe na sems dga' ba dang / sems shin tu nyams pa de ba dang ; sems mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa la dmigs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang por de skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe na sems dga' ba dang / sems shin tu nyams pa de ba dang ; sems mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa la dmigs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it first arises, at that time there is mental joy, mental pliancy, mental delight, and the appearance of mental satisfaction.

original: de'i 'og tu shin tu sbyangs pa'i shugs dang po skyes pa gang yin ba de khad kyis khad kyis shin tu phra bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shin tu sbyangs pa'i shugs dang po skyes pa gang yin ba de khad kyis khad kyis shin tu phra bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: After that, the force of the first arising of pliancy gradually becomes more subtle.

original: lus la shin tu sbyangs pa grib ma lta bu dang ldan par @163b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la shin tu sbyangs pa grib ma lta bu dang ldan par @163b 'gyur ro //

original: sems dga' ba gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems dga' ba gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: sems zhi gnas kyis nye bar brtan zhing rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pas dmigs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor ba las dang po ba de yid la byed pa dang bcas pa yin te /

analyzed: des na yid la byed pa dang bcad pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: des gzugs na spyod pa'i sems chud du thob pa dang / lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa chung du thob pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa la sbyor ba'i skal pa yod cing nus pa dang /

analyzed: gal te chags par 'gyur ba'i yul la spyod par gyur kyang /

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa drag po skye bar mi 'gyur zhing / gnyen po chung zad tsam dang ngan ngon tsam la brten cing cung zad brtsal ba tsam gyis sel nus par 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba dang / khengs par 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa dang /

analyzed: de nang du yang dag 'jog la 'dug ste /
