analyzed: yid la byed pa de nyid la lan mang du byed do //
translated: frequently practices that attention.

original: ji lta ji ltar lan mang du byed pa de lta de ltar nyin mtshan de dang de dag 'das pas de'i lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de 'phel zhing rgyas ba dang / yang par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lan mang du byed pa de lta de ltar nyin mtshan de dang de dag 'das pas de'i lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de 'phel zhing rgyas ba dang / yang par 'gyur ro /
translated: As he/she frequently practices it, in that and that day and night, his/her physical pliancy and mental one-pointedness increase, expand, and grow.

original: gang gi tshe de'i yid la byed pa dam zhig brtan la sra ba dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa la mos pa 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi mtshan ma rnams kyang yong su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe na de la 'jig rten pa'i lam mam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i yid la byed pa dam zhig brtan la sra ba dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa la mos pa 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs kyi mtshan ma rnams kyang yong su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe na de la 'jig rten pa'i lam mam /
translated: When their attention is firm, stable, and solid, and they are engaged in interest in a completely pure object, and the signs of the aspects of serenity and insight have been fully grasped, at that time, they may either follow the mundane path or the supramundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang gis 'gro bar 'dod pa de la sbyor ba brtson par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang gis 'gro bar 'dod pa de la sbyor ba brtson par byed do //
translated: When their attention is firm, stable, and solid, and when they are engaged in a pure conception of the object, and when they have fully grasped the signs of the factors that contribute to serenity and insight, then they should apply themselves to the practice of whichever path they wish to cultivate, whether the mundane path or the supramundane path.

original: de la gnag dag tshe 'di la 'jig rten pa'i lam kho nas 'gro bar 'gyur zhig 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis ma yin pa'i gang zag du yod ce na /
analyzed: de la gnag dag tshe 'di la 'jig rten pa'i lam kho nas 'gro bar 'gyur zhig 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis ma yin pa'i gang zag du yod ce na /
translated: What are the types of persons who proceed by means of the mundane path in this life and not by means of the supramundane path?

original: smras pa / bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad dang / chos 'di ba yin yang sngon zhi gnas spyod spyod pa dbang bo rtul ba dang / de bzhin du dbang po rno yang dge ba'i rtsa pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / byang chub sems dba' phyi ma la byang chub thob par 'dod cing tshe 'di la ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad dang / chos 'di ba yin yang sngon zhi gnas spyod spyod pa dbang bo rtul ba dang / de bzhin du dbang po rno yang dge ba'i rtsa pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / byang chub sems dba' phyi ma la byang chub thob par 'dod cing tshe 'di la ma yin pa ste /
translated: and bodhisattvas who desire to attain enlightenment in the future, not in this life.

original: gang zag de bzhin ni tshe 'di nyid la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de bzhin ni tshe 'di nyid la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: These persons proceed by the mundane path in this very life.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa 'gro ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa 'gro ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That proceeding by the mundane path is of two kinds:ğŸ”½those who have all the bonds, namely, ordinary beings,

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'ching ba mtshang ba'i slob @164b ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'ching ba mtshang ba'i slob @164b ma rnams so //
translated: and those who have destroyed the bonds, namely, the learners.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'dod pa rnams la rags par lta zhing snyom par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po la zhi bar lta bar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la rags par lta zhing snyom par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang po la zhi bar lta bar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral par bya ba dang /
translated: It is the desire to go beyond desire in the same way up to the sphere of nothingness.ğŸ”½It is the desire to enter into the attainment of the non-perceptive meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par sgrub par byed pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par sgrub par byed pa rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the desire to actualize the five superknowledges by relying on the meditations.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: The yogi who strives to go beyond desire by means of seven mental orientations attains the going beyond of desire.

original: bdun po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are these seven?

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid so so rig pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / spyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid so so rig pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / spyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
translated: He said: The mental attention of the discernment of the characteristics, the mental attention arisen from belief, the mental attention of isolation, the mental attention of the unification of joy, the mental attention of practice, and the mental attention of the result of the culmination of practice.

original: de la mtshan nyid du so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid du so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mental attention of the discernment of the characteristics?

original: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed cing /
analyzed: smras pa / yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed cing /
translated: He said: The mental attention by which one discerns the characteristics of the grossness of the sense-pleasures,

original: bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed pa'o //
translated: and the characteristics of the calmness of the first absorption.

original: ji ltar na 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed ce na /
translated: How does one discern the characteristics of the grossness of the sense-pleasures?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyi gzhi drug po don dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol ba na rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyi gzhi drug po don dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / rigs pa yongs su tshol ba na rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed de /
translated: He said: When one investigates the six bases of the sense-pleasures, namely, the object, the characteristic, the direction, the time, and the reasoning, one discerns the characteristics of the grossness.

original: de la re zhig rags pa'i don yongs su tshol ba ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig rags pa'i don yongs su tshol ba ni /
translated: First, the investigation of the gross meaning is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa 'di dag ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa 'di dag ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: â€œThese desires are full of misfortune,

original: gnod pa mang ba'o //ğŸ”½yams kyi nad lta bu mang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa mang ba'o // yams kyi nad lta bu mang ba'o //
translated: full of harm,ğŸ”½full of disease,ğŸ”½full of tumors.

original: 'go ba'i nad lta bu mang ba'o zhes /
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad lta bu mang ba'o zhes /
translated: and many are like contagious diseases.ğŸ”½

original: rags pa'i don yongs su tshol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rags pa'i don yongs su tshol bar byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, one investigates the gross meaning.

original: 'dod pa de dag la nyes dmigs mang po dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bu mang po'i bar dag yod pa gang yin pa de dag ni rags pa'i don yin no //ğŸ”½de la dngos po yongs su tshol ba ni nang gi 'dod pa dag la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa dag la yang 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod do zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag la nyes dmigs mang po dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bu mang po'i bar dag yod pa gang yin pa de dag ni rags pa'i don yin no // de la dngos po yongs su tshol ba ni nang gi 'dod pa dag la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa dag la yang 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod do zhes yongs su tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The gross meaning is that these desires are full of misfortune, up to being full of tumors.ğŸ”½The investigation of the thing is the investigation of the desire for internal things and the desire for external things.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol @165a * //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol @165a * //
translated: The investigation of the specific characteristic is the investigation of the desire for defilement and the desire for things.

original: ba ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: â€œThese are the desires for defilement.

original: 'di dag ni dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: These are the desires for things.

original: de dag gyang bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang mthun pa dag dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /ğŸ”½da de ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ste ;
analyzed: de dag gyang bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dag dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang mthun pa dag dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin / da de ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ste ;
translated: They are favorable to the abode of pleasure, favorable to the abode of suffering, and favorable to the abode that is neither pleasurable nor suffering.

original: de la bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnas dang / 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin no //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang mthun pa dag ni /ğŸ”½zhes sdang gi gnas dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa'i gnas dag yin no //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnas dang / 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin no // sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang mthun pa dag ni / zhes sdang gi gnas dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa'i gnas dag yin no //
translated: The abode that is favorable to pleasure is the abode of attachment to pleasure, the abode of the perversion of ideation, and the abode of the perversion of thought.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin /ğŸ”½bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin / bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag ni /
translated: The abode that is favorable to suffering is the abode of hatred, the abode of anger and resentment, and the abode of envy and selfishness.

original: 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'i gnas dang / lta ba phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin te /
analyzed: 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'i gnas dang / lta ba phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin te /
translated: The abode that is favorable to neither pleasure nor suffering is the abode of concealment, hypocrisy, deceit, craft, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, and the perversion of view.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa'i dag ni rab tu gnod pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa dang / rab tu gnod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i dag ni rab tu gnod pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa dang / rab tu gnod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he investigates the specific characteristics of the sense-desires: â€œThe sense-desires are associated with painful feelings and with painful afflictions.â€

original: de la ji ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he investigate their general characteristics?

original: 'dod pa 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bar dang / mnyam zhing mtshungs par rjes su 'brel zhing gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bar dang / mnyam zhing mtshungs par rjes su 'brel zhing gnas pa yin te /
translated: â€œAll these sense-desires are associated with the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of association with what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, and the suffering of seeking the unattained.

original: gang dag 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i /
translated: Those who enjoy the sense-desires

original: 'dod pa'i 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa de dag kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid las rnam par ma grol bas de dag gi 'byor ba de yang brnyan ma yin no zhes de ltar 'dod pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa de dag kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid las rnam par ma grol bas de dag gi 'byor ba de yang brnyan ma yin no zhes de ltar 'dod pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su tshol bar byed
translated: In this way, they thoroughly investigate the general characteristics of desire.

original: do // ji ltar na phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: do // ji ltar na phyogs yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How do they thoroughly investigate the categories?

original: 'dod pa 'di dag ni rang po'i phyogs kho nar gtogs pa te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di dag ni rang po'i phyogs kho nar gtogs pa te /
translated: They think, â€œThese desires belong only to the category of the beginningless past.

original: rus pa'i keng rus lta bu dang / sha'i khams tshad lta bu dang / rtsva'i sgron ma lta bu dang / me mdag gi dong lta bu dang / sbrul gdug pa lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brnyan po'i rgyan lta bu dang /
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus lta bu dang / sha'i khams tshad lta bu dang / rtsva'i sgron ma lta bu dang / me mdag gi dong lta bu dang / sbrul gdug pa lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / brnyan po'i rgyan lta bu dang /
translated: They are like a skeleton, like a lump of flesh, like a grass torch, like a pit of embers, like a poisonous snake, like a dream, like a borrowed ornament,

original: shing ki ma pa ka'i 'bras bu lta bu yin te /
analyzed: shing ki ma pa ka'i 'bras bu lta bu yin te /
translated: like the fruit of the kimpaka tree,

original: sems can rnams 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa na yang 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal du ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / @165b kun du bsrung ba las byung ba dang / mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa na yang 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal du ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / @165b kun du bsrung ba las byung ba dang / mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba dang /
translated: When sentient beings seek out their desires, they experience many sufferings that arise from seeking out desires, from protecting what they have obtained, from the loss of what they love,

original: ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang / nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang / nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: from insatiable craving, from being out of control, and from their misdeeds.

original: de dag thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: All of these should be understood as explained above.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de ltar 'dod pa la brten pa'i nyes dmigs lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de ltar 'dod pa la brten pa'i nyes dmigs lnga gsungs te /
translated: The Lord also taught five dangers that arise from attachment to desire:

original: 'dod pa rnams ni mnog chung la sdug bsngal mang zhing nyes dmigs mang ba dang / 'dod pa rnam la brten pa na ngom mi myong /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni mnog chung la sdug bsngal mang zhing nyes dmigs mang ba dang / 'dod pa rnam la brten pa na ngom mi myong /
translated: â€œDesires are of little enjoyment, much suffering, and much danger. When one relies on desires, one is never satisfied.

original: chog mi shes shing snying tshim pa'i mtha' med pa dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis 'dod ba rnams rnam grangs du mas smad pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la brten pa na kun du sbyor ba rnams nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chog mi shes shing snying tshim pa'i mtha' med pa dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis 'dod ba rnams rnam grangs du mas smad pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la brten pa na kun du sbyor ba rnams nye bar stsogs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: When one relies on desires, the fetters increase.

original: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi bya ba cung zad kyang med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi bya ba cung zad kyang med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is not a single nonvirtuous thing that they will not do.â€

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa de dag ni mi ngoms par byed pa dang / mang po thu mong yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / spyod pa ngan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sred pa 'phel bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa de dag ni mi ngoms par byed pa dang / mang po thu mong yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / spyod pa ngan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sred pa 'phel bar byed pa dang /
translated: Thus desires are insatiable, they are shared by many, they are the cause of non-Dharma and bad conduct, they increase desire and craving,

original: dam ba rnams kyis spangs pa'i 'os su gyur pa dang / myur du 'jig par gyur pa dang / rkyen la brten pa dang / bag med pa'i sa yin te /
analyzed: dam ba rnams kyis spangs pa'i 'os su gyur pa dang / myur du 'jig par gyur pa dang / rkyen la brten pa dang / bag med pa'i sa yin te /
translated: they are worthy of being abandoned by the holy ones, they quickly perish, they are dependent on conditions, and they are the basis of heedlessness.

original: mi rtag pa dang / gsog dang / gsog dang / brdzun pa dang / sla ba'i chos can dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / byis pa 'drid pa yin pas tshe 'di'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / gsog dang / gsog dang / brdzun pa dang / sla ba'i chos can dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / byis pa 'drid pa yin pas tshe 'di'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang /
translated: The desires of this life, the desires of the next life,

original: lha'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang / mi'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdud kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa dang / mi'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdud kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: the desires of the gods, and the desires of humans are the domain of MÄra.

original: de dag ni bdud kyi gzan ma ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bdud kyi gzan ma ste /
translated: They are the bait of MÄra.

original: de dag la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are like this:

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / nyes rtsom dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams rnam pa du ma dag 'byung zhing 'phags pa nyan thos gang dag 'di la slob pa de dag gi bar chad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / nyes rtsom dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams rnam pa du ma dag 'byung zhing 'phags pa nyan thos gang dag 'di la slob pa de dag gi bar chad byed pa yin te /
translated: Covetousness, ill will, and wrong views are the many kinds of sinful, unwholesome actions that arise and create obstacles for the noble disciples who train in this.

original: 'dod pa 'di dag ni shas cher de ltar rnam grangs du mar nag po'i phyogs kho nar gtogs pa yin no zhes de ltar phyogs su yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di dag ni shas cher de ltar rnam grangs du mar nag po'i phyogs kho nar gtogs pa yin no zhes de ltar phyogs su yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He seeks out the categories of these desires, which are mostly included in the dark side.

original: ji ltar na dus yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dus yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he seek out time?

original: 'dod pa de dag ni @166a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ni @166a * //
translated: He seeks out the time of these desires,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su de ltar gnod pa mang ba dang / 'og ba'i nad lta bu'i bar mang ba dang / nyes dmigs mang ba yin no zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su de ltar gnod pa mang ba dang / 'og ba'i nad lta bu'i bar mang ba dang / nyes dmigs mang ba yin no zhes de ltar dus yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: which are always, always, at all times, and forever, full of many dangers, up to and including the diseases of leprosy and tuberculosis, and full of many faults.

original: ji ltar na rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he seek out reason?

original: 'dod pa rnams ni brtsal ba chen po dang / yongs su brtsal ba chen po dang / ngal ba chen po dang / las dang bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sdud par byed /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni brtsal ba chen po dang / yongs su brtsal ba chen po dang / ngal ba chen po dang / las dang bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sdud par byed /
translated: He seeks out the reason that these desires are accumulated through great effort, great exertion, great fatigue, and through various kinds of work and crafts.

original: sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: sgrub par byed cing /
translated: accumulate.

original: nye bar stsogs par byed pa de dag legs par bsdus /
analyzed: nye bar stsogs par byed pa de dag legs par bsdus /
translated: Having well gathered,

original: legs par bsgrubs /
analyzed: legs par bsgrubs /
translated: well accomplished,

original: nye bar bsags nas kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsags nas kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: and well accumulated those,

original: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las mi dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyi phyi rol gyi yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po rnams dang /
analyzed: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las mi dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyi phyi rol gyi yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po rnams dang /
translated: they give to their parents, children, wives, male and female servants, workers, staff, friends, ministers, relatives, and family members external things that are owned,

original: nang gi lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba 'bras chan dang / zan dron gyis nye bar gsos pa rtag tu bsku ba dang / bkru ba dang / mnye bas nye bar brten pa dang / 'bral ba dang / 'thor ba dang /
analyzed: nang gi lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba 'bras chan dang / zan dron gyis nye bar gsos pa rtag tu bsku ba dang / bkru ba dang / mnye bas nye bar brten pa dang / 'bral ba dang / 'thor ba dang /
translated: and to their internal bodies, which are coarse physical things that arise from the causes of the great elements, and which are nourished by rice and barley, and which are supported by constant anointings, washings, and massages, and which are subject to separation, scattering,ğŸ”½and destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can 'di byung ngo cog ni sdug bsngal sel ba tsam du 'gyur ba ma zad /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can 'di byung ngo cog ni sdug bsngal sel ba tsam du 'gyur ba ma zad /
translated: â€œNot only do they become mere removers of suffering,

original: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni kha zas yin no //
analyzed: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni kha zas yin no //
translated: Food is what removes the suffering of hunger.

original: grang ba'i sdug bsngal sel ba dang / ngo tsha ba'i gnas pa car gyis g-yogs pa ni gos yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i sdug bsngal sel ba dang / ngo tsha ba'i gnas pa car gyis g-yogs pa ni gos yin no //
translated: Clothing is what removes the suffering of cold and what covers the private parts.

original: gnyid kyi snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba dang / chags pa dang / sdod pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni mal cha dang stan yin no //
analyzed: gnyid kyi snyoms pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba dang / chags pa dang / sdod pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni mal cha dang stan yin no //
translated: Beds and seats are what remove the suffering of exhaustion from sleep and the suffering of attachment to and dependence on the ground.

original: nad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba ni na ba'i gsos sman yin te /
analyzed: nad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba ni na ba'i gsos sman yin te /
translated: Medicine is what removes the suffering of illness.

original: de ltar 'dod pa 'di dag ni sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa tsam du zad bas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa 'di dag ni sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa tsam du zad bas /
translated: Thus, since these desired objects merely remove suffering,

original: 'di dag la chags pas yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing zhen pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la chags pas yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing zhen pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: you should not enjoy them with attachment or with craving.

original: nad kyis btab pa'i nad pas nad zhi bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir sman pa bsten pa lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: nad kyis btab pa'i nad pas nad zhi bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir sman pa bsten pa lta bu yin pas /
translated: You should be like a patient who relies on a doctor merely to cure an illness.

original: yid ches pa'i lung yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung yang de nyid yin la /
translated: This is also a trustworthy scripture.

original: 'dod pa de dag ji lta ji ltar rags ba yin pa de lta de ltar bdag nyid pa ye shes dang / mthong ba la 'jug pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ji lta ji ltar rags ba yin pa de lta de ltar bdag nyid pa ye shes dang / mthong ba la 'jug pa yang yod /
translated: The more gross these desires are, the more they are the object of the knowledge and vision of the self.

original: rjes su dpag ba'i bya ba yang de nyid yin @166b te ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag ba'i bya ba yang de nyid yin @166b te ;
translated: This is also the object of inference.

original: 'dod pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i chos nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa'i chos nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid yin pas /
translated: The nature of these desires is the reality that has been known since beginningless time and the inconceivable reality.

original: de dag ni bsam par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni bsam par mi bya zhing /
translated: They should not be reflected upon.ğŸ”½They should not be imagined.

original: rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes de ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes de ltar rigs pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this way, he seeks the reason.

original: des 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des 'di lta ste /
translated: He thinks:

original: gzhi drug po dag gis de ltar 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtogs pa nas bsam gtan dang po la zhi pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhi drug po dag gis de ltar 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtogs pa nas bsam gtan dang po la zhi pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: In this way, he understands the characteristics of the desires as gross through the six bases, and he understands the characteristics of the first concentration as peaceful.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rags pa gang yin pa de lta bu rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas med do zhes /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rags pa gang yin pa de lta bu rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas med do zhes /
translated: In the first absorption, there is no coarseness of the desire realm in any way.

original: des bsam gtan dang po ni rigs pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no zhes de ltar bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do /ğŸ”½mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: des bsam gtan dang po ni rigs pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no zhes de ltar bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed pa de ni /
translated: Thus, he discriminates the first absorption as having the characteristic of peace, since it is free from the coarseness of the desire realm.

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attention of the stage of meditative equipoise by which one discriminates the desire realm as having the characteristic of coarseness and the first absorption as having the characteristic of peace is called attention that discerns the characteristics of coarseness and peace.

original: yid la byed pa de yang thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / 'dres pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de yang thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / 'dres pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This attention should be understood as being of three types: that derived from hearing, that derived from reflection and that derived from a combination of the two.

original: des de ltar 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes nas bsam gtan dang po la yongs su tshol ba dang / rags pa'i zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyis thos pa dang bsam pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: des de ltar 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes nas bsam gtan dang po la yongs su tshol ba dang / rags pa'i zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyis thos pa dang bsam pa las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: Having understood desire in this way, he thoroughly investigates the first meditative concentration and, having transcended the hearing and reflection that are characterized by the grossness of desire,

original: gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing /
analyzed: gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing /
translated: he becomes devoted to it through the aspect of meditative development alone.

original: mtshan ma de nyid la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates serenity and insight that have that very sign as their object.

original: sgom par byed pa la ji ltar yongs su tshol ba dang / rags pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang dang yang du zhi bar byed de /
analyzed: sgom par byed pa la ji ltar yongs su tshol ba dang / rags pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang dang yang du zhi bar byed de /
translated: In cultivating it, he repeatedly pacifies the thorough investigation and the grossness of desire that is characterized by the grossness of desire and the serenity of the first meditative concentration.

original: de ni mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de kun du bsten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: de ni mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // de kun du bsten cing goms par byas /
translated: This is called the â€œmental attention that is born of devotion.â€

original: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dang po kho nar nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dang po kho nar nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the cause of repeatedly cultivating and frequently practicing that, the path that abandons the afflictions arises for the first time.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam yang dag par skyes pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de ni rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam yang dag par skyes pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de ni rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention that is endowed with the correct generation of the path for abandoning the afflictions is called â€œattention that is secluded.â€ğŸ”½Through that, one first abandons the afflictions of the desire realm and becomes free from the negative tendencies of that realm.

original: des dang po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des dang po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: After that, one delights in abandonment and delights in seclusion.

original: @167a * // spong ba de la phan yon du mthong ba dang / rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chung ngu la reg nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @167a * // spong ba de la phan yon du mthong ba dang / rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chung ngu la reg nas 'di lta ste /
translated: One sees the benefits of that abandonment and experiences the joy and pleasure that arise from seclusion.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa spang ba'i phyir dang / dus dus su rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa spang ba'i phyir dang / dus dus su rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed cing /
translated: In order to abandon dullness, sleep, and excitement, one delights in that abandonment with attention that is clear and pure from time to time.

original: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas kun du sbyor bar byed pa de ni dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de ltar spong ba'i dga' ba dang / sgom pa'i dga' ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa na rgyu'am gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas kun du sbyor bar byed pa de ni dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // de ltar spong ba'i dga' ba dang / sgom pa'i dga' ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa na rgyu'am gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: The attention that is applied by the mind that is completely discouraged is called the attention that is the contraction of delight.

original: de la dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la /
translated: When one is correctly and thoroughly engaged in the delight of renunciation and the delight of cultivation, then whether it is a cause or a condition,

original: bgegs byed par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: bgegs byed par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba na /
translated: the afflictions that are the entanglements that wish to obstruct the practice of the side of virtue do not arise.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then one thinks,

original: ci bdag la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod bzhin du mi myong ngam /
analyzed: ci bdag la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yod bzhin du mi myong ngam /
translated: â€œIs it that I do not experience the desire for the objects of desire because I have no desire for them?ğŸ”½Or is it that I do not experience them individually because I have no desire for them?â€

original: 'on te med pas so sor mi myong snyam du sems shing de yongs su dpyod par 'dod pas rab tu dad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma stu gu gang yang rung ba yid la byed de /
analyzed: 'on te med pas so sor mi myong snyam du sems shing de yongs su dpyod par 'dod pas rab tu dad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma stu gu gang yang rung ba yid la byed de /
translated: With the wish to investigate this, one attends to any sign that is conducive to faith.

original: de'i pag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du ma spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma de yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: de'i pag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du ma spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma de yid la byed pa na /
translated: Because he has not completely abandoned all latent propensities for those signs,ğŸ”½when he attends to those signs,

original: bsten pa la gzhol ba dang / bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: bsten pa la gzhol ba dang / bsten pa la 'bab pa dang / bsten pa la bab pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur zhing ;
translated: his mind becomes engaged in attending to them, descends toward them, and settles on them.

original: btang snyoms su mi gnas la yid 'byung ba dang / smon pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang / mi mthun pa gnas na /
analyzed: btang snyoms su mi gnas la yid 'byung ba dang / smon pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang / mi mthun pa gnas na /
translated: If he does not remain in a state of equanimity, but instead experiences aversion, wishes to escape, turns away, and is discontent,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /ğŸ”½bdag gi sems ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / bdag gi sems ni 'di lta ste /
translated: he thinks to himself,ğŸ”½â€œMy mind is not free from attachment to the objects of desire.

original: 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: It is not liberated.â€

original: des bag la nyal de'i lhag ma ma lus par rgya cher spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des bag la nyal de'i lhag ma ma lus par rgya cher spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has not completely abandoned all latent propensities for those signs,

original: bdag gis sems mngon par 'du byed pas /
analyzed: bdag gis sems mngon par 'du byed pas /
translated: he must apply himself to

original: mngon par zin pa dang / chu bzhin du bcus pa dang / chos nyid kyis mngon par zin pa des spong ba la dga' ba dang / bsgom pa la dga' ba rgya cher gnas par bya'o snyam pa de ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zin pa dang / chu bzhin du bcus pa dang / chos nyid kyis mngon par zin pa des spong ba la dga' ba dang / bsgom pa la dga' ba rgya cher gnas par bya'o snyam pa de ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and by the power of the Dharma itself, he should delight in abandoning and delight in cultivating.

original: de de ltar spang ba la dga' ba dang / sgom pa la dga' bar rgya cher gnas shing zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu brtson par byed pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar spang ba la dga' ba dang / sgom pa la dga' bar rgya cher gnas shing zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu brtson par byed pa na /
translated: When he thus delights in abandoning and delights in cultivating, and when he is striving to cultivate serenity and insight,

original: yang dang yang du dpyod par byed cing de'i gnyen po sgom par byed de /
analyzed: yang dang yang du dpyod par byed cing de'i gnyen po sgom par byed de /
translated: he should repeatedly investigate and cultivate their antidotes.

original: dus dus su @167b spangs ba dang / ma spangs pa nyid la dpyod par byed pa na /
analyzed: dus dus su @167b spangs ba dang / ma spangs pa nyid la dpyod par byed pa na /
translated: When he investigates from time to time whether or not he has abandoned the afflictions,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las re zhig tsam gyi tshul gyis sems 'bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las re zhig tsam gyi tshul gyis sems 'bral bar byed cing /
translated: he will temporarily free his mind from all the afflictions of the desire realm,

original: sa bon gtan bcom pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gtan bcom pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but he has not yet utterly destroyed their seeds.

original: de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i lam gyi mthar thug pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i yid la byed pa yang dag par skyes pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i lam gyi mthar thug pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i yid la byed pa yang dag par skyes pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the mental attention that is the antidote to all the afflictions, which arises at the very end of the path of preparation for the first concentration, is called â€œmental attention at the end of the process of preparation.â€

original: de'i mjug thogs kho nar rgyu de dang rkyen des bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug cing bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa skyes pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs kho nar rgyu de dang rkyen des bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi la snyoms par 'jug cing bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa skyes pa de ni /
translated: Immediately after that, by that cause and those conditions, one enters into the actual first concentration, and the mental attention that is associated with the actual first concentration arises.

original: sbyor pa mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor pa mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called â€œmental attention that is the result of the end of the process of preparation.â€

original: de la rab tu dben pa yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa yid la byed pa skyes bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas lus yongs su tshim par byed do //
analyzed: de la rab tu dben pa yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa yid la byed pa skyes bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas lus yongs su tshim par byed do //
translated: When the mental attention that is seclusion and the mental attention that is the gathering of joy have arisen, at that time, the joy and pleasure that arise from seclusion completely satisfy the body.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: At the time of the mental attention that is the end of the process of preparation,

original: lan 'ga' lan 'ga' ni bde ba'i dngos po chung ngu'i tshul gyis khyab par byed do //
analyzed: lan 'ga' lan 'ga' ni bde ba'i dngos po chung ngu'i tshul gyis khyab par byed do //
translated: Sometimes, it pervades in the manner of a small amount of pleasure.

original: lan 'ga' lan 'ga' ni bde ba'i dngos po shin tu mang po dang / shin tu rgya chen po'i tshul gyis khyab par byed do //
analyzed: lan 'ga' lan 'ga' ni bde ba'i dngos po shin tu mang po dang / shin tu rgya chen po'i tshul gyis khyab par byed do //
translated: Sometimes, it pervades in the manner of a very large amount of pleasure.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa skyes pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa skyes pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: When the mental attention of the fruit of the culmination of practice arises,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: lus thams cad dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas ma khyab pa dang / khyab par bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: lus thams cad dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas ma khyab pa dang / khyab par bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest bit of the body that is not pervaded by the pleasure and well-being born of seclusion.

original: de de'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dben pa /ğŸ”½rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de de'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: At that time, he is secluded from the sins and non-virtues that are secluded from the desires,ğŸ”½he has thoughts,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: he has analysis,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: he has the pleasure and well-being born of seclusion,ğŸ”½and he has the first concentration with five factors.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag lnga bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po'i lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag lnga bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po'i lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He abides in the accomplishment of the five limbs of the first meditation, in the fruit of the path of the antidote in the realm of desire, and in the attainment of freedom from passion for the realm of desire.

original: de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pas ni spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de yang /ğŸ”½yongs su shes bar byed /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pas ni spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de yang / yongs su shes bar byed /
translated: By the attention of the discernment of characteristics, he knows what is to be abandoned.

original: thob par bya ba gang yin pa de yongs su shes par byed cing /
analyzed: thob par bya ba gang yin pa de yongs su shes par byed cing /
translated: He knows what is to be attained.

original: spang bar bya ba spang ba dang / thob par bya ba thob par bya ba'i phyir sems gtod par yang byed do //ğŸ”½mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed @168a * //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba spang ba dang / thob par bya ba thob par bya ba'i phyir sems gtod par yang byed do // mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed @168a * //
translated: He directs his mind to the abandonment of what is to be abandoned and to the attainment of what is to be attained.

original: pas ni spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par sbyor ba rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: pas ni spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par sbyor ba rtsom par byed do //
translated: By the attention born of aspiration, he begins the correct application for the sake of abandoning and attaining.

original: rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa chen po spong bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa chen po spong bar byed do //
translated: By the attention of isolation, he abandons the great afflictions.

original: dga' ba sdud ba'i yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po spong bar byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba sdud ba'i yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po spong bar byed do //
translated: The mental attention of collecting joy eliminates the middling degree of the aspects of the afflictions.

original: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas ni /
translated: The mental attention of investigation

original: thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la sems 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la sems 'jog par byed do //
translated: places the mind in the absence of the pride of attainment.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pas ni /
translated: The mental attention of the culmination of practice

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung du spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung du spong bar byed do //
translated: eliminates the lesser degree of the aspects of the afflictions.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pas ni /
translated: The mental attention of the result of the culmination of practice

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa de dag bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa de dag bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: experiences the result of cultivating those aspects of mental attention.

original: gzhan yang mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the mental attention that discerns characteristics and the mental attention that arises from belief are associated with the antidote of repudiation.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the mental attention of conformity.

original: rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la gang yin pa de ni spong ba'i gnyen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la gang yin pa de ni spong ba'i gnyen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The attentiveness of complete withdrawal and the attentiveness of the culmination of practice are associated with the antidote of elimination.

original: gnyen po yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: These are the attentiveness to the antidote.

original: de la dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de la dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The attentiveness of delight and gathering is

original: gnyen po yid la byed pa dang / dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yid la byed pa dang / dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: the attentiveness to the antidote and the attentiveness of delight.

original: de la spyod pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The attentiveness of practice is

original: so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the attentiveness of thorough analysis.

original: de ltar na yid la byed pa drug po de dag du ni /
analyzed: de ltar na yid la byed pa drug po de dag du ni /
translated: Thus, these six types of attentiveness

original: yid la byed pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: are included in the four types of attentiveness.

original: rjes su mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / dang bar 'gyur ba dang / so sor rtog pa dag 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / dang bar 'gyur ba dang / so sor rtog pa dag 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four types of attentiveness are the attentiveness of suitability, the attentiveness to the antidote, the attentiveness of delight, and the attentiveness of thorough analysis.

original: ji ltar yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one enters meditative concentration on the first meditative concentration through seven types of attentiveness,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa yang yid la byed pa bdun gyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa yang yid la byed pa bdun gyis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the second, third, and fourth concentrations, and for the meditative attainments of the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothing whatsoever, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to enter the second concentration,

original: gang gis rtog pa dag la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gis rtog pa dag la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed cing /
translated: one should discern the characteristics of investigation and analysis as coarse,

original: rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed pa de ni /
translated: and discern the characteristics of the absence of investigation and analysis of the second concentration as peaceful.

original: @168b mtshan nyid du so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de la bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: @168b mtshan nyid du so sor rtog pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // de la bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: This is called the attention that discerns the characteristics.ğŸ”½One who has entered the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan dang po thob pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po thob pa /
translated: who has attained the first concentration,

original: rtog pa dag la rags par lta zhing mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa dang po skyes pas /ğŸ”½dmigs pa yid la rjod pa rags pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dag la rags par lta zhing mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa dang po skyes pas / dmigs pa yid la rjod pa rags pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is the gross discursiveness of the realm of contemplation, which is unstable in its object.ğŸ”½Discursiveness is the gross mental expression that occurs in the unstable contemplation of the object.

original: dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa de dang 'brel ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i yid la rjod pa shin tu phra ba gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa de dang 'brel ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i yid la rjod pa shin tu phra ba gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the subtle mental expression that accompanies the unstable contemplation of the object.

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa de dag kyang sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa de dag kyang sems las byung ba ste /
translated: Discursiveness and discursive investigation are mental activities.

original: sems skyes na skye bar 'gyur zhing lhan cig 'byung ba na mtshungs par ldan pa dus gcig tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sems skyes na skye bar 'gyur zhing lhan cig 'byung ba na mtshungs par ldan pa dus gcig tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: When the mind arises, they arise and, when they occur simultaneously, they are associated.

original: de ltar na de dag ni nang nas skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi skye mched du rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni nang nas skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi skye mched du rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are the internal and external sense bases.

original: de dag thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang /
translated: All of them are in the past, present, and future.

original: rgyu las byung brten cing 'bral par 'byung ba byung nas 'jig pa kun mi ring ba /
analyzed: rgyu las byung brten cing 'bral par 'byung ba byung nas 'jig pa kun mi ring ba /
translated: They arise from causes, are dependent, and are separated.

original: yun ring du mi gnas pa /
analyzed: yun ring du mi gnas pa /
translated: They do not last long.

original: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa /
analyzed: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa /
translated: They disturb the mind.

original: g-yo bar byed pa /
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa /
translated: They move.

original: rab tu ma zhi ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They engage in a form that is not at peace.
